story:
Spooky Basement: Welcome to Monsteropolis

It is said that on Halloween the boundary between the living and the dead is at its thinnest. What better time to revive a dead book series?

Welcome to Monsteropolis will be the first book of the Spooky Basement series, an immature horror/comedy anthology I tried to Kickstart this past summer. The series of twelve books didn't reach its goal, which only proves that Kickstarter is bad luck.

Below is the synopsis of Welcome to Monsteropolis, and you can also find sample chapters at the bottom of the page. They've been revised since Kickstarter, and Chapter Six is entirely reworked, so check them out even if you're a veteran. The only real difference is I've cut back the language to a PG-13 level to broaden the audience; violence is still at a hard "R movie for twelve-year-olds" level.

Synopsis:

When Baron and his best friend/guitar Garindax get sucked into a portal while attending a birthday party, they are transported to the kingdom of creeps known as "Monsteropolis." There, they tear apart a haunted hotel, race hoverboards across graveyards, and fight in a gladiator match against the one and only Boogeyman. Will the duo be able to battle their way back to Earth in time to kill some cake, or will they rot forever under Monsteropolis' black-lit sun?

The Impact

I have no idea. It should at least get you pumped. If it makes you contemplate your own mortality or volunteer at a chimp rescue habitat or something, then that's all good, too. I think 1990's The Willies said it best with the tagline, "You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll puke, you'll die."

Risks & Challenges

There aren't any. If this campaign is funded, and unless the world explodes or something, Welcome to Monsteropolis will get written and self-published (electronically) with the target date of summer 2015.

What the Money Is for

I've had a lot of fun writing this book so far, and I'm going to continue writing it whenever I have free time. This campaign is really to confirm public interest in a way that will make me share the product when it's done rather than keep it to myself. It will also make me dedicate time out of each day to get it finished sooner, cover self-publishing costs, and buy beer for my cover artist.

Sample Chapters

story:
My name is Rachael Ikins.

  •  I am an award winning poet and novelist. Last year I attended a writers conference in Ireland at the invitation of one of my publishers. I am also an award winning visual artist.
  • My entire life I 've worked solo, outside the system founding a poetry open mic, critique groups online. 
  • I have managed to have four chapbooks published and my first novel. I d really like to make it with a full length collection and to be able to compete on a higher level. I support myself solely on my arts. I'm really working hard to make that second novel a success and to launch a full length manuscript of poems.
  • I have a chance to return to Ireland to perform in an international poetry festival.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

This is a matching funds situation where the hope is that local Irish owned or arts interested businesses will be willing to match funds with Irish hosts in the festival area. The festival winner gets all expenses paid. The rest of the poets need help. This is why I'm here. The Irish host will pay all accommodations. I will need plane fare and approximately $400 for food and travel while there. Ireland is a country that treats poets and artists very well. I would love for the chance to take advantage of this weeklong residency, reading from collected works in Irish owned businesses and performing at the festival.

  • My favorite perk that has already excited friends and been talked about near and far is " Be careful what you do and say in front of Rachael or you' ll end up in her novel." I think it would be fabulous to actually invite participants to be characters in my novel as a way of saying thanks for your support and help.
  • If I don't reach my goal of enough to travel to Ireland at this time, the funds will go into a concerted home effort of publishing the second novel, finding a publisher or literary agent to do so, and to getting the full length collection out there.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • We hear Robin Williams' voice on an ad on TV. Quoting from a The Dead Poets Society about the importance of poetry. Why does my work matter? Because the world needs poetry. Poets witness and speak for those who cannot and unflinchingly record in a very personal an intimate way the stuff of daily life. Both my artwork and writing are intense and empathetic connections to the greater existence. I have much feedback on the significance of my work in this regard.
  • While I have never attempted a project exactly like this before, I did found a poetry open mic in Hamilton at Sushi Blues restaurant. It endured for 3 years from 2006-2009. It grew to include a blog published by me and a feature. Poets drove from all over to read at Monday Night Poetry at Sushi Blues. In between, I wrote and had published the four chapbooks and first novel.
  • Being in Ireland last December had an enormous impact on me. The chance to study with world famous writers was fabulous. On my own I made connections with local airing writers and artists and am pleased to be appearing soon on a Irish online journal site.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you, too, are a poverty stricken but excellent artist/poet, short on pence but long on passion, pass the word that this poet is going global. Share the excitement in your tweets, FB posts and other social networking tools.

use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Mi nombre es Wilfredo E Beyra, soy medico cubano nacido en 1966 que vive en EUA hace 13 años por refugio político. Aquí me desempeño como técnico cardiovascular y de polisomnografia.
 Soy católico, estuve en la III Semana Social Católica y en el primer encuentro nacional de historia "IGLESIA CATOLICA Y NACIONALIDAD CUBANA"ambos en Cuba en 1997. 
Opositor a la dictadura Castrista desde el año 1994, fundador junto al Dr. Rafael Ibañes del movimiento pro-derechos humanos CARLOS MANUEL DE CESPEDES lo que me costo la represión e intolerancia del régimen hasta el punto de no permitirme ejercer la medicina con la posibilidad de ir 20 años a prisión por unas declaraciones a la CNN cuando la visita de el papa JUAN PABLO II a Cuba en 1998.
Actualmente soy el fundador del movimiento EXILIO CUBANO UNIDO, "ECU" y director de asuntos internacionales de la PLATAFORMA UNITARIA CUBANA.
El objetivo de nuestra campaña es fundar "La UNO", UNION NACIONAL OPOSITORA.Durante los 55 años de dictadura han existido alrededor de 100 organizaciones opositoras dentro de Cuba pero divididas, en estos momentos contamos con mas de 20 movimientos de oposición dispuestos a la Unidad que será definitiva para organizar y dirigir la lucha por la libertad y la democracia.Este gran y trascendental evento de unidad no se puede celebrar en Cuba por la represión del régimen por lo que es necesario invitarlos a venir a Miami. Será uno de los momentos mas importantes en la lucha contra la tiranía de los Castro y el inicio del camino para la libertad.
Necesitamos 20,000 dollares para invitar a 20 representantes de esas organizaciones opositoras dentro de Cuba a razón de $1,000.00 por cada uno que incluye $100.00 de pasaporte,$165.00 de Visas, 450.00de pasajes ida y vuelta, mas alojamiento y alimentación por alrededor de 7 días. La Plataforma Unitaria costeara los gastos de transporte, material de estudios, medicinas y otros gastos.
Será un evento definitivo para la libertad de nuestro sufrido pueblo que padece la falta de derechos fundamentales por mas de 50 años pero que en la unidad de las fuerzas opositoras ve la esperanza a vivir en democracia.
Si no logramos los fondos que necesitamos, el dinero será utilizado en apoyar las fuerzas opositoras a la dictadura Castrista dentro de Cuba.
Ustedes con su contribucion ayudaran a que los opositores dentro de la isla den el paso mas importante para lograr que nuestro pueblo sea libre y el mundo sentirá orgullo de los que hicimos posible este anhelo uniendo a los opositores en su lucha pacifica pero heroica en contra de la mas cruel tiranía de la historia de este hemisferio.
Tal vez hay muchas personas que no puedan hacer donaciones pero que se solidarizan con nuestro justo reclamo por la unidad y la libertad,a ustedes le rogamos nos ayuden a difundir este proyecto.

story:
I would like to reach a wide audience with this work because I know it will help others. I am exploring e-book publishing through Amazon, as well as print copy distribution with the help of Mill City Press, a self-publishing company based in Minneapolis, MN.

My book and guided meditation CD will guide the reader through a journey of self discovery and remembrance of their true self, who they were before this incarnation on Earth. We will explore Heaven as I have come to know it, meet your guides and angels, find your role and gifts that you always have on the Other Side and bring with you to your current life, explore your "Book of Life" in the Living Library to find answers to your questions, and re-write the things that you have chosen for this lifetime that no longer serve your Highest Good.

Funds received will be used to bring this work to the public through e-book publishing on Amazon, print copy distribution via Mill City Press as well as the creation and distribution of the Guided Meditation CD/MP3 Download.

Please consider supporting the publication of this book and Guided Meditation CD. Thank you, from the depth of my soul to yours.

With love and gratitude,
Karen Stensgard

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mark Stavish and I am the founder and Director of Studies of the Institute for Hermetic Studies. Over the last twenty years I have authored hundreds of articles on classical and modern esotericism, from both an academic and practical perspective. In addition, I have authored six books on alchemy, qabala, Freemasonry, prayer, and after-life-survival.  Many of these titles have been translated into Russian, French, Spanish, Polish, and Portuguese. 

In September of 2014 the Institute for Hermetic Studies initiated its own publishing activities known as the "IHS Study Guides", specializing in high quality student and reader requested materials. Our first title, "Light on the Path - A Study Guide for Qabal, Alchemy, and Astrology" was successful enough in the first month to warrant the release of a second title. In October of 2014 we released "The Inner Way - The Power of Prayer and Belief in Spiritual Practice." 

This campaign is to raise $4,000 (US), sufficient funds to continue the process of reader supported specialty publications whose mass appeal may be limited, but whose importance to the niche audience is exceptional, some even say critical, to their understanding of the topics presented.

Financial support in the order of $4,000 will provide the Institute for Hermetic Studies with approximately $3,000 after fees and donor perks are deducted, thereby providing funding for TWO new titles in the IHS Study Guides Series. 

These titles are:

Child of the Sun – Psychic & Physical Rejuvenation in Alchemy and Qabala (IHS Vol. 3)

Sea of Sapphire – Visionary Techniques and Talismanic Magic with the Tree of Life (IHS Vol. 4)

In funding the publication of these volumes, you will be assisting in making available this little known material available in a practical and clear manner to a wider audience of students. This will aid not only to individual students, but also those working in more organized settings to bring about the fullness of the expression of what the 17th Century Rosicrucians called, the Light, Life, and Love in each of us.

What We Need & What You Get

It costs approximately $3,000 to bring a non-fiction book to market. However, with IHS volunteers, we have been able to reduce that cost to about $1,500 per title.  In short, we can produce two books for the cost of one.  Funds raised will be used to cover costs of proofreading, copyediting, and typesetting/design. 

 If we do not reach our goal, funds less than $1,500 will be donated to The Louis Claude de St. Martin Fund (of the Luzerne Foundation), and existing volumes in the IHS Study Guides Series will be substituted for future volumes for donor perks. The LCSM Fund was established in 2001 to aid in the support of academic and practical esoteric studies . To date, it has donated money to both public and university libraries, supported  The New Alexandrian Library Project, and provided funding for attendance at academic conferences (Association for the Study of Esotericism, 2014, Colgate University). For more information see:  http://www.hermeticinstitute.org/html/lcsm.html
Your contribution to the success of this project wil be recognized by a host of Perks, including PDFs, copies of the books upon their publications, listing in the books as a supporter, even Benefactor of their publication. Something you can show friends and family, and be proud of, knowing that you have helped bring something special and meaningful into the lives of others.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please be sure to share this campaign with your friends and family, by using the Indiegogo Share Tools.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi friends! 

If you don't want to read all the details below, here's the Short Version:

My beautiful wife and five amazing children are in Chile.  I haven’t seen them in 160 days and counting.

 I am writing and publishing this book in order to bring them back sooner.  I miss them greatly as any dad would.  We went on vacation last year to take care of my in-laws as they had some very severe health issues.  At the end of last year, the contract I had been working on suddenly ended. So in December, I came back up to the United States to get another contract and support my family financially.

Now it is time for them to come home.  I am writing this book to help speed their way back into my arms, but also to begin the career that I know I should have started years ago.

This Indiegogo campaign is a big pre-sale of the book to help me gauge how many books to print for our first run.

Here is a video of my little girls:

Here is one of my boys:

Long Version:

My name is Joshua Phair. I have been writing, teaching, training, and speaking publicly since I was 12.  I was recently Co-Author of another book that went Best Seller titled The Rise by Author Greg S. Reid.

I have always been very involved.  In my youth there was drama, debate, choir, soccer, wrestling, track, and scouting.  I also began composing music in my teens, played violin, and piano. 

I was chosen in 7th grade to go to a high school literary event in the state of Oregon.  It was about this same time that I discovered a LOVE for books.

My passion, however, is for speaking, coaching and teaching others, helping them realize how very important they are. 

After the passing of Jim Rohn, Og Mandino, Zig Ziglar and some of the truly great authors, we now live in a world where three brands of self-awareness and improvement books are needed. 

Inspiration – Stories of amazing people accomplishing amazingly beautiful and great things.  This gives us hope and allows us to free our imaginations, and in liberation learn to dream and create again.

Motivation – Stories of perseverance, consistency, and true grit, showing social proof of others sticking to it when things get tough.  This helps us continue in action though we may have temporarily lost sight of the dreams we seek to create.

Enlightenment – Stories, Metaphors, Analogies that help us to gain clarity with regard to who we are, why we are here, and where we are going.  This helps us live life with passion, and with purpose so that whatever dreams we are creating may give lasting joy and complete fulfillment.

It does not matter the order they are in, as everyone’s journey is their own, but all three are essential.

My first solo book to be published in 24 years will be in the inspiration area.  The Phoenix Phenomenon gives hope by allowing all to see that there is really no such thing as failure.  The stories will come alive and paint a picture that even in the direst of circumstance may hope be found.

Who is my inspiration for this book?

While I write it to reunite my family, the inspiration for this book is my Father.

My greatest Hero is my Dad.  I wrote a poem for my father not too long ago.  He was disheartened after some circumstances beyond his control and felt no longer deserving of the Superman “S” that he had on his chest.  The poem will give you a better idea of why he is my Hero.


The man who adopted one child more...

Panic, awake...
can this be?
The dream...
yet again it comes to me...

Your family is not complete,
God already gave us five,
adopted two more,
and then, we felt alive...

Yet again this dream,
it comes to me.
Telling me, “Look again,
it’s not complete.”

Somewhere,
there is another one.
He is waiting,
and will become your fifth son.

Again,
strange circumstance occurs...
Receive a phone call,
and something stirs.

Another boy needed you,
Call it fate or guidance of the spirit.
You replied in hushed tones,
"Send him for a visit."

And so a boy came
and stood re-united,
with is two other brothers,
and was simply delighted...

No more lost and lonely,
he was finally found.
And given a home,
where love would abound.

He grew and he grew,
and became he a man.
Imitating the good
that he saw in that man.

A man who,
in faith, listened to a dream.
A dream that to others,
impossible would seem.

Peacefully, awake...
the dream comes to me?
The dream that stills my troubled heart,
and brings me great peace...

Your family is complete.
I gave you five, and then gave you three more.
Thank you for listening, and when you get here,
there will be an open door...

Joshua S. Phair - October 15th, 2013


There are many other reasons that this amazing man is my Hero.  I only have time for one more.

My Dad and his beautiful and loving wife, took care of both their mothers toward the end of their lives.  My Dad’s mom lived in their house and, for many years, was cared for until she passed.

So when my in-laws got sick in 2012, I decided a little prematurely that it was time I followed in my father’s footsteps.  They were big shoes to fill, and though in no way do I consider my attempt a failure, I had to come home early to prepare financially for when I can really up the game and continue an amazing legacy.

So my wife and beautiful children stayed behind to make sure that my in-laws were taken care of , and I came home to begin again.  In the last 6 months with the help of some amazing mentors, I have finally shed the large portion of self-doubt that has held me back all these years from publishing my own works.


What are others Saying?

Karl Monson


"My good friend joshua has relayed his wisdom thru the spirit to others that go on to raise the bar of success in their lives and brings them worldly success. Many continue without the long-term happiness because they forgot the human touch that was taught. I am hopeful that this new book shows the true spirit and purpose of us all. For those who have the opportunity to inspire and those who seek inspiration."

- Annie McLaughlin Booth -


Paul Barlow 


"I'm so looking forward to this book! You better believe I'm getting a copy as soon as it's out! From my dear friend, mentor, and coach, this book will be phenomenal. I just know it!"

- Lisa Pickard Light -


So what are you trying to accomplish with this campaign?


I have divided it up into sections.

Primary Goals 

$30,000

Reunite my family

Publish “The Phoenix Phenomenon”

Secondary Goals

$50,000

Publish “El Fenómeno del Fénix”, the Spanish version of my book.

$75,000

Begin the Push to get both to Best Sellers Lists and start my career as a Professional Coach and Speaker

$100,000

Begin writing my Unspoken Lessons series – A series of 21 short books that will change forever the way you view inspiration, Motivation and enlightenment.  Live, Laugh, Love, Learn, Give, Serve…
story_txt:
Hi friends! 
If you don't want to read all the
details below, here's the Short Version:
My beautiful wife and five amazing children
are in Chile.  I haven’t seen them in
160 days and counting. 

 I am writing and publishing this book in order
to bring them back sooner.  I miss them
greatly as any dad would.  We went on
vacation last year to take care of my in-laws as they had some very severe
health issues.  At the end of last year,
the contract I had been working on suddenly ended. So in December, I came back
up to the United States to get another contract and support my family
financially.
Now it is time for them to come
home.  I am writing this book to help
speed their way back into my arms, but also to begin the career that I know I
should have started years ago.
This Indiegogo campaign is a big
pre-sale of the book to help me gauge how many books to print for our first
run.
Here is a video of my little girls:

Here is one of my boys:

Long Version:
My name is Joshua Phair. I have been
writing, teaching, training, and speaking publicly since I was 12.  I was
recently Co-Author of another book that went Best Seller titled The Rise by Author Greg S. Reid. 
I have always been very
involved.  In my youth there was drama,
debate, choir, soccer, wrestling, track, and scouting.  I also began composing music in my teens,
played violin, and piano.  
I was chosen in 7th grade
to go to a high school literary event in the state of Oregon.  It was about this same time that I
discovered a LOVE for books.
My passion, however, is for speaking,
coaching and teaching others, helping them realize how very important they
are.  
After the passing of Jim Rohn, Og
Mandino, Zig Ziglar and some of the truly great authors, we now live in a world
where three brands of self-awareness and improvement books are needed.  
Inspiration
– Stories of amazing people accomplishing amazingly beautiful and great
things.  This gives us hope and allows us
to free our imaginations, and in liberation learn to dream and create again.
Motivation
– Stories of perseverance, consistency, and true grit, showing social proof of
others sticking to it when things get tough. 
This helps us continue in action though we may have temporarily lost
sight of the dreams we seek to create. 
Enlightenment
– Stories, Metaphors, Analogies that help us to gain clarity with regard to who
we are, why we are here, and where we are going.  This helps us live life with passion, and
with purpose so that whatever dreams we are creating may give lasting joy and
complete fulfillment.
It does not matter the order they
are in, as everyone’s journey is their own, but all three are essential.
My first solo book to be published
in 24 years will be in the inspiration area. 
The Phoenix Phenomenon gives hope by allowing all to see that there is
really no such thing as failure.  The
stories will come alive and paint a picture that even in the direst of
circumstance may hope be found.
Who is my inspiration for this book?
While I write it to reunite my
family, the inspiration for this book is my Father.
My greatest Hero is my Dad.  I wrote a poem for my father not too long
ago.  He was disheartened after some
circumstances beyond his control and felt no longer deserving of the Superman
“S” that he had on his chest.  The poem
will give you a better idea of why he is my Hero.
The
man who adopted one child more...Panic, awake... 
can this be?
The dream... 
yet again it comes to me...
Your family is not complete, 
God already gave us five, 
adopted two more, 
and then, we felt alive...
Yet again this dream, 
it comes to me.
Telling me, “Look again, 
it’s not complete.”
Somewhere, 
there is another one.
He is waiting,
and will become your fifth son.
Again, 
strange circumstance occurs...
Receive a phone call, 
and something stirs.
Another boy needed you, 
Call it fate or guidance of the spirit.
You replied in hushed tones,
"Send him for a visit."
And so a boy came
and stood re-united, 
with is two other brothers, 
and was simply delighted...
No more lost and lonely, 
he was finally found.
And given a home, 
where love would abound.
He grew and he grew, 
and became he a man.
Imitating the good
that he saw in that man. 
A man who, 
in faith, listened to a dream.
A dream that to others, 
impossible would seem.
Peacefully, awake... 
the dream comes to me?
The dream that stills my troubled heart, 
and brings me great peace...
Your family is complete.
I gave you five, and then gave you three more. 
Thank you for listening, and when you get here,
there will be an open door...
Joshua S. Phair - October 15th,
2013

Writespace Year Two Fundraiser Extravaganza


About Writespace

       The mission of Writespace is to support writers. We seek to cultivate a space for community and learning for writers in the Houston area and beyond. But "space" doesn't just mean physical space to us. It also means creating conversation between writers. At Writespace, we support writers of all genres, including writers of literary fiction, poetry, science-fiction, fantasy, mystery, young adult, and other genres. We promote diversity, quality, and imagination in literature.

       Founded in May of 2014, Writespace has had an amazing two years. We've seen people who thought that they were just "dabbling" at writing become committed to putting writing first in their lives. Through our weekly writing workshops led by some of Houston's finest writing teachers, we've been able to support writers who can't afford to earn an MFA in Creative Writing by providing high-quality training and mentorship opportunities. 

       During our first two years, Writespace has served:  

•     Over 600 writers through over 80 writing workshops 

•     Over 350 writers and readers through 10 readings 

•     Over 90 writers through our shared-space write-ins program

•     Over 50 writers through our editing services

       Between year one and year two, we have more than doubled the number of writers we serve, as well as our yearly revenue (though operations still fit within the category "shoestring"). In year three we plan to more than double our numbers again, so that we can do an even better job of supporting writers.


About Our Instructors

       Writespace boasts a first-class faculty based out of Houston, Texas and beyond. Our instructors have published novels, collections, and nonfiction works in all genres. During Writefest we bring in talented journal editors and writers from around the nation so that emerging writers from Houston and beyond can learn from their expertise.


About Writespace's Programs 

Workshops: Writespace hosts one-day, 4-week, and 6-week writing workshops in a variety of genres. Past workshop topics included how to find an agent, science fiction and fantasy, mystery, writing for children, novel writing, short story, and poetry. A listing of our summer workshops is available on our website. 

Young Writers:  Writespace is proud to host workshops for young writers age 14-19. 

Readings: Writespace hosts open mics, readings, and book signings. Through the support of the community, we have been able to host some great events last year since our founding, such as Lit Con, a Halloween open mic, a Writers of Faith reading, faculty readings and more! We offer a reduced rate to local writers who want to launch their book with us and offer 100% of all book sale proceeds back to the writers. 

Editing Services and Manuscript Consultations: Writespace offers manuscript critiques, consultations, and editing services geared toward creative writers. 

Write-Ins: Writespace offers weekly write-ins in Houston. Write-Ins provide writers a quiet space to write away from the lure of necessary home chores, the demands of family, and the attention-suck of the Internet.


Writers Family Reunion

Come Find Your Writing Family at the Writers Family Reunion!

       The Writers Family Reunion is a one-day gathering and community-building event that Writespace will host Saturday, August 20th. The Family Reunion is designed to give writers an opportunity to develop friendships with other writers, learn from more experienced writers, and fortify their knowledge of craft and career. All levels and all genres are welcome!
       Join us for fun activities, such as: 
  • Critique group speed dating 
  • Small group first page feedback sessions and Q&As with professional writers
  • Literary games like Literary Prize Roulette, Hopscotch Haiku, and Pin-the-Mustache-on-William-Faulkner
      Along with opportunities to meet local writers, attending writers will have the opportunity to discover fantastic local literary resources; form new critique groups, join existing ones, or just learn about them; and bolster their knowledge of how to complete projects, submit, find agents, and publish. 
       To learn more, go here.    

       Registration is open! You can register via our site or by signing up for the Writers Family Reunion perk on the righthand side of the page. NOTE: If you’re not yet a member of Writespace, please choose the $100 Non-Member Full-Day Pass perk option—or consider becoming a member before adding this perk.

       Meet our Writers Family Reunion co-sponsors:

                 

                   

             


Writefest

 

       Writefest is a week-long writers festival taking place March 6-12th, 2017 in Houston, TX. The festival kicks off with a series of Monday-Friday workshops and culminates in a weekend filled with presentations, critique sessions, panels by local and national literary journal editors of all genres, a Literary Journal Fair, and readings by local and nationally-recognized authors.

       Three factors make Writefest unique among national writing events:

1. A focus on short forms (short stories, flash fiction, creative nonfiction pieces, personal essays, and poetry). 
2. A focus on literary journals and magazines.
3. A focus on writers of all experience levels, genres, and backgrounds.
       One of our campaign goals is to bring in a nationally recognized author to serve as Writefest's 2017 keynote speaker! Last year's keynote speakers included Jordan Bass of McSweeney's and Neil Clarke of Clakesworld. Registration for Writefest 2017 opens in August 2016.


*Campaign Details*


What We're Asking 

       The financial goal for our campaign is $7,500. When we reach $7,500, we'll add stretch goals! 

Where the $ Will Go

       Below is a breakdown of the funds we're requesting and where the funds will be distributed:


* Campaign Perks *

Swag Bag

Anthologies: 

       Writespace is proud to reveal the cover for our newest anthology!

       In Medias Res

      
        For the past few months, Writespace has been proud to showcase the work of local Houston photographer and fellow Silver Street Studios tenant John Bernhard. We're excited that John has partnered with Writespace to provide the artwork for the cover of our newest anthology, In Medias Res: Stories from the In-Between, set to release this fall. 

       Our Space: Shorts & Poetry from the Houston Community

       
       Our Space is a collection of shorts and poetry from the Writespace community. Published in 2015, Our Space includes work by twenty-five exceptional Houston writers.

       ARTlines2

 

       ARTlines2 was a national ekphrastic poetry competition organized by Public Poetry in partnership with the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston (MFAH)—and ARTLines2: Art Becomes Poetry is the beautiful anthology produced by the competition. In it, lush poems orbit around color pages of artworks chosen by MFAH curators. Inspired by the art, the featured poetry comes from a nation-wide competition judged by luminaries including former Poet Laureate of the United States, Robert Pinsky. This is a beautiful book, designed for art lovers and poetry lovers alike.

NOTE: To receive this perk, you must be able to pick up the book at Writespace before or after a workshop or event--or, at any time during the week.

Ebook Bundle Selections:

       Here are two of four craft books by Christina Escamilla that you could choose as a perk. The two available titles not pictured are 1001 Everyday Prompts and The Art of Storytelling.  Please see Christina Escamilla's site to choose a fiction title--or let us know if you'd like us to choose one for you.

                                   


Hand-Stitched Journals

       Layla Al-Bedawi's hand-stitched journals come in a variety of sizes, colors, and styles. You get to choose your favorite!
       NOTE: To receive this perk, you must be able to pick up the book at Writespace before or after a workshop or event--or, at any time during the week.

                 


Writing Consultations: 
       Appointment times are scheduled between the writer-editor and the Indiegogo contributor. Consultations can occur in-person or via phone, email, or Skype--excepting consultations with Writefest editors, which are remote-only, because these editors live in different states around the country. FYI, when a consultant's name is highlighted, you can click on the name to read his/her bio. Choices are first-come, first-served, and page will be updated as consultations sell out.

Writefest Editor Consultations:
Share up to 2 pages of writing for an editor of one these awesome journals to review:

 

Julia Rios: Poetry & Reprints Editor at Uncanny. Julia also has three years of experience as the fiction editor of Strange Horizons. 


 

Mike Allen: Editor of Mythic Delirium and Clockwork Phoenix.

 

Ranylt Richildis: Editor-in-Chief of Lackington's.


 

Robert Stapleton: Founder and Editor of Booth, the literary journal of Butler University in Indiana.


 

Caseyrenée Lopez: Founder and Editor-in-Chief of Crab Fat Magazine.


 

Matthew Limpede: Executive Editor of Carve Magazine


Coffee Chats and Consultations:

       Bring your questions about the writing life and, if you'd like, the first page of a longer work for the author of your choice to review!

Cassandra Rose Clarke: Young Adult and Speculative Fiction

Joy Preble: Young Adult and Middle Grade

Adrienne Perry: Literary Fiction and Mainstream Fiction

KJ Russell: Speculative Fiction

Marian Szczepanski: Literary Fiction and Historical Fiction

Elizabeth White-Olsen: Literary fiction, Young Adult, and Memoir

Jessica Wilbanks: Memoir and Creative Nonfiction

DL Young: Science Fiction (& will review up to five pages of work)


Resume Consultations:

       About resume consultant Susannah Russell: Susannah earned a double major in English and Psychology from the University of Texas at Austin and a Doctorate of Juris Prudence at the University of Houston Law Center. She currently works at a large energy corporation where she reviews contracts, negotiates land deals, interprets and applies regulatory law, works on multi-million-dollar development plans, and serves on her department’s recruitment team. In her spare time, she enjoys writing, volunteering at Writespace, and helping her clients craft stellar resumes.


Novel Editor Consultations:

Christina Escamilla: All genres of mainstream and speculative fiction, including science fiction, fantasy, and horror


Memberships:

      You can learn more about Writespace memberships here. If you’re not sure whether you’ve renewed, never fear—we will save your renewal until it’s time for you to renew.

       With a Women in the Visual and Literary Arts (WiVLA) membership, you can attend monthly meetings, submit work to WiVLA-sponsored exhibitions and contests, receive monthly newsletters filled with calls for submissions and other opportunities, and network with experienced writers! This membership perk is applicable for the 2017 calendar year, but you can start attending meetings immediately. You can find out more on WiVLA's site.


Writing Time at Writespace Write-Ins:


     Finally, the book you've been meaning to write can happen TODAY instead of "someday." Writespace is the only space in Houston dedicated solely to giving writers time to write. Come make use of the quiet time away from chores and WIFI to create the best work you can. Your writing deserves your time and attention--and it's writers who write TODAY, not "someday," who get to watch their dreams come true.

Learn more about Writespace’s weekly write-ins here. NOTE: The perk price to the right is Writespace members’ Weekday Write-Ins rate—if you are not yet a member, please choose $60 Member Writer perk before choosing this perk, or, if you prefer, visit our site to sign up for Weekly Write-Ins at the non-member rate.


Scholarships:

       To learn how Writespace scholarship recipients are chosen, go here.  

       Here's a photo of the writers who attended Adrienne Perry's fantastic spring 2016 Writers of Color Workshop, for which Writespace offered over $1500 in scholarships:


Workshop Gift Certificates:

       You can check out Writespace's upcoming workshops schedule here. 


Author Photoshoot:

                                                        

       Nathan Fjord Lindstrom specializes in commercial and editorial portrait photography, including location photography for corporate and advertising clients. His work has appeared in Sports Illustrated, Fortune, Marie Claire, Texas Highways, ESPN The Magazine, and Forbes. His advertising and corporate photography has been used by General Electric,  ExxonMobil, Marine Well Containment Co and Thompson Reuters.



* Campaign FAQs *


Why should I donate to Writespace?

       We are doing a lot of good, even though we are so new. Check out our track record in the "About Writespace" section near the top of this page.

       Writespace believes in supporting writers. Whether you are new and just getting started, or just need to get back in the game, we're here to help. We believe that writing transcends genre. We love all kinds of writing, from literary fiction to poetry to mystery to science fiction. We are devoted to expanding the Houston literary scene. We're supported by a team of dedicated volunteers from all over Houston who want to make a writing community that is their own. We encourage our writers to make our space theirs.

If I contribute dollars or contribute by signing up for a perk, will my contribution be tax-deductible?

    The short answer is no. The longer answer is maybe.     While Writespace is a registered non-profit with the Secretary of State, we have not yet received our 501(C)3 status with the IRS. We are fiscally sponsored by Fresh Arts, however, so if you would like to make a tax-deductible donation to Writespace separate from this campaign, please  contact us. Part of the funds from this campaign will go towards helping us achieve our goal of becoming a 501-(C)3 organization. 

What if I live out of state?

       Consider donating via our e-book perk, which gets you an electronic copy of our new e-book, Our Space, sent to your email. Or, donate by purchasing one of our consultations, available via Skype, online, or phone. Lastly, if you want to purchase a Writespace gift certificate perk, remember that we offer online workshops. 

What if I'm outside of the U.S.?

      We are happy to accept international donations, however we regret that we are unable to ship books outside of the U.S. 

What are this campaign's stretch goals?

       First Goal: $7,500. If we make our goal of $7,500 our next stretch goal will be $10,000 and that stretch goal is really, really AMAZING. We can't tell you yet what it is, but make sure to check back on our Indiegogo page for more info as we near our goal!


--- Want to donate a perk to our campaign? Email us by clicking on "Ask a Question" on the top righthand side of this page!

--- THANK YOU for your time --and thank you for supporting writers!

NOTE: To receive this perk, you must be able to pick up the book at Writespace before or after a workshop or event--or, at any time during the week.


Ebook Bundle Selections:


       Here are two of four craft books by Christina Escamilla that you could choose as a perk. The two available titles not pictured are 1001 Everyday Prompts and The Art of Storytelling.  Please see Christina Escamilla's site to choose a fiction title--or let us know if you'd like us to choose one for you.
                                   



Hand-Stitched Journals

       Layla Al-Bedawi's hand-stitched journals come in a variety of sizes, colors, and styles. You get to choose your favorite!
       NOTE: To receive this perk, you must be able to pick up the book at Writespace before or after a workshop or event--or, at any time during the week.

                 


Writing Consultations: 
       Appointment times are scheduled between the writer-editor and the Indiegogo contributor. Consultations can occur in-person or via phone, email, or Skype--excepting consultations with Writefest editors, which are remote-only, because these editors live in different states around the country. FYI, when a consultant's name is highlighted, you can click on the name to read his/her bio. Choices are first-come, first-served, and page will be updated as consultations sell out.

Writefest Editor Consultations:
Share up to 2 pages of writing for an editor of one these awesome journals to review:



 

Julia Rios: Poetry & Reprints Editor at Uncanny. Julia also has three years of experience as the fiction editor of Strange Horizons. 





 


Mike Allen: Editor of Mythic Delirium and Clockwork Phoenix.




 
Ranylt Richildis: Editor-in-Chief of Lackington's.


 
Robert Stapleton: Founder and Editor of Booth, the literary journal of Butler University in Indiana.

 

Caseyrenée Lopez: Founder and Editor-in-Chief of Crab Fat Magazine.

 


Matthew Limpede: Executive Editor of Carve Magazine

Coffee Chats and Consultations:
       Bring your questions about the writing life and, if you'd like, the first page of a longer work for the author of your choice to review!
Cassandra Rose Clarke: Young Adult and Speculative Fiction
Joy Preble: Young Adult and Middle Grade
Adrienne Perry: Literary Fiction and Mainstream Fiction
KJ Russell: Speculative Fiction
Marian Szczepanski: Literary Fiction and Historical Fiction
Elizabeth White-Olsen: Literary fiction, Young Adult, and Memoir
Jessica Wilbanks: Memoir and Creative Nonfiction
DL Young:  Science Fiction (& will review up to five pages of work)

Resume Consultations:


       About resume consultant Susannah Russell: Susannah earned a double major
in English and Psychology from the University of Texas at Austin and a Doctorate of Juris Prudence at the University of Houston Law Center. She currently works at a large energy corporation where she reviews contracts,
negotiates land deals, interprets and applies regulatory law, works on
multi-million-dollar development plans, and serves on her department’s
recruitment team. In her spare time, she enjoys writing, volunteering at Writespace, and helping her clients craft stellar resumes.

Novel Editor Consultations:
Christina Escamilla: All genres of mainstream and speculative fiction, including science fiction, fantasy, and horror


Memberships:





      You can learn more about Writespace memberships here. If you’re not sure whether you’ve renewed, never fear—we will save your renewal until it’s time for you to renew.


       With a Women in the Visual and Literary Arts (WiVLA) membership, you can attend monthly meetings, submit work to WiVLA-sponsored exhibitions and contests, receive monthly newsletters filled with calls for submissions and other opportunities, and network with experienced writers! This membership perk is applicable for the 2017 calendar year, but you can start attending meetings immediately. You can find out more on WiVLA's site.



Writing Time at Writespace Write-Ins:



 
     Finally, the book you've been meaning to write can happen TODAY instead of "someday." Writespace is the only space in Houston dedicated solely to giving writers time to write. Come make use of the quiet time away from chores and WIFI to create the best work you can. Your writing deserves your time and attention--and it's writers who write TODAY, not "someday," who get to watch their dreams come true.

Learn more about Writespace’s weekly write-ins here. NOTE: The perk price to the right is Writespace members’ Weekday Write-Ins rate—if you are not yet a member, please choose $60 Member Writer perk before choosing this perk, or, if you prefer, visit our site to sign up for Weekly Write-Ins at the non-member rate.


Scholarships:
       To learn how Writespace scholarship recipients are chosen, go here.  
       Here's a photo of the writers who attended Adrienne Perry's fantastic spring 2016 Writers of Color Workshop, for which Writespace offered over $1500 in scholarships:






Workshop Gift Certificates:
       You can check out Writespace's upcoming workshops schedule here. 

Author Photoshoot:
                                                        
       Nathan Fjord Lindstrom specializes in commercial and editorial portrait photography, including location photography for corporate and advertising clients. His work has appeared in Sports Illustrated, Fortune, Marie Claire, Texas Highways, ESPN The Magazine, and Forbes. His advertising and corporate photography has been used by General Electric,  ExxonMobil, Marine Well Containment Co and Thompson Reuters.



* Campaign FAQs *

Why should I donate to Writespace?
       We are doing a lot of good, even though we are so new. Check out our track record in the "About Writespace" section near the top of this page.
       Writespace believes in supporting writers. Whether you are new and just getting started, or just need to get back in the game, we're here to help. We believe that writing transcends genre. We love all kinds of writing, from literary fiction to poetry to mystery to science fiction. We are devoted to expanding the Houston literary scene. We're supported by a team of dedicated volunteers from all over Houston who want to make a writing community that is their own. We encourage our writers to make our space theirs.
If I contribute dollars or contribute by signing up for a perk, will my contribution be tax-deductible?
     The short answer is no. The longer answer is maybe.
    While Writespace is a registered non-profit with the Secretary of State, we have not yet received our 501(C)3 status with the IRS. We are fiscally sponsored by Fresh Arts, however, so if you would like to make a tax-deductible donation to Writespace separate from this campaign, please  contact us. Part of the funds from this campaign will go towards helping us achieve our goal of becoming a 501-(C)3 organization. 
What if I live out of state?
       Consider donating via our e-book perk, which gets you an electronic copy of our new e-book, Our Space, sent to your email. Or, donate by purchasing one of our consultations, available via Skype, online, or phone. Lastly, if you want to purchase a Writespace gift certificate perk, remember that we offer online workshops. 
What if I'm outside of the U.S.?
      We are happy to accept international donations, however we regret that we are unable to ship books outside of the U.S. 

What are this campaign's stretch goals?
       First Goal: $7,500. If we make our goal of $7,500 our next stretch goal will be $10,000 and that stretch goal is really, really AMAZING. We can't tell you yet what it is, but make sure to check back on our Indiegogo page for more info as we near our goal!


--- Want to donate a perk to our campaign? Email us by clicking on "Ask a Question" on the top righthand side of this page!



--- THANK YOU for your time --and thank you for supporting writers!

story:
Who?
I am Lazzat Davletova and began my studies in 1992 when I started Vedic science courses. I was fascinated by this deeper understanding of life. I furthered my credentials by graduating from a meditation teaching course. I then taught meditation and Stress management. I furthered my certification and became a Ayurveda Wellness consultant. I now practice Stress management, meditation, Ayurveda and other integrative therapies professionally. 


What?
Learn stress management through knowledge and integrative therapies that create a fundamental basis for human health in order to prevent future problems. The solution is truly sustainable because it involves balancing the lifestyle and diet of each individual's unique physiology. Every person is different. This stress management technique is a lifelong practice to help prevent illness and negative life experiences.

How? 
I have interviewed outstanding holistic doctors and health practitioners as well as conducted my own research on hidden reasons of stress in our physiology. Through my research and studies, I have broken through and discovered information that is unknown to many. I have written a book that I want to share freely. It addresses one of the most common problems on the individual and societal level in modern day culture: stress. In the book I research into stress, the body's stress response, the effects and temporary coping mechanisms. I find answers  to many questions about stress, wellness, anxiety, insomnia, etc. Within the book you will find instructions on how to manage stress anytime in your life. Also, I want to create a website that will be a resource for information as well as a forum for group support.


Why?
 Knowledge is forever; your whole life. Learn this knowledge one time and keep it for life vs. endless doctor visits. By living in accordance with the laws of nature, life is more likely to be extended, you can live in balance and manage your own health issues. Only with severe imbalances may a practitioner be needed.

What motivated me to write the book with this research? Why I should explain ancient knowledge with modern science?

First, everybody believes in science and wants to have proof of any healing therapies in research. We ask: what is it for me in this old science of life as we call Ayurveda or even in modern integrative therapies? Why not to go to doctor, MD, who has such extensive training to know everything in this world about health?

Yes, doctor had training in medicine but not wellness, not alternative therapies but only in diagnosis and treatment of disease with medicines. They don`t have time to learn about new alternative therapies and can`t tell if it is safe or not.  Alternative health providers can`t recommend much sometimes too because they have limitation in this regard. However, we have freedom of information privilege and we have right to research, educate and advocate our knowledge. In addition, everybody has right to tell about his/her personal story that other people can learn something about that and prevent it.

Second, many disorders  and imbalances could be helped with ancient and integrative therapies, which I learned and research.  I would like to tell other people how to prevent and eliminate many health problems and reduce stress response with natural therapies including Ayurveda. However, nobody will follow recommendations in full if they don`t understand the value of this knowledge. It require some gradual lifestyle changes, better food choices and other modalities that can help only in long term. Though supplements can help more fast they can bring only about 20% of success in healing. Most recommendations are made appropriate to individual type of physiology after personal consultation but I can make general recommendations for everybody. 


#1. $1,000 to pay a publishing company to design the cover front/back, publish the book and distribute it to 2500 online stores. I need to get this information out there.
#2. $780 for the editing and illustrations of the book
#3. $500 marketing for the book through online marketing.
#4. $1000 for website creation. The website will have extensive information including articles, discussions, questionnaires, group support, comprehensive information about stress, access to the eBook and more. It will be a free resource for stress management and other valuable wellness knowledge.


The Impact
This project is important to each person because it reveals information to improve well-being. In modern times health has become confusing and fragmented. People have lost touch with nature and many imbalances have resulted in illness and disease. By becoming aware of your nature and adjusting your life accordingly, you can correct those imbalances. These imbalances can become weight problems, stress, anxiety and insomnia, just to name a few. Any person interested in learning more can email me and I will send a copy of the book. The more people who become aware of these techniques the better. 
By supporting this cause, you will receive materials to help people understand why they may not handle stress well and why they have anxiety. If you want to change the world, you first must change yourself. As more of us become aware and change, the collective world can begin to change. 

What's Next?
 I plan to conduct scientific research to connect this knowledge of life with modern science using medical devices in order to demonstrate the healing abilities that are possible through putting this knowledge into practice. This way there is tangible modern evidence to the ancient philosophies.

Other Ways You Can Get Involved
If you can't donate at this time, you can still get a copy of the book by contacting me at infoims@att.net if you would like to learn more. We ask you to please share this cause anyway you can including via Facebook or other social media.

Donate now!

story:
In 1855 Nathaniel Hawthorne insisted that “America is now wholly given over to a damned mob of scribbling women.” Dear old boy. Let’s make his vision a reality.

Update

October 31: Inside Higher Ed published a piece I wrote on why I'm starting this press. And we're mentioned in Bitch Magazine's Feminist News Roundup. Also: nice shout-outs from The Feminist Wire and VIDA: Women in Literary Arts on their Facebook pages. : )

Introduction

My name is Rosalie Morales Kearns. I’m a writer/editor of Puerto Rican and Pennsylvania Dutch descent, based right now in Albany, NY. I’m starting a small book publishing company, Shade Mountain Press, which will publish literary fiction by women authors. Two titles are scheduled to be published in 2014: Egg Heaven, a short story collection by Robin Parks; and Her Own Vietnam, a novel by Lynn Kanter.

Why I'm Doing This

Women are still vastly underrepresented among authors of literary fiction. Only about 25% to 30% of authors published in literary journals are women. Of the authors whose books get reviewed in the major book review outlets, again, less than a third are women. Same situation in book publishing--and this is the case whether the publisher is a huge conglomerate or a small, supposedly cutting-edge press. At some publishers, the percentage of women authors of literary fiction is as small as 10%.

I noticed this trend myself as I researched publishers who might be interested in my own novel manuscript. Time after time, the “new and forthcoming” sections of reputable small, literary presses included only one female author out of eight, or one out of ten. Sometimes a publisher’s entire “new and forthcoming” list was male.

Lots of good articles are being written about this trend. The arts organization VIDA: Women in Literary Arts (www.vidaweb.org) is always posting links to relevant articles from places like NPR, The Atlantic, The Nation, and Salon.

I’m trying to be part of the solution. 

Why This Matters

I happen to know that women are writing great things. Besides teaching writing classes, I go to writers’ conferences, I join writers groups. I hear women writers read from their works-in-progress, and it’s brilliant, amazing stuff.

I want their voices to be heard. I especially want to read more works by women from groups historically underrepresented among literary authors: women of color; women with disabilities; women from working-class backgrounds; lesbian/bisexual/queer women.

Obviously, one small publishing house by itself can’t solve this problem. But it’s a step in the right direction.

How I'm Qualified to Do This

I’ve been a freelance copyeditor of book manuscripts for twenty years, first with a research institute (where I worked with book designers and printers and had hands-on experience with layout) and then as a freelancer. I’ve also taught creative writing at the college level and in adult education classes, so I’ve had a lot of experience working with authors.

What I Need

The figure of $13,000 includes general start-up costs: a website, attorney’s fees for author contracts, ISBNs. Per-book costs include cover design, copyediting, paper, printing, binding, shipping, and promotion.

I would like Shade Mountain books to be printed using traditional offset printing, rather than print-on-demand (POD). Using offset printing for my books gives me more options for type design and paper, results in a higher-quality finished product, and gives my books a better chance of being ordered by bookstores and libraries.

Having startup capital is crucial for book publishing. When a customer buys a book in a bookstore or an online site like Amazon, the store or online site keeps about 55% of the money the customer paid. The distributer takes another 5-10%. The 35% that the publisher receives can take nine months or more to arrive--and then part of that, of course, goes to the authors as royalties. This process can become self-sustaining after a few years if you have decent sales and maintain a good-quality list, but in the meantime, you need money upfront.

Other Ways You Can Help

A great way to help (whether you can afford to donate or not) is to let others know about this campaign, by sharing the link with your friends. If you would like to be on the Shade Mountain Press e-newsletter mailing list, please email me at shademountainpress@gmail.com, and I’ll let you know when the titles will be available.

For more information about Shade Mountain Press, including why I chose the name, please see this link on my personal website.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Carl Schlotman. I am a current senior at Queens University of Charlotte. I have done 5 internships in my collegiate career: CAI Insurance, Merrill Lynch, CapitalSouth Partners, TPG Sourcing Advisors, Brookwood Associates, and Goldman Sachs. 

I have learned a lot in attaining the above experiences and I tried many different strategies in my process. I want to share the lessons I learned along the way to help more students acheive their goals. I think the best way to help the most students is through a book. I have the manuscript written, but I need your help to fund the upfront publishing costs!


What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $2,000 in funding for:

1. Editing the manuscript- $750

2. Ebook Conversion- $250

3. Printing Costs- $1,000


Table of Contents for Cash in Your Diploma

1. Establishing a Presence on Campus

"The best effort of a fine person is felt after we have left their presence."-Ralph Waldo Emerson

2. Goal Setting for College Students

"Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible."-Tony Robbins 

3. Build Relationships

"If civilization is to survive, we must cultivate the science of human relationships - the ability of all peoples, of all kinds, to live together, in the same world at peace." -Franklin D. Roosevelt

4. How can a College student possibly add value?

"I've always been seen as the underdog in everything I've ever done in my life, and it doesn't bother me in the slightest. The lessons have just made me stronger." -Victor Ortiz

“It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.”-Mark Twain

5. Master Awkward Small Talk

“Discomfort brings engagement and change. Discomfort means you’re doing something that others were unlikely to do, because they’re hiding out in the comfortable zone.” - Seth Godin

6. Follow up to Succeed

"Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not: the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent." - Calvin Coolidge

7. Internships are the New B.A. 

"When I was a 21-year-old intern at CBS, I was told I had crossed eyes and shouldn't try to be on air. That's when I decided I was going to be behind the scenes." - Andy Cohen

"My biggest bit of advice would be to spend some time actually helping caterers or Chefs, even if it has to be for free or as an intern of culinary externship. It helps immerse yourself in what you potentially want to do." - Giada De Laurentiis

"I started in the mailroom, literally, as an intern... in 1974. The legislator I was working for at the time said, 'I want you to get your law degree and come back here and get elected and be the first woman governor.' I kind of took that guy seriously - I thought that sounded like a pretty good idea." -Claire McCaskill 

"I think the lie we've told people in the marketplace is that a degree gets you a job. A degree doesn't get you a job. What gets you a job is the ability to carry yourself into that room and shake a hand and look someone in the eye and have people skills. These are the things that cause people to become successful." - Dave Ramsey 

8. The Internship of Getting an Internship

“It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.” ― Ernest Hemingway

9. Avoid being an analyst for Coffee Running LLC

"A winner is someone who recognizes his God-given talents, works his tail off to develop them into skills, and uses these skills to accomplish his goals." Larry Bird 

"To succeed, you will soon learn, as I did, the importance of a solid foundation in the basics of education - literacy, both verbal and numerical, and communication skills." - Alan Greenspan 

10. The Telephone is a Deadly Weapon 

"Life is way too short to be small." -Benjamin Disraeli

11. Infrastructure of You

“Investing in yourself is the best investment you will ever make. It will not only improve your life, it will improve the lives of all those around you.” -Robin Sharma

"The most successful men in the end are those whose success is the result of steady accretion. . . It is the man who carefully advances step by step, with his mind becoming wider and wider - and progressively better able to grasp any theme or situation - persevering in what he knows to be practical, and concentrating his thought upon it, who is bound to succeed in the greatest degree." - Alexander Graham Bell

"What can I learn today that I didn't know before?" - Donald Trump 

12. Cowards Quit - Effort Levels 

"Most of us who aspire to be tops in our fields don't really consider the amount of work required to stay tops." -Althea Gibson 

“Never make excuses. Your friends don't need them and your foes won't believe them.” ― John Wooden

"Finding your purpose may be a lifelong pursuit or you may have discovered it when you were 5 years old. There's no absolute timeline for anyone. That's a good reason never to give up, to keep on discovering things every day." Donald Trump 

"Excellence is the gradual result of always striving to do better." - Pat Riley

13. Steps to the Top- Be the Best

"Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out." John Wooden

“Good, better, best. Never let it rest. Until your good is better and your better is best.”- Tim Duncan

14. Ibuprofen of Business- Constructive Criticism

"Criticism may not be agreeable, but it is necessary. It fulfils the same function as pain in the human body. It calls attention to an unhealthy state of things." - Winston Churchill  

"I like criticism. It makes you strong." LeBron James

15. A Personal Board of Directors

“Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.” ― Benjamin Franklin

"I think a role model is a mentor - someone you see on a daily basis, and you learn from them." - Denzel Washington

16. The Power of Thank You

"The joy I get from winning a major championship doesn't even compare to the feeling I get when a kid writes a letter saying: 'Thank you so much. You have changed my life." - Tiger Woods

"For all the supporters of Tesla over the years, and it's been several years now and there have been some very tough times, I'd just like to say thank you very much. I deeply appreciate the support, particularly through the darkest times." - Elon Musk

18 Give Back and Helps Others

“Happiness begins where selfishness ends.” -John Wooden

“Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.” - Albert Einstein 

“The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to them their own.” - Disraeli

Bonus

Inaction-Iron rusts from disuse, stagnant water loses its purity and in cold weather becomes frozen, even so does inaction sap the vigors of the mind. Leonardo da Vinci 

“Failing to prepare is preparing to fail.” ― John Wooden

“Never try to be better than someone else. Learn from others, and try to be the best you can be. Success is the by-product of that preparation.” ― John Wooden


The Impact

I just want to help students achieve their goals by sharing the strategies that I used to attain the internships listed above and get a full time offer in the start of my senior year. I am still young and I certainly don't claim to know everything. But I have tried many different methods using a trial and error process to narrow in on the most successful tactics. By sharing these tactics in the Cash in Your Diploma, I hope to save current students time and energy while maximizing their results.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, you CAN still HELP:

1. Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat. 

2. Help spread the word to professors, mentors, and friends.

Thank you so much for your time, and I really appreciate the support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Priyanka and I’ve written a book on better travel, which includes my own journey towards navigating the world as someone who embraces all cultures and has found purpose in supporting causes at home and abroad. This campaign supports the publication of the book, as well as my own global activism work with citizens all over the world. 

 

As such, I dedicate this campaign to Third Culture Kids of the World, now is the time.

 

This book will teach you how to engage people from other cultures around the world through time-tested strategies and enchanting travel adventures. After collecting and curating stories from fellow protesters, friends abroad, international scholars, travel influencers, people I've met on planes, tour guides, and industry experts, I found that the most important ingredient to navigating our world is infinite love.

 

The travel mindsets in the book may lead to a more repeatable or sustainable way of navigating our world, and include: 1. Finding Truth 2. Open-Mindedness 3. Resilience 4. Giving Back

 

Part I: How we got here?

Part II: Current state of travel + the travel mindsets 

Part III: Future of travel + technology's influence

Part IV: Global Citizen Pledge

 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means to leave a place better than when you arrived and be encouraged to adopt a cause that you are passionate about to the extent you are ready to be that change you wish to see in the world.

 

Audience: You will enjoy this read if you are interested in travel, are passionate about activism for global or local causes, and like learning about cultures. Ultimately, I hope this book will inspire all of us to share our unique travel stories and posture us to be better global citizens.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order perks to help cover the costs for publishing my book and to engage you with opportunities to be part of the journey and enjoy some travel specific merch. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Dec. 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book. The mock-ups you see are currently a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Dec. 2020
  • Book merchandise (masks, wristbands, other branded items)

 

When I pre-sell 130 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, and based on perk level, additional items like:
  • A handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • A handwritten postcard thank you from another country (with travel tips)
  • Merchandise (e.g., personalized mask and wristband)
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover and title
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing a book
  • And more...

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use the hashtags #ThirdCultureKids #BetterTravel #GlobalCitizen #GlobalActivist #travel. 

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, through text/call or direct message on social media.

 

About the Author

Priyanka is an avid traveler having been to 40 countries and 44 out of 50 U.S. states. After traveling the world she realized there were so many interesting people she had learned from and countless stories she could tell that would influence how we can travel better. 

Priyanka also works as a Director of Data and Informatics at ASTHO, where she works on health IT and data related projects for all state and territorial health agencies. Part of her work involves her traveling to the U.S. states and territories.

For more information you can connect with Priyanka on LinkedIn, IG: p.s.travelstories, FB: Surio, Priyanka and Twitter: p.s.travelstories.
