story:
I am taking my books, ideas on raising consciousness, meditative movements and activism toward awareness on the road in order to make happy. I know it will be a successful journey, a happy one, but I also know I may face perils that exiting one’s front door and traversing across the continent might bring.

  I intend to share my writing and meditative movement all across the U.S.A. and Canada, from Mendocino to Maine. I will be promoting my metaphilosophy The Matrix of Four, The Philosophy of the Duality of Polarity and 108 Steps to Be in The Zone, my book on fusion of movement Tibet Fusion, my marijuana mystery Down And Out in Mendocino, my other potfiction The Terraist Letters contrasting the global prohibition of marijuana/hemp and the global promotion of nuclear experimentation, The New Printed Threat about events that turn a pot dealer into a book dealer, my political nonfiction The Little Green Book of Revolution, The Complete Patriot’s Guide to Oligarchical Collectivism and the serious and hilarious A Holiday Hazing Santa Claus Syndrome.  

  A successful trip will be safe completion, beyond that I hope to find new places to call home, find new individuals to call friends, make a positive impact with writing and share meditative movement for wellness in the war world. It will be a book tour toward raising individual consciousness and collective awareness. I am inspired by my tai chi chuan teacher to proceed on a compassionate course to enhance consciousness and wellness. The more people I can help heal themselves, through sharing writing or sharing meditative movement, the more successful a journey I will consider it. 

  Honestly though, in the end I’ll never be comfortable with success if nuclear experimentation remains acceptable.  So as I proceed on my journeys I intend to share information on nuclear experimentation, through my voice, printed articles, flyers, stickers maybe, and of course continuing to write on the subject, the danger it presents to all of our successes, dreams and opinions or whatever. Educating individuals about nuclear experimentation will be a major focus.  

  A wise person once told me that to stop something, don’t fight it, start something better. In order to implement new systems, build the anew and people will gravitate to whatever is better without fluctuation, without confrontation. I wholeheartedly endorse this, however when there is a fire that does not burn out like nuclear fires, one must control it first before building new structure.

  Nuclear experimentation casts the biggest shadow, is the most diabolical specter there is. In order for humanity to put out the fire of global nuclear experimentation we need to educate and uplift each other. Nuclear experimentation operates in the same manner as the petrolithic industry; elements are mined, refined and then set afire with life threatening processes at every step. The differences between petrolithic and nuclear fuel burning is that some nuclear waste is deadly for millions of years and risks entirety like the ongoing disasters at Fukushima, Hanford and more recently W.I.P.P. in New Mexico.  

  I want to ask you for your assistance in expanding my journey that is a fourfold plan of promoting writing, raising individual consciousness, sharing wellness through meditative movement and sharing information on nuclear experimentation. I plan on being on the road for many months, flowing with the flow, sharing writing, meditative movement and educating people about the ongoing fire preventing implementation of more integrative energy systems though its mere existence. Grand success for me would be playing a part in the progression toward stopping global nuclear experimentation and beginning integrative energy sources -labeled alternative- instead of the hyper deadly and destructive nuclear and petrolithic systemization.

  Your contribution toward a successful book tour is invaluable to me personally and professionally.  Your financial contribution will go toward the van, fuel, flyers, articles on consciousness and nuclear experimentation, books and towards speaking engagements across the continent. Your contribution, on a personal level, would fuel me with the confidence to go forth  

  Please consider making a donation to my endeavors as an artist, healer and activist. Please also share this with your local yoga studio, tai chi chuan group, bookstore, community center, meditative group, ashram, radio program or whomever in your area that might offer a place to exchange ideas as I go or otherwise support. If any of your friends might consider supporting my endeavors to raise awareness of individual consciousness and collective awareness of nuclear experimentation with whatever you are able. I’m honored for you to read and share, I’m humbled and extremely grateful for your financial contribution, connection, and assistance in any form. Thank you, gratefully,

Ethan Indigo Smith

Books:  http://www.amazon.com/Ethan-Indigo-Smith/e/B0058V4P2U/ref=ntt_dp_epwbk_0

Articles: http://wakeup-world.com/category/contributing-writers/ethan-indigo-smith/ http://www.opednews.com/author/stats/author32780.html  http://www.zengardner.com/?s=ethan+indigo+smith


Here’s what some have said about Ethan Indigo Smith’s writing:

Transport J. D. Salinger's Holden Caulfield to the 21st century and you get the protagonist of The Terraist Letters. This rollicking journey through NYC, juxtapositions the mainstream, the lamestream and the out-of-stream as the Terraist heroes attempt to bring some sanity as well as medicinal cheer to the urban zombies of today. Ethan's work will titillate, irritate, but most importantly, stimulate some serious thought concerning current conventions. Give it a read. Your brain might thank you.

~New York Times Best Selling author, groundbreaking researcher, Jim Marrs

It's (The Complete Patriot’s Guide) a book to read a few pages at a time, and then contemplate for hours after. It's written as a learning experience, the facts, quotes and ideas bundled together in a way which leads to our own thoughts as the material moves on. I remember when 1984 was ushered in, wondering: "What next?" Ethan wondered as well, and the results of his curiosity and writing, if not the answer, will lead to the answer.

~Deborah Meier, Senior Scholar NYU, founder of the modern small schools movement

I found Ethan's writing extremely informative.  I liked it and it's interesting.

~Immortal Technique

Ethan has a rare ability to 'Universalize' concepts from different traditions such as yoga, tai chi, chi gung, ancient Egypt, Kabbalah and modern science. The 108 Steps is very inspiring and describes the feeling of being in The Zone and how to get there.

~Manoj Chalam, Physicist and Metaphysics Yogi

Ethan's work on meditation achieves a level of rarefied quality so necessary to metaphysical writing and teaching. The 108 Steps is simple and profound, and rich in details and analogies that bring the inner truths of diverse traditions into usefulness in the present time. It is as simple as the profoundness of a child taking its first steps, the mathematical intricacies of numerology, astrology and ancient wisdom in Ethan's writing make entering this world of spiritual development an exciting and safe journey…

~Laura Peppard, Founder and Director of the Reno Psychic Institute

Ethan writes cold, hard and direct. He defines patriotism exactly, but more than that, Ethan explores reality thoroughly. The book is informative, inspiring and highly enlightening.

~Allah B, Nation of Gods and Earths, Harlem

“I enjoyed the Matrix of Four. Ethan’s excursions take you to fertile philosophical ground.”

~John S. Engstrom, President of Arthur Young’s Institute for the Study of Consciousness

a donation to my endeavors as an artist, healer and activist. Please also share
this with your local yoga studio, tai chi chuan group, bookstore, community
center, meditative group, ashram, radio program or whomever in your area that
might offer a place to exchange ideas as I go or otherwise support. If any of your
friends might consider supporting my endeavors to raise awareness of individual
consciousness and collective awareness of nuclear experimentation with whatever
you are able. I’m honored for you to read and share, I’m humbled and extremely grateful
for your financial contribution, connection, and assistance in any form. Thank
you, gratefully,
Ethan Indigo Smith

Here’s what some have said about Ethan Indigo Smith’s
writing:
Transport J. D. Salinger's Holden Caulfield to the 21st
century and you get the protagonist of The Terraist Letters. This rollicking
journey through NYC, juxtapositions the mainstream, the lamestream and the
out-of-stream as the Terraist heroes attempt to bring some sanity as well as
medicinal cheer to the urban zombies of today. Ethan's work will titillate,
irritate, but most importantly, stimulate some serious thought concerning
current conventions. Give it a read. Your brain might thank you.
~New York Times Best Selling author, groundbreaking researcher,
Jim Marrs 
It's (The Complete Patriot’s Guide) a book to read a few
pages at a time, and then contemplate for hours after. It's written as a
learning experience, the facts, quotes and ideas bundled together in a way
which leads to our own thoughts as the material moves on. I remember when 1984
was ushered in, wondering: "What next?" Ethan wondered as well, and
the results of his curiosity and writing, if not the answer, will lead to the
answer. 
~Deborah Meier, Senior Scholar NYU, founder of the modern
small schools movement
I found Ethan's writing extremely informative.  I liked it and it's interesting.
~Immortal Technique
Ethan has a rare ability to 'Universalize' concepts from
different traditions such as yoga, tai chi, chi gung, ancient Egypt, Kabbalah
and modern science. The 108 Steps is very inspiring and describes the feeling
of being in The Zone and how to get there.
~Manoj Chalam, Physicist and Metaphysics Yogi 
Ethan's work on meditation achieves a level of rarefied
quality so necessary to metaphysical writing and teaching. The 108 Steps is
simple and profound, and rich in details and analogies that bring the inner
truths of diverse traditions into usefulness in the present time. It is as
simple as the profoundness of a child taking its first steps, the mathematical
intricacies of numerology, astrology and ancient wisdom in Ethan's writing make
entering this world of spiritual development an exciting and safe journey…
~Laura Peppard, Founder and Director of the Reno Psychic
Institute
Ethan writes cold, hard and direct. He defines patriotism
exactly, but more than that, Ethan explores reality thoroughly. The book is
informative, inspiring and highly enlightening. 
~Allah B, Nation of Gods and Earths, Harlem
“I enjoyed the Matrix of Four. Ethan’s excursions take you
to fertile philosophical ground.”
~John S. Engstrom, President of Arthur Young’s Institute for
the Study of Consciousness

story:
Short Summary

Greetings! 

In 1990, the Zora Neale Hurston/Richard Wright Foundation was created as the only 501c3 organization of its kind to discover, develop and honor Black authors of fine literature, nonfiction, and poetry. 

Named after Zora Neale Hurston (Their Eyes Were Watching God) and Richard Wright (Native Son) - two literary icons from the Harlem Renaissance - Hurston/Wright has mentored and awarded hundreds of teen and adult writers across the country with workshops, financial awards and scholarships, writing competitions, and other in-kind support. 

2015 will make Hurston/Wright’s 25th year of service, and we're asking our many supporters, and fans of reading to celebrate with us by contributing towards this campaign to ensure the foundation’s fiscal strength.  

Help Hurston/Wright raise $25,000 towards another 25 years of great programs for the literary community, and launching our dream of creating literary and cultural center headquartered in Washington, D.C. for award-winning and aspiring Black writers. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • OUR GOAL: $25,000 - But, it's always great to surpass your goal ;-) 
  • YOUR GIFTS: $25 DONORS - Shoutouts on Hurston/Wright's Facebook, Twitter and Instagram sites. $50 DONORS - The social media shoutouts and an author signed copy of an autographed copy of It’s All Love: Black Writers on Soul Mates, Family and Friends - an anthology published by Broadway books to benefit the Hurston/Wright Foundation. $100 DONORS - The social media shoutouts and an author signed copy of  an autographed copy of It’s All Love and an autographed copy of Gumbo - an anthology of 73 Black writers edited by Marita Golden and E. Lynn Harris and published by Doubleday to benefit the Hurston/Wright Foundation.  $250 DONORS - The social media shoutouts and autographed copies of It’s All Love, Gumbo, and The Butler: A Witness to History by Wil Haygood.  $500 DONORS - The social media shoutouts and autographed copies of It’s All Love, Gumbo, The Butler, and Pulitzer-Prize winner, The Warmth of Other Suns The Epic Story of America’s Great Migration by Isabel Wilkerson and a ticket to attend The Hurston/Wright Legacy Awards Ceremony in October 2015. $1,000 DONORS - The social media shoutouts, autographed books, two tickets to The Hurston/Wright Legacy Awards Ceremony and 25th Anniversary Celebration in October 2015, and guest attendance at our Writers' Week panels, seminars and readings during July 2015. $5,000 DONORS - All of the above and four invitations to a special VIP dinner with the Hurston/Wright 2015 Legacy Awards honorees in October 2015.

Your Impact

  • Helping the Hurston/Wright Foundation celebrate its 25th anniversary and sustain its fiscal strength for years to come.
  • Supporting Hurston/Wright's dream of creating a literary and cultural space headquartered in Washington, D.C. that will be a home for the foundation's programs and events, and for Black writers creating , researching, and writing new work.
  • Providing monetary awards to talented college students who excel in writing engaging works of fiction and poetry.
  • Financially supporting a nonprofit that has honored literary greats such as Nikki Giovanni, Junot Diaz, Edward P. Jones, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Edwidge Danicat, Wil Haygood and Percival Everett. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family, friends and colleagues who love award-winning literature, nonfiction and poetry, and spread the word via Facebook and Twitter.

story:
I'm Cecilia. I'm an indie author under the pen name C. J. Brightley. I've published clean epic fantasy series, a darkish near-future  Christian fantasy series, a sweet fantasy romance novella series, and a fairytale adventure with a bit of romance. My author website is http://www.cjbrightley.com. I also run http://www.noblebright.org, a new site dedicated to promoting the best of noblebright fantasy.

Still Waters Anthology by Spring Song Press

Spring Song Press is my new publishing venture that will focus on fantasy anthologies, both Christian and secular. I will be the senior editor, and I have a talented cast of freelance editors and artists to help me produce the best anthologies possible. You can find the site and call for submissions at http://www.springsongpress.com.

C. S. Lewis wrote about fairy tales for children: Since it is so likely that they will meet cruel enemies, let them at least have heard of brave knights and heroic courage.

G. K. Chesterton wrote: Fairy tales, then, are not responsible for producing in children fear, or any of the shapes of fear; fairy tales do not give the child the idea of the evil or the ugly; that is in the child already, because it is in the world already. Fairy tales do not give the child his first idea of bogey. What fairy tales give the child is his first clear idea of the possible defeat of bogey. The baby has known the dragon intimately ever since he had an imagination. What the fairy tale provides for him is a St. George to kill the dragon.

These are the stories I write, and these are the stories I'm looking to publish through Spring Song Press. We will publish heroic, fantastic, beautiful, strange, heart-breaking, bittersweet, uplifting, clean, thought-provoking, weird, slipstream, magical works from talented authors both new and established.

Your contributions will make it possible.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will help fund our first anthology, Still Waters.

Our goal is $5,000, which will pay for:
  • Wraparound cover art
  • Payment to authors - I've self-funded the anthology to the lower end of the semi-pro pay range for short fiction (by Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America (SWFA) standards), but I'd like to pay my authors more! At $2000 funding, I will be able to double the payment to authors. At $3000 funding, I will be able to triple the payment to authors. If we hit $6000 funding, I will be able to pay professional rates. The authors have submitted knowing about the lower rate, so this would be a great surprise for them.
  • Content editing, layout, formatting
  • Copy editing
  • Print copies for supporters
  • Advertising for the retail launch

Any "extra" funds will go towards the authors, cover some of my time spent editing, and toward our next anthology!

Why use Indiegogo when I'm already established on Amazon and other sites? Well, upfront funding is always helpful, of course. :) The anthology will be available retail on Amazon and other sites. But by funding it ahead of time, you can get extra perks, get the anthology before it's on Amazon, AND contribute more! Even at the regular retail price of $5 for the ebook or $15 for the paperback, I'll give up less money in fees through Indiegogo than in a retail sale on Amazon.

Risks & Challenges

I've already received almost 50 submissions, with several more coming in each day and a few promised from some of my favorite authors. I'm confident this anthology will be wonderfully enjoyable!

I've pre-paid for the wraparound cover. I'll do the content editing and the majority of the copyediting, and then will have freelancers I trust make sure I haven't missed anything.

This anthology will happen! Please consider supporting it and helping us get noblebright fantasy into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or aren't ready to pitch in quite yet, you can still help! It would be super cool if you would:

  • Share the campaign using the handy dandy buttons,
  • Bookmark this campaign for later contribution,
  • Consider buying the anthology later when it's available for retail sale, and/or
  • Email the campaign to a friend who might be interested.

Thank you!

story:
You're invited to be a part of producing Cold Wax Medium: Techniques, Concepts & Conversations, the first comprehensive book exploring the many aspects of using cold wax.

This is an important moment for the many artists who are discovering the beauty and subtlety of cold wax medium. Until now, no comprehensive book has been available on the topic--one that covers in depth both the how and the why of creating with cold wax medium.  With the publication of our book, that is about to change. The book is co-authored by Rebecca Crowell, whose workshops and art have played a major role in the cold wax revival, and artist Jerry McLaughlin. More than just a technical guide, it provides essential information for artists who are new to cold wax, as well as inspiration and ideas for those already using it. This book represents a broad community: over 100 working artists from around the world have contributed images, ideas, and methods.

Rebecca began her work with cold wax over 15 years ago, and has taught hundreds of people in her highly regarded workshops. Over the years, many of these artists requested that she write a book. A year and a half ago Jerry's proposal to collaborate persuaded her, and we launched this project. Initially we planned a modest print-on-demand book with a few featured artists. However, so many people were excited about the project and eager to share their ideas and experiences that the book grew far beyond initial plans.  We are indebted to the cold wax community for the overwhelming support that has helped our vision grow. 

With your help, we now hope to honor this expanded vision of the book by publishing enough copies to meet the large demand we anticipate and to produce the most beautiful volume possible.

Here's what we anticipate the book will look like:

 


Here is a peek at Chapter 1 (unedited):

The book includes:

  • Waning and Waxing: The Story of Cold Wax Medium
  • Essentials: Materials and Tools of Cold Wax Painting
  • Substrates: From the Ground Up
  • About Ateliers: Studio Setup, Safety, and Cleanup
  • Alla Prima: Beginnings and Quick Paintings
  • Building History: Step by Step
  • The Elements of Art: Using Visual Language 
  • Inner Work: Your Personal Voice
  • Looking Outward: Referencing the Recognizable
  • Putting Things Together: Collage and Assemblage
  • Branching Out: Further Possibilities
  • It’s a Wrap: Finishing Steps
  • Conversations: Insights from Featured Artists

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to do an initial print run large enough for everyone interested to own a copy. If we do not reach our goal, we will only be able to print enough for our campaign contributors and featured artists. If we exceed our goal, we will use any additional funds to lower the retail price of the book and improve our overseas distribution (which is quite expensive).

Here is where your contributions will go: 

  • Book cover design $500
  • Overall graphic design $1,500
  • ISBN, copyright, & barcode $350
  • Editors $3,000
  • Insurance, legal fees $1,200
  • Office supplies, software, secure data storage $500
  • Professional fees $500
  • Travel $2,250
  • Printing and delivery of books $15,000
  • Crowdfunding fees (5%) + Credit card fees (3%) $2,150
  • TOTAL: $27,000
For contributing to our campaign, the perks include the following:
  • $800 - For $800 we are offering 4-day cold wax workshops at Rebecca's studio in Osseo, Wisconsin. These workshops will be taught by both Rebecca and Jerry. There are 6 spots available per date, and we have two dates available: May 11-14, 2017 and May 18-22, 2017. Contributors at this level also get an advanced copy of the book.
 

"Having Rebecca and Jerry both was terrific! They provided an in depth look that I don't believe could be found anywhere else!"  - Recent workshop participant
 
  • $200 - Contributors of $200 get an advanced copy of the book signed by both Rebecca and Jerry, their name in the book as a "Cold Wax Patron," and one pack each of notecards with Rebecca's and Jerry's artwork.

 

  • $100 - Everyone who contributes $100 will get an advanced copy of the book signed by both Rebecca and Jerry.

 

  • $60 - Everyone who contributes $60 will get an advanced copy of the book. 
NOTE: We anticipate delivery of advanced copies in December of this year. If we reach our goal, additional orders will be filled in early 2017. If we do not reach our goal, contributors of $60 or more will still get a book, but no additional copies will be available for sale.
 
  • $25 - For $25 you get 10 note cards and envelopes with artwork from your choice of either Rebecca or Jerry.
Rebecca:

Jerry:

 
  • $10-$24 - For $10-$24 you will experience the joy of knowing you helped us print a beautiful book that we can share with the world.

    Moving Forward

    We have put together a great team of people and have the support of dozens of artists. We have prepared as much as possible to make sure our project goes smoothly. From writing and artwork to design and production, everything is in place. The Cold Wax community is growing quickly, and this is a book people want!

    We have secured our printing costs and are using Toppan Printing, a well respected international printing company. Obviously, there can always be unforeseen issues with shipping and international transactions. While we do not anticipate any problems, these issues could delay arrival of the book into the US. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

       

      We do not have an advertising budget. So, we are relying on social media and word of mouth to make our campaign and project known. Please tell your friends to visit and share coldwaxbook.com on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest.

story:
My name is Suzi Peel. Actually, my two middle names will tell you more about my family: Giselle and Aurelia for my two grandmothers, who were married to Maurice and Joseph.

Maurice Louis Perlzweig was my grandfather – the only grandparent I really knew—and was a huge inspiration to me. He understood the rights of every person and worked hard to let everyone attain them. Dr. Perlzweig lived from 1895 to 1985 and is a model for those of us seeking to improve the world!

He recorded his autobiography, and I want to make it accessible widely: on a website, as a book and in talks. I want to make it easy to learn about his pioneering crusade for the rights of the Jews of Europe in the 20th Century, his founding role in the United Nations Human Rights Council and his work with Eleanor Roosevelt on the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

I am passionate about helping people reach their full potential. I am trained as a historian, I have been a teacher and mentor and trainer, and I am working in global public health. Please help me share his inspiring story.

What I Need & What You Get

•  I am seeking $8000 to cover the costs of my research, writing and above all the publication and dissemination of my grandfather’s autobiography. I have done much of the work already – the transcription of the many hours of recorded interviews. But I need to review every word and annotate every name to help modern readers fully grasp the magnitude of one Human Rights Hero’s work. The main cost will be printing and shipping the finished books.

•  There’s a list of perks – but feel free to tell me if I’ve missed the perk you really want most!

•  Even if I don't reach my entire goal for this campaign, your donations will support my finalization of the electronic version of the book and its dissemination to supporters, to schools, libraries and universities.

The Impact

I want to honor my grandfather. It is good to be reminded of how much a single person can accomplish through steady and focused work in the world.

Let's help others to learn about him, and about the start of the UN focus on Human Rights. Readers will be informed about one life during a critical time in our recent history, and inspired to make the most of their own lives.

The books of M.L. Perlzweig's autobiography will be disseminated by readers like you to others in your community. They will be donated to schools, libraries, universities where many readers can find them.

Your financial support will help this happen in the months ahead! Thank you.

Risks & Challenges

This endeavor might not strike readers at large as a glitzy new-new thing. I don’t expect my campaign to be featured by Indiegogo. What I do hope is that this Indiegogo campaign will be a way to reach activists, scholars, thinkers and doers around the world who will resonate with Human Rights and be curious about the early days.

Human Rights are the bedrock of what I have done and continue to do: teaching in poor migrant neighborhoods, advocating for children orphaned by AIDS and strengthening programs to assist them, and now improving health and health literacy among the underserved in Maryland, USA. As I write, human rights are being violated in the United States and around the world.

Having persisted through great challenges and persevered, I am confident that I will make this tribute to my grandfather, M.L. Perlzweig: Pioneer of Human Rights into reality with your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Please help get the word out and tell people about this campaign.

•  You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I hate asking for money. I hate asking for help. In fact, right now, I feel a lot like a homeless man begging on the street. And now I feel like a jerk for insinuating that homeless people are below me. That's not true! 

But I am pretty desperate. You see, I really want to take this writing class. It's held at UNT under the Creative Writing MFA program. I know- you don't know what that is. But it's like law school for writers with the top MFA programs even harder to get into than Harvard. I applied for six last, last Christmas and was amply rejected. Yay.

(Skip the dramatic, boo hoo, I'll never write again blah blah). Present day...

I applied to the  UNT grad school to take a course about behavior. When they actually agreed to let me take it (what? but I feel so undeserving) I decided hey, if emailing a professor can get me into one course then maybe...

I found a creative writing course under the MFA program, stalked the professor, sent him an email (Sir, pleeeaaaaasssseeeee), and prepared for the ensuing silence. He wrote me back (what?). He said the course was in fact restricted (of course) but (wait, but?) sometimes they made exceptions. He asked for a writing sample (ohhhh but all my writing has already been rejected and I'm a failed human being). Fine. What's one more rejection right? I sent him a sample. He replied giving me acceptance into the course!

I know I know, its not an MFA program, but it could lead to one right? And a lot of MFA programs are 100 percent covered. If I could just take this course, make some contacts, get some better writing samples...

Will you help? Pretty pretty please? If for no other reason than it's my birthday, you probably know me, you were going to buy me a present anyway, I was going to insist that you don't, you were going to get mad because you didn't know what to get me etc. 

Oh and also for the perks. Because I have to offer you perks on this site it seems...

story: I've been in my province for too long and have been away from my extended family who live in the maritimes. I've also been in an unhealthy/dysfunctional partnership for the past 7 or 8 months and have been living with my partner over the past 3-4 months (as I was running out of options). I've lost my sense of self through all the manipulation, head games, deceit and gas lighting and I just can't do this anymore. I've tried leaving her  before but, it didn't work. Even though she is currently gone (will be back February 10th) I just don't feel safe here and can't think straight. I want to get out out of this partnership, out of this apartment and ultimately to leave the city where I have been hurt the most. I want the chance to start over again to go to a city where I can heal go, to get therapy/counseling and recover from not only this experience but, the past hurts which have built up overtime. I want to get out of this place so I can get better, so I can be healthy. & one day help others and make a difference in the world. I need help getting out of this place: I need help to get better.

story:
Headmistress Press is an independent publisher of books of poetry by lesbians. Headmistress was born on January 1, 2013 and is lovingly run by your three dedicated mistresses, Mary Meriam, Risa Denenberg, and Rita Mae Reese. Headmistress Press is dedicated to honoring lesbian existence, discovering a range of lesbian voices, and promoting lesbian representation in the arts. We published three fabulous books in 2013 and five extraordinary books in 2014.  As we enter year three, we are feeling energetic and want to grow, grow, grow. In 2015, we intend to publish ten books of poetry, produce an amorous pack of 12 lesbian poet trading cards, introduce our first annual Charlotte Mew Chapbook Contest, and publish the anthology Lavender Review: Poems from the First Five Years. 

Whew, we are getting ambitious! We want your participation in our dreams! 

Who we are: We are lesbian poets! Our commitment as editors of Headmistress Press is an unpaid labor of love.

Mary Meriam, Headmistress Co-founder
Mary is the founder of Lavender Review, an international, biannual e-zine dedicated to poetry and art by, about, and for lesbians. She conceived of and birthed Headmistress Press and is our designer, editor, and publisher par excellence. She makes our gorgeous books.

Risa Denenberg, Headmistress Co-founder
Risa is a skilled editor, and our accounting and bookkeeping devotee.

Rita Mae Reese, Headmistress of Marketing
Rita Mae has recently joined the team of Headmistress bringing years of experience working for a lesbian press along with her to use as our marketing maven. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $3000 to develop and complete the following exciting projects in 2015:

1) Announcing: Lesbian poet trading cards!

Our goal is to produce a series of full-color, collector-worthy trading cards featuring a lesbian poet each month, displaying the poet’s photo, biography, and words. With so many wonderful poets to venerate, this is our way of paying tribute to past and present poets, whether self-identified as lesbian or not, whose work has not been promoted nearly enough. This project is our way of honoring lesbian existence, recognizing a range of lesbian voices, and promoting lesbian representation in the arts. We intend to produce cards for sale and as gifts to our supporters.

The money we raise with your help will allow us to print, safely package, and mail 100 Limited Edition sets of 12 Lesbian Poet Cards for 2015. We expect that sales of these cards will be seed money to continue with a series of 12 cards in 2016 and beyond. Be sure to get the jump on the first cards produced as your gift for donating to Headmistress! Imagine after 10 years of cards, how envied you will be to have series one!

2) Announcing: The First Annual Charlotte Mew Chapbook Contest!

Charlotte Mew  (1869-1928) was an English poet who has been nearly forgotten, although in her lifetime Virginia Woolf called her “the greatest living poetess.” Though tormented by poverty and fear of madness, she produced poems of great beauty and enormous passion. In line with our goal to honor the lesbian experience, Headmistress is introducing our First Annual Charlotte Mew Chapbook Contest in her honor. The 2015 contest will be a first contest for us and we are very excited about being able to offer a monetary prize to a lesbian poet. We will be accepting submissions starting in May 2015 and will announce a winner in the fall. Although we do charge a reading fee, we have always had a sliding scale ($8, $14, or $20), and no one will be turned away for lack of entrance fee.


The money raised with your help will allow us, for the first time, to offer a monetary prize to our contest winner and to pay an outside judge (wait until you hear who we have!) to pick the winning book. We use lesbian artists to grace the covers of our books, and in 2013 and 2014 we had no funds to pay for this amazing art. Lesbian artists deserve to be paid!

3) Announcing: For the first time in print: Lavender Review!

Headmistress Press is thrilled to be publishing Lavender Review: Poems from the First Five Years, edited by Mary Meriam, the creator and curator of Lavender Review. 

At its fifth anniversary, something special! Selections from this wonderful and beloved lesbian poetry and art e-zine will appear on Valentine's Day, 2015 in print! The 48 contributors to this anthology include renowned and new lesbian poets such as Mary Kathryn Arnold, O. Ayes, Hannah Baker-Siroty, Robin Becker, Nicole Brossard, J.K. Daniels, Risa Denenberg, Andrea Dulanto, Laura Foley, Suzanne Gardinier, Janice Gould, Judy Grahn, Alix Greenwood, Alyse Knorr, Joy Ladin, Eleanor Lerman, Colleen McKee, Marty McConnell, Holly Mitchell, Lesléa Newman, Minnie Bruce Pratt, Rita Mae Reese, Naomi Replansky, Rachel Rose, Sarah Sarai, and Ann Tweedy; plus translations of Marina Tsvetaeva, Renée Vivien, and Sappho; plus some poems from the past by Amy Lowell, Charlotte Mew, Sara Teasdale, and others; plus a few lesbian-friendly poems by straight and gay poets.

The money we raise with your help will cover the cost of mailing contributor copies to these very deserving poets!
Many thanks to Cris Williamson for permission 
to use her song "Sweet Woman" in our movie. 

Visit Headmistress Press! Like us on Facebook! Buy Headmistress Books!

story:
I'm writing this on what may be remembered as one of the most traumatic days in Scottish history - the day after we turned our back, for the time being at least, on the sovereign right to shape our own political future, and the day on which Alex Salmond announced his decision to step down as First Minister.  However, the months ahead are still full of opportunities as we seek to ensure that the London parties do not betray the panic-stricken "vow" they made to the Scottish people just before polling day.  If they do let us down, as they probably will, much will depend on whether the SNP can at last make a telling breakthrough on "away soil" at the UK general election in May.

In the months between now and the election, it's more important than ever that we have a strong alternative media in Scotland to put the pro-SNP case, because in the context of a UK-wide vote, the party is usually widely ignored by the London-based broadcast and print media.

Over the years, Scot Goes Pop has carved out a niche role in the pro-independence blogosphere, particularly due to its coverage of opinion polls.  It relentlessly challenged the agenda-driven misreporting of polls as supposedly showing that the Yes campaign were not even in the game.  

There will not be a huge number of full-scale Scottish polls before the general election, but there will be some, and with your help I hope to cover them as comprehensively as I have done the referendum polls.  When there aren't polls around, I'll go back to doing what I used to do - offer general commentary on the  political scene in Scotland, the UK, and further afield, and probably undertake the occasional 'fisking' of mainstream media commentators.

In case you don't know about me, my name is James Kelly, and I've written Scot Goes Pop for more than six years.  I've also written articles for the International Business Times, Political Betting, Wings Over Scotland, National Collective, Scottish Roundup, Fair Observer and the Eurovision Times.  Some of my IBTimes articles were syndicated on Yahoo News in the run-up to the referendum.

Since I ran the first fundraiser, I've practically been blogging full-time.  Even if I take my foot off the accelerator a little (as I'll probably have to), it just won't be possible to find the time to keep the blog going properly without a second fundraiser.  I'm setting an ambitious target of £5000, because that's the amount I think would just about be enough to keep things ticking over until May, and perhaps a little beyond.  But anything over and above that would be enormously helpful.

If the target is significantly exceeded, I'll be able to use some of the money on advertising.  In theory it might even be possible to commission our own poll, but that's unlikely because it would need the target to be exceeded by several thousand pounds.

As I said last time, if the fundraiser fails and only raises a small amount that can't possibly make any difference to my ability to keep the blog going, rest assured the money won't be wasted - I'll donate it to other pro-independence alternative media outlets.

I fully appreciate what a difficult time this is to be launching this initiative, when people are feeling heartbroken and have donated so much of their disposable income in an attempt to secure a Yes vote.  I feel the timing is unavoidable, though - I didn't want to do it before polling day and potentially divert money that might otherwise have gone to the Yes campaign, but if I wait even a few more days a golden opportunity may be lost, because for obvious reasons the current readership of the blog is much bigger than it has ever been before, or is ever likely to be again.

What I am going to do, however, is run this over a much longer timescale than last time (60 days) - so if you think you might want to donate but would rather wait a few weeks, feel free to do that.  And even if you're a regular reader, please don't feel under any pressure to donate AT ALL.  I regard you all as friends (with the exception of the trolls!), and that's far more valuable than any donation.

Now more than ever, let's stay strong.

story:
Gentle Hearts Service Dogs was created to provide specially trained and qualified Service Dogs to those families in need, with a particular focus on children with Autism. 

Gentle Hearts has and will continue to provide trained Service Dogs at "no cost" to these families. 

This will be achieved through the generous donations of caring people who understand that there are many expenses involved in raising, training and caring for these Service Dogs. 

My name is Gary DeGeronimo, founder and Director of Training for Gentle Hearts.  After 30 years in the world of canines, more than 15 of those years working with Service and Therapy Animals, my passion continues to assist those folks who will benefit from the love and dedication a Service Dog can bring.  For more on Gentle Hearts Service Dogs, go to Facebook Page "Gentle Hearts Service Dogs" or visit www.gentleheartsservicedogs.org. 

This Campaign will allow me to raise and train three Service Dogs that will change the life's of three families -- thank you for your consideration.

story:
English version 

TELL YOUR MEN THEY CAN SHOOT ME
Written by: Gian Marco Benedetto

"Tell your men they can shoot me" is not just a book, it is also an experiment in free culture to support conscientious objection to military service and war.
For almost nine months working with the solidarity of those who make possible the sharing of information.
This book was born with no producer / publisher behind.
Now to be realized, it also needs your help.

Translations, travel, study of the law, interviews, implementation and post-implementation make up the  book's cost. It should be collect at least the sum of € 3,800 to finalize everything and be able to breathe a sigh of relief before proceeding to the final distribution.

Any work of genius comes from stimuli that are the foundation of social life and relationships with others, as well as by the knowledge already acquired and consolidated from which each of us continually draws.
The author is opposed to "intellectual property" in a radical way and has no business project staff in order to produce a good traded.
So do not worry if you do not have great resources. Even a small donation can make a difference. Even just talking to a friend can be crucial. I invite you to share the campaign via the tools Indiegogo on your channels and social networks.

In return you will be able to print the book directly from home and bind it yourself if you want. you can download the E-book, or request a print copy, a public presentation by the author, a postcard of the book, the presence of your name in the credits for the construction of the whole.

And look at that at stake is much more than repay the work and effort of those who are presenting an independent project. It is possible to show that this route is viable and that the culture and information must move freely and not be used for war. As people in the Mediterranean.


Italian version

DICA PURE AI SUOI CHE POSSONO SPARARMI
Written by: Gian Marco Benedetto

"Dica pure ai suoi che possono spararmi" non è solo un libro, è anche un esperimento di cultura libera per sostenere l'obiezione di coscienza al servizio militare e alla guerra.
Da ormai nove mesi funziona grazie alla solidarietà di chi rende possibile la condivisione delle informazioni. Questo libro è nato senza nessun produttore/editore alle spalle.
Ora per essere realizzato, ha bisogno anche del vostro aiuto.

Traduzioni, spostamenti, studio delle normative, interviste, realizzazione e post-realizzazione del libro costano. Si deve raccogliere almeno la cifra di 3.800 € per ultimare tutto e poter tirare un sospiro di sollievo prima di procedere alla definitiva diffusione. 

Una qualsiasi opera d'ingegno scaturisce dagli stimoli che sono alla base del vivere sociale e delle relazioni con gli altri, oltreché dal sapere già acquisito e consolidato dal quale ognuno di noi continuamente attinge.
L'autore si oppone alla "proprietà intellettuale" in maniera radicale e non presenta alcun progetto di business personale al fine di produrre un bene oggetto di commercio. Non preoccupatevi dunque se non avete grandi risorse. Anche una piccola donazione può fare la differenza. Anche solo parlarne con un amico può essere fondamentale. Ti invito a condividere la campagna tramite i tools di Indiegogo e sui tuoi canali e social network.

In cambio potrai stampare il libro direttamente da casa e rilegarlo tu stesso se vorrai. potrai fare il download dell'eb-ook, o richiedere una stampa cartacea, una presentazione pubblica con l'autore, una cartolina del libro, la presenza del vostro nome nei ringraziamenti per la realizzazione del tutto.

E guardate che in ballo c'è molto di più del ripagare il lavoro e lo sforzo di chi sta presentando un progetto indipendente. C'è la possibilità di dimostrare che questa via è percorribile e che la cultura e le informazioni devono circolare liberamente e non servire per fare la guerra. Come le persone nel Mediterraneo.

“Tell your men they can shoot me” sadece bir kitap değil, aynı zamanda zorunlu askerlik ve savaş karşıtı vicdani reddi desteleyen bir free culture denemesi.
Bu kitap çalışması bilgilerini cömertçe paylaşmaktan çekinmeyen insanların destekleri sayesinde, yaklaşık dokuz aydır devam ediyor. 
Bu kitap arkasında herhangi bir yapımcı / yayıncı desteği olmaksızın yayınlanacaktır. Ve tabi ki tanınması ve yaygınlaşması için sizlerin yardımına ihtiyaç duymaktadır. Çeviriler, yolculuk masrafları, hukuki çalışmalar, röportajlar, kitabın yazım ve yazım sonrası çalışmaları… Her şeyin bitirilmesi ve nihai dağıtıma girmeden önce rahat bir nefes alınabilmesi için toplamda en az 3.800 € tutarında bir meblağın toplanması gerekiyor.
Tüm yaratıcı işler, sosyal hayatın ve toplumsal ilişkilerin temelini oluşturan dürtülerden olduğu kadar her birimizin sürekli yararlandığı mevcut ortak bilgilerden de ortaya çıkar. 
Yazar “fikri mülkiyet” denilen kavrama kökten karşı çıkmakta olup herhangi bir ticari kaygı gütmemektedir. Bu nedenle katkı sağlayacak kişilerin çok fazla kaynak ayıramamaktan endişe etmelerine gerek yok. Çok küçük miktarlardaki bağışlar bile büyük farklar yaratabilir. Hatta sadece bir arkadaşınızla bu kitap hakkında konuşmanız bile son derece önemli bir katkı sağlayacaktır. 
Herkesi, Indiegogo.com sitesi üzerinden  başlatılan bu kampanyayı arkadaşlarına ve sosyal ağlarındaki insanlara duyurmaya davet ediyoruz. 
Bunun karşılığında destekçiler kitabı evlerinde doğrudan indirebilecek ve isterlerse ciltletebileceklerdir. E-kitap olarak indirebilecekler ya da basılı bir kopyasını, yazarın kitap tanıtımını ve kitap için tasarlanan bir posta kartını talep edebileceklerdir. Ayrıca tüm katılımcıların adları hazırlanacak olan teşekkür listesinde yer alacak. Burada nelerin söz konusu olduğunun anlaşılabilmesi, bağımsız bir proje ortaya koyan kişilerin çaba ve gayretleri için onlara maddi katkıda bulunulmasından çok daha önemlidir. Bunun geçerli bir yol olduğunu, kültür ve bilginin tıpkı Akdeniz insanları gibi serbestçe dolaşması ancak savaşlar için kullanılmaması gerektiğini göstermek mümkündür.

Li ser vê yekê ji bo ku bê te nasîn û zanîn benda alîkariya we ye. Wergera wê, lêçûnên rê, xebatên hiquqî, hevpeyvînên wê, xebatên pêş û paşîn.. û hwd. Ji bo ku bê te çap kirin û belav kirin de herî kêm pêdivî bi 3.800 € heye.
Wekê hemû karên din de, her çiqas pewistî bi têkiliyên civakî hebe jî ew qas pewistî bi zanînên hevpar jî heye ku mirov jê sûd werbigre.
Nivîskar bi tundî hemberê têgeha ''xwedaniya ramanê'' derdikeve. story:
STRETCH GOAL TIME!!!

GOAL: $16,000

At $16,000 we’ll be able to commission a hand bound gift edition of one copy ofStories for Chip to be presented to Mr. Delany.



Rosarium Publishing, established in 2013 by Bill Campbell to give voice to exciting writers of fiction, comics, and graphic novels, is honored to present its latest project: Stories for Chip: A Tribute to Samuel R. Delany. 


Samuel R. Delany is one of the icons of sf, one of the genre's great stylistic innovators whose brilliant achievements illuminate a path forward for all writers, but especially those of us who are queer and African-American. He has won four Nebula awards and two Hugos. He is a Science Fiction and Fantasy Hall of Fame inductee and a Science Fiction Writers of America Grandmaster. He remains one of literature's greatest living critics as well, his nonfiction serving to validate the seriousness of sf in the eyes of the larger literary community. Generations of readers of all backgrounds (as this collection demonstrates) hold him in great esteem for different reasons: some readers are awed by his novels, including Babel-17, Nova, and Dhalgren; some know him for his works of nonfiction such as The Jewel-Hinged Jaw and The Motion of Light in Water; some--storied writers such as Octavia E. Butler--as a professor and mentor who kickstarted their careers. He has judged the National Book Award, been the subject of an award-winning documentary (The Polymath, or The Life and Opinions of Samuel R. Delany, Gentleman, 2007).  Delany has been a unique presence in the literary community for over 50 years.


Editors Nisi Shawl and Bill Campbell have gathered together an exciting array of fiction and incisive essays by over 30 acclaimed and award-winning authors, including Geoff Ryman, Nalo Hopkinson, Eileen Gunn, Nick Harkaway, and Junot Díaz, plus rising stars of astonishing power and creativity. Over three-quarters of the 150,000 words contained in this volume are original to the book. Amazingly diverse along multiple axes, Stories for Chip is a fitting tribute to Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America Grand Master Samuel R. Delany, a genius who never met a boundary he didn't challenge.


WHAT WE NEED

Our goal is to raise $10,000.  This is the minimum amount that will allow us to cover the costs of the book's publication, including paying authors a decent rate for their work. 

THE STRETCH GOAL

At $16,000 we’ll be able to commission a hand bound gift edition of one copy of Stories for Chip to be presented to Mr. Delany.


THE TEAM

Nisi Shawl’s collection, Filter House, was one of two winners of the 2009 James Tiptree, Jr. Award. Her work has been published at Strange Horizons, in Asimov’s SF Magazine, and in anthologies including Dark Matter, The Moment of Change, Dark Faith 2, and The Other Half of the Sky. Nisi was WisCon 35’s Guest of Honor. She edited The WisCon Chronicles 5: Writing and Racial Identity and Bloodchildren: Stories by the Octavia E. Butler Scholars, and she co-edited Strange Matings: Octavia E. Butler, Science Fiction, Feminism, and African American Voices with Dr. Rebecca Holden. With classmate Cynthia Ward, Nisi co-authored Writing the Other: A Practical Approach. She is a co-founder of the Carl Brandon Society and serves on the Board of Directors of the Clarion West Writers Workshop. Her website is www.nisishawl.com.


Bill Campbell is the author of Sunshine Patriots, My Booty Novel, Pop Culture: Politics, Puns, "Poohbutt" from a Liberal Stay-at-Home Dad, and the hip-hop satire, Koontown Killing Kaper. Along with Edward Austin Hall, he co-edited the groundbreaking anthology, Mothership: Tales from Afrofuturism and Beyond. His forthcoming projects include the comic book anthology, APB: Artists against Police Brutality, which he is co-editing with Jason Rodriguez and John Jennings and, along with Ashley A. Woods, the comic book series, Baaaad Muthaz: A Spaceploitation Extravaganza. Campbell lives in Washington, DC, where he spends his time with his family, helps produce audio books for the blind, and helms Rosarium Publishing. @RosariumBill


THE TABLE OF CONTENTS

Introduction by Kim Stanley Robinson

Eileen Gunn   Michael Swanwick and Samuel R. Delany at the Joyce Kilmer Service Area, March 2005

Nick Harkaway  Billy Tumult

devorah major   Voice Prints

Isiah Lavender, III   Daily Encounters: Or, Another Reason Why I Study Race and Racism in Science Fiction

Anil Menon   Clarity

Ellen Kushner   When Two Swordsmen Meet

Chesya Burke  For Sale: Fantasy Coffin (Ababuo Need Not Apply)

Haralambi Markov   Holding Hands with Monsters

Carmelo Rafala   Song for the Asking 

Kit Reed   Kickenders

Walidah Imarisha   Walking Science Fiction: Samuel Delany and Visionary Fiction

Alex Jennings   Heart of Brass

Claude Lalumière   Empathy Evolving as a Quantum of Eight-Dimensional Perception

Jewelle Gomez   Be Three

Ernest Hogan   Guerrilla Mural of a Siren's Song

Hal Duncan   An Idyll in Erewhyna

L. Timmel Duchamp   Real Mothers, a Faggot Uncle, and the Name of the Father: Samuel R. Delany's Feminist Revisions of the Story of SF

Junot Díaz   Nilda

Benjamin Rosenbaum   The First Gate of Logic

Thomas M. Disch   The Master of the Milford Altarpiece

Sheree Renée Thomas   River Clap Your Hands

Roz Clarke   Haunt-type Experience

Fábio Fernandes   Eleven Stations

Kai Ashante Wilson   "Legendaire"

Michael Swanwick   On My First Reading of The Einstein Intersection

Kathryn Cramer   Characters in the Margins of a Lost Notebook

Vincent Czyz   Hamlet's Ghost Sighted in Frontenac, KS

Tenea D. Johnson   Each Star a Sun to Invisible Planets

Alex Smith   Clones

Geetanjali Dighe   The Last Dying Man

Geoff Ryman   Capitalism in the 22nd Century

Nalo Hopkinson & Nisi Shawl   Jamaica Ginger

Chris Brown  Festival


THE PERKS

Aside from the perks you see to the right, over twenty authors have contributed their own unique rewards for this campaign. Because of the limit of perks you can display on this page, we will be rotating the Author Rewards throughout the campaign. Please mark when your favorite author's perk appears. This is first-come/first-serve so you have to stay on your toes.


April 20

Junot Díaz

Nicola Griffith

Andrea Hairston

Ellen Kushner

Haralambi Markov

Tobias Buckell

Mary Robinette Kowal

Geoff Ryman

May 15

Chris Brown

N.K. Jemisin

Jonathan Lethem

Anil Menon

Michael Swanwick

Sheree Renée Thomas


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know that not everyone can contribute. That is totally understandable. However, you can help by signal boosting and spreading the word. Please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for your support. It is greatly appreciated.


P.S.: There's a fancy word for what we want to give Delany. It's called "Festschrift!"  

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Festschrift

Our goal is to raise $10,000.  This is the minimum amount that will allow us to cover the costs of the book's publication, including paying authors a decent rate for their work. 
THE STRETCH GOAL
At $16,000 we’ll be able to commission a hand bound gift edition of one copy of Stories for Chip to be presented to Mr. Delany.
THE TEAM


Nisi Shawl’s collection, Filter House, was one of two winners of the 2009 James Tiptree, Jr. Award. Her work has been published at Strange Horizons, in Asimov’s SF Magazine, and in anthologies including Dark Matter, The Moment of Change, Dark Faith 2, and The Other Half of the Sky. Nisi was WisCon 35’s Guest of Honor. She edited The WisCon Chronicles 5: Writing and Racial Identity and Bloodchildren: Stories by the Octavia E. Butler Scholars, and she co-edited Strange Matings: Octavia E. Butler, Science Fiction, Feminism, and African American Voices with Dr. Rebecca Holden. With classmate Cynthia Ward, Nisi co-authored Writing the Other: A Practical Approach. She is a co-founder of the Carl Brandon Society and serves on the Board of Directors of the Clarion West Writers Workshop. Her website is www.nisishawl.com.


Bill Campbell is the author of Sunshine Patriots, My Booty Novel, Pop Culture: Politics, Puns, "Poohbutt" from a Liberal Stay-at-Home Dad, and the hip-hop satire, Koontown Killing Kaper. Along with Edward Austin Hall, he co-edited the groundbreaking anthology, Mothership: Tales from Afrofuturism and Beyond. His forthcoming projects include the comic book anthology, APB: Artists against Police Brutality, which he is co-editing with Jason Rodriguez and John Jennings and, along with Ashley A. Woods, the comic book series, Baaaad Muthaz: A Spaceploitation Extravaganza. Campbell lives in Washington, DC, where he spends his time with his family, helps produce audio books for the blind, and helms Rosarium Publishing. @RosariumBill

story:
Buck's Landing

Hi. I'm Cameron Garriepy, author of the forthcoming contemporary romance, Buck's Landing.

I'm an author and fiction blogger, as well as a managing editor for Write on Edge.

I have previously published a YA/Fantasy novella and two short stories. You can find out more about those on my Amazon Author's Page.

Whether it's Shakespeare, Jane Austen, or Nora Roberts, love stories are my passion. As an author, my greatest pleasure is connecting directly with my readers, which is why I am choosing to self-publish this book. However, to paraphrase a popular saying, it takes a village to self-publish a novel, and that's why I'm asking for your help. Contributing to this campaign will make it possible for a hardworking author to persue her dreams.

About the Book:

Buck's Landing is a summer romance set on the New Hampshire seasoast. It is the first of a proposed quartet of New England seacoast novels, each exploring a different seaside community and season.

After her father's untimely death, Sofia Buck has returned to her hometown to run his mini-golf and vacation rental business, Buck's Landing, for the summer. She left Hampton Beach, and the misery of her widowed father's alcoholism, ten years ago, vowing to never return. She wants nothing more than to fulfill her obligations and get out of town, until her next door neighbor throws a wrench in her plans.

Silas Wilde walked away from a lucrative but soul-crushing career, determined to live life on his own terms. Hampton Beach called to him, and running a convenience-slash-gift shop on the boardwalk suits him just fine. He didn't realize his new life was missing something until he met Sofia.

As July turns into August, their chemistry sizzles and their emotions tangle, but their goals pull them in different directions.

Is the potential for happiness enough to banish Sofia's demons? Is a summer romance enough to satisfy Silas's desires?

The opening lines, as well as excerpts about Sofia and Silas are available on my blog.

What I Need & What You Get

The funding I receive from this campaign will go towards:

  • Paying a professional editor to work through the manuscript with me. This is the primary financial goal. The editor I'm hoping to hire is a fellow writer and freelance editor. I encourage you to check out Roxanne Piskel's writing and her freelance editing business.
  • Upfront pre-launch promotional costs, ie: design and layout, and public relations. Additional funds will assist with the hidden costs of a successful indie publishing endeavor.

The perks:

  • your name in the acknowledgements!
  • ebooks!
  • signed paperback copies!
  • chances to appear as a character in the novel!

See the Perks section for more detail.

Can't Contribute? You Can Still Contribute!

I appreciate any and all support, including:

    • Sharing this campaign online via Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.
    • Spreading the word in real life.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
I



Hope... is something that all living creatures cling to when they are desperate. Like the frenzied animal with it's leg caught in a trap desperately thinking that the next pull of its leg, no matter how painful, will bring freedom. But unfortunately, hope like everything else in this desolate unforgiving world, can easily wither away for even the strongest of will.

Hardak is what they call this place. A fitting name for a desert with no sand. Blown away years ago by the high winds of the night. All that remains is sun baked hard pan with the occasional clusters of sharp gutting rock that look like the teeth of a giant buried monstrosity.

It is in these harsh elements we find a gang of hardened thugs transporting a bounty in the form of human cargo. Kidnapping, once a harshly punished crime now goes unnoticed and even rewarded at this time of year.

Bound by their wrists and tethered to the back of a caravan, this group of newly captured slaves have listened to the music like repetition of the caravan's wheels and horses hooves beating the path for several long days. With the only break in rhythm being the occasional bark of an order or painful crack of the whip. This is why one of the slaves found it so strange to hear a faint but clearly audible "Pssst!".

Slowly lifting his head, careful not to catch the unwanted attention of his captors, the slave searches for the source of the sound. But not one person, slave or slaver was looking in his direction. Just when he was beginning to think that what he heard was a figment of his exhausted mind. Asham catches a glance from the female slave next to him.

In a hushed tone she whispers into the dust. "I overheard them say..." pausing to look around to make sure none else will hear her. "...that we're almost there." Having traveled for several days without being given so much as a drop of water. Asham's exhausted mind couldn't help but ask "Almost where?" Mouthing the words “Hardak's captial: ...“ the 2nd part of the sentence was viciously interrupted by the unmistakable sound of a whip loudly cracking through the air towards the female slave.

An arc of blood instantly sprayed from her back through her ragged clothes where the whip struck her across the back. Her scream: a piercing sound loud enough to make him want to cover his ears. Though he would never get the chance as the crack of a 2nd whip instantly sends Asham to a world of blackness as the female slave's scream echos in his unconsciousness mind.





II


Caught in between this world and the land of dreams, Asham struggles to make sense of the confusion inside his head. His mind, slowly awakening, is telling him what he sees before his eyes must be a dream. But what if it wasn't, he tells himself. What if his parents were actually still alive. That their gruesome death was only a dream.

Euphoric happiness and profound relief fills inside of him as he lets this thought soak in. Yes! They really are still alive! Then it begins to fade. Strange muted sounds seem to come from nowhere. Like the sound of a dozen soldiers putting on armor at the same time. Dread begins to creep in. His parents faces fade, replaced with the blurry outline of a female figure holding a water skin in hand and shaking him with the other.

”Get up!” the female slave yells into his damaged ear. “The guards are coming right now!” Struggling to his feet Asham only has enough time to notice a gate before him opening, and the gleaming walls stocked with weapons and armor, just like the people standing around him. When he hears a strange male voice filled with twisted laughter bellow "IT'S SHOWTIME!" followed by a violent shove from behind. The force of the push sends Asham flying forward out of the darkness and into the all too bright sunlight, landing hard on his hands and knees.

 


III


Confusion and pain are all that Asham feels as the crowd of soldiers run past or trample over him as they rush into the arena screaming battle cries with weapons held high. However their brave cries quickly become silenced as each man comes to a dead stop with their jaw hanging open. Towering before them behind a half opened gate, is a creature that could only be described as a giant grotesque one horned mutant bull. With what Asham had mistaken for injuries on the beast actually serve to protective it. As its upper limbs, shoulders, and parts of its back are all covered in what look like protruding bone. The crowd inside the circular shaped arena cheer madly with each kill delivered by the beast, punctuated with “Ooooooh's” and “Ahhhhhh's” for each significant strike landed by a slave. Asham's strategy of not making any sudden moves to attract the attention of the beast has paid off so far, in the fact that he's still alive while several more dead slaves lie in pools of blood.

But he knows that time is short. For the devil sends the beast with wrath. Now with time to think, to clear the memories from his mind, a calmness envelopes Asham. Time seems to slow down. The crowd changes from a hazy blur to distinct individual faces that cannot hold his gaze when he looks upon them. He even catches a glimpse of a pair of sparkling eyes behind a large gate shrouded in darkness, that could only belong to the female slave who helped him moments earlier. Without a hint of fear Asham stands up in plain sight and looks across the arena directly into the eye of the beast preparing to take his life.

 



IV

[Asham vs. mutant bull not included]


V


Apart from the fact that he was carried down into and across the arena while resting on pillows. Asham could clearly see he was a clergy man of importance or possibly their high leader simply by the attire he wore. Adorned in regal robes and the tallest and most impressive crown which sparkled brilliantly from the jewel encrusted three pronged symbol at its center, which also formed the same shape at the head of the short scepter in his hand.

But it was none of these features that made him most striking. For this man being carried on pillows had no legs from the crotch down, no ears, no left arm, and of what remained of him not covered by this robes was covered in numerous scars.

Arriving at the edge of the large pit located at the center of the arena. The high leader takes a moment to look upon the frenzied crowd. Ever so gently with the slightest gesture of raising his one remaining arm the crowd drops to a hush.

"Faithful citizens of Hardak. I thank you for your honor and patronage in these troubled times.” It pleases the speaker to see his citizens nod their head in agreement and obedience. “With this world forcing greater and greater hardships upon you on a daily basis, it is with even greater importance that we continue our sacred but arduous tradition of sacrifice.” Both the speaker and the crowd begin to build in volume. But it is the gleam of the small blade the speaker is now holding out in front of him that has the crowd in a near hypnotic state. “From the blackness shall rise the light!” His voice unnaturally growing louder than the massive crowd. “Sacrifice is the path to life!” With slightly shaking hands the speaker raises the shining blade ever higher, and bellows in a thunderous voice “Welcome... to... THE OFFERING!" as he plunges the blade directly into his chest and collapses.

 

__________

story:
Our Story

Our Story


Prostibulo Poetico is a multi lingual poetry experience which has been internationally recognized and most recently listed by the Guardian as one of the 10 best art spots in Barcelona. Prostibulo Poetico is in partnership with The Poetry Brothel, Poetry Society of New York, LLC, whose mission is to expand both poets’ and non-poets’ personal, intellectual and fiscal interest in poetry through performances, workshops, publications, and other projects. Prostibulo Poetico developed in early 2009 as a performance art event aimed at fostering intimacy, urgency and exaltation within the Barcelona poetry community, and at expanding that community to include a more diverse population. Today it provides a structure and set of values that unite communities of poets all over the world, poets who are committed to experiencing and expressing poetry in an personal way—a way that is more true to the nature of poetry itself.


Based on the concept of the prewar brothels in the United States and Europe, many of which functioned as safe havens for the fledgling, avant-garde artists of the times, Prostibulo Poetico, like the Poetry Brothel events present both male and female, emerging and established poets. The creation of character, as both disguise and freeing device, enables the Prostibulo Poetico to be a place of uninhibited creative expression, for poets and audience alike. Each poet, under an alias, offers the intimacy of his or her original poetry in one-on-one readings for a fee. Recognizing that poets undervalue themselves in the creative marketplace, Prostibulo Poeticol hopes to confirm both for writers and the public the literal monetary value of such vital work. Since its inception Prostibulo Poetico has thrown off three major branches—Venezuela, Los Angeles, and Chicago—and inspired several satellite poetry brothel events in Belfast, Ireland; Leister, England; London, England; Oaxaca, Mexico; Auckland, New Zealand; Seattle, Washington; Portland, Oregon; and Akron, Ohio. Given the high level of interest in the project, The Poetry Brothel is taking steps to expand its reach by establishing bases of operation throughout the world.


Presently, we are only $2000,1700Euro away from meeting our fundraising goal for launching.  Libro Rojo ed. 3, a collection of poems by the poets of the Prostibulo. Every dollar helps. To donate even as little as $5 would be to support an innumerable number of poets and artists in this area.


Prostibulo Poetico thanks you from the bottom of its collective heart for your generous support. We cannot grow without your contributions and genuinely hope to meet you at an upcoming event. 





The Impact

People who cannot physically be here in Barcelona and want to support our writers will still be able to experience  their poetry through a physical form of a book, that being Libro Rojo. If we do not meet our goal we will keep moving forward and host as many events as we can to be able to fund our project. In any case, we look forward to bringing you the best poetry that Barcelona can offer. If you would like to receive any further information about our events or poets please feel free to email us at prostibulopoetico@gmail






Or visit our website at www.prostibulopoetico.com 


What We Need & What You Get 

5 dollars gets you your name listed on our blog. 1 free reading at any Barcelona or Madrid event. And our sincerest gratitude.

10 dollars 2 free readings. A personally signed postcard from the Madame of the Prostibulo.

25 dollars 2 free readings and 2 free admissions at the Barcelona brothel as well as a signed postcard and poem from the Madame of the Prostibulo.

50 gets you all previous awards, plus our book, Libro Rojo.

100 gets you all previous awards plus an autographed photo

200 gets you all previous awards plus a poem by the Madame

500 gets you all previous awards and a copy of Cabaret Desire by Erika Lust.

1000 or more.  We will invite you to a dinner with the poets from our Barcelona branch and read you poems all night.  If you are not located in Barcelona we will  send care package that includes something handmade by each poet.  

Nuestra Historia

 

El Prostíbulo Poético es una experiencia poética multilingüe que ha sido reconocida internacionalmente, recientemente fue incluida por el periódico The Guardian como una de los 10 mejores eventos/lugares artísticos en Barcelona. El Prostíbulo Poético está asociado a The Poetry Brothel, Sociedad de Poetas de Nueva York, LLC, cuya misión es expandir el interés personal, intelectual y fiscal en la poesía a través de actuaciones, talleres, publicaciones y otros proyectos. El Prostíbulo Poético se desarrolló a principios del 2009 como un evento de performance art con la intención de traer intimidad, urgencia y exaltación entre la comunidad poética de Barcelona y para aumentar ese grupo con gente más diversa. Hoy en día proporciona una estructura y una serie de valores que unen a comunidades de poetas de todo el mundo, poetas comprometidos con experimentar y expresar la poesía de una forma más personal – una forma más fiel a la propia naturaleza de la poesía.

 

Basado en el concepto de los burdeles de antes de la Segunda Guerra Mundial en Estados Unidos y Europa que fueron refugio de los artistas de vanguardia de esa época, el Prostíbulo Poético, como en los eventos del Poetry Brothel, introduce a poetas noveles y establecidos de ambos sexos. La creación de un personaje como disfraz y elemento liberador permite al Prostíbulo Poético ser un sitio de creación desinhibido, tanto para los poetas como para el público. Cada poeta, bajo un alias, ofrece la intimidad de sus propios textos originales por un precio. Reconociendo que los poetas se suelen infravalorar en el mercado creativo el Prostíbulo Poético espera confirmar tanto para los poetas como para el público el valor monetario real de tal trabajo vital. Desde su origen el Prostíbulo Poético ha inspirado a tres nuevos grupos – en Venezuela, Los Ángeles y Chicago – así como eventos en Belfast, Irlanda; Leicester, Inglaterra; Londres, Inglaterra; Oaxaca, México; Auckland, Nueva Zelanda; Seattle, Washington; Portland, Oregon; y Akron, Ohio. Dado el gran interés en el proyecto, el Prostíbulo Poético está tomando los pasos necesarios para incrementar su alcance estableciendo nuevas bases de operaciones en todo el mundo.

Our Story





Our Story

Prostibulo Poetico is a multi lingual poetry experience which has been
  internationally recognized and most recently listed by the Guardian as one of
  the 10 best art spots in Barcelona. Prostibulo Poetico is in partnership with
  The Poetry Brothel, Poetry Society of New York, LLC, whose mission is to
  expand both poets’ and non-poets’ personal, intellectual and fiscal interest
  in poetry through performances, workshops, publications, and other projects.
  Prostibulo Poetico developed in early 2009 as a performance art event aimed
  at fostering intimacy, urgency and exaltation within the Barcelona poetry
  community, and at expanding that community to include a more diverse
  population. Today it provides a structure and set of values that unite
  communities of poets all over the world, poets who are committed to
  experiencing and expressing poetry in an personal way—a way that is more true
  to the nature of poetry itself.

Based on the concept of the prewar brothels in the United States and
  Europe, many of which functioned as safe havens for the fledgling,
  avant-garde artists of the times, Prostibulo Poetico, like the Poetry Brothel
  events present both male and female, emerging and established poets. The
  creation of character, as both disguise and freeing device, enables the
  Prostibulo Poetico to be a place of uninhibited creative expression, for
  poets and audience alike. Each poet, under an alias, offers the intimacy of
  his or her original poetry in one-on-one readings for a fee. Recognizing that
  poets undervalue themselves in the creative marketplace, Prostibulo Poeticol
  hopes to confirm both for writers and the public the literal monetary value
  of such vital work. Since its inception Prostibulo Poetico has thrown off
  three major branches—Venezuela, Los Angeles, and Chicago—and inspired several
  satellite poetry brothel events in Belfast, Ireland; Leister, England;
  London, England; Oaxaca, Mexico; Auckland, New Zealand; Seattle, Washington;
  Portland, Oregon; and Akron, Ohio. Given the high level of interest in the project,
  The Poetry Brothel is taking steps to expand its reach by establishing bases
  of operation throughout the world.

Presently, we are only $2000,1700Euro away from meeting our fundraising goal
  for launching.  Libro Rojo ed. 3, a collection of poems by the poets of
  the Prostibulo. Every dollar helps. To donate even as little as $5 would be
  to support an innumerable number of poets and artists in this area.

Prostibulo Poetico thanks you from the bottom of its collective heart
  for your generous support. We cannot grow without your contributions and
  genuinely hope to meet you at an upcoming event. 




The Impact
People who cannot physically be here
  in Barcelona and want to support our writers will still be able to experience
   their poetry through a physical form of a book, that being Libro Rojo.
  If we do not meet our goal we will keep moving forward and host as many
  events as we can to be able to fund our project. In any case, we look forward
  to bringing you the best poetry that Barcelona can offer. If you would like
  to receive any further information about our events or poets please feel free
  to email us at prostibulopoetico@gmail





Or visit our website at www.prostibulopoetico.com

  Get 
5 dollars
  gets you your name listed on our blog. 1 free reading at any Barcelona or
  Madrid event. And our sincerest gratitude. 
10
  dollars 2 free readings. A personally signed postcard from the Madame of the
  Prostibulo. 
25
  dollars 2 free readings and 2 free admissions at the Barcelona brothel as well
  as a signed postcard and poem from the Madame of the Prostibulo. 
50 gets you all
  previous awards, plus our book, Libro Rojo.
100 gets you all
  previous awards plus an autographed photo
200 gets you all
  previous awards plus a poem by the Madame
500 gets you all
  previous awards and a copy of Cabaret Desire by Erika Lust. 
1000
  or more.  We will invite you to a dinner with the poets from our
  Barcelona branch and read you poems all night.  If you are not located
  in Barcelona we will  send care package that includes something handmade
  by each poet.
