story:
Story of My Book

Trigger Warning is a poetry book designed to show anyone out there who is going through a rough patch that there is always someone out there who understands and can help them.

 

My name is Harley Vaughn and I am the author of Trigger Warning. I wrote this book because I, along with many others around me, have battled depression and abuse in my past. I never had the courage to ask for the help I needed, so I am sharing my voice to push others to talk about what is going on in their lives and to seek recovery.

 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that though you feel alone or lost, there are others out there who have been through these battles as well. You will also find that it is possible to get help and get better. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for reaching out. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find your voice and reach out to those around you for the help you need.

 

In this book, you'll learn about personal battles and seeking recovery:

  • Love and Loss and how they can contribute in the downward spiral of our mental health
  • Depression, sexual and physical assault, along with other battles, and how it changes our outlooks on life
  • Finding the courage to say that you are not okay and how to go about recovering

You will love this book if you have dealt, are dealing, or know someone who has had these issues in their life. Trigger Warning is a poetry book that speaks to teens and young adults who are looking at depression and recovery for the first time.

 

The Book - Trigger Warning

The book is written in 4 Parts.

 

Part 1 contains the introduction and Poems 1-5. In the introduction, I share how I personally battled through depression and suicidal tendencies, and how I sought recovery multiple times. These chapters will also show you love and how it can be the start of your mental downfall. 

 

Part 2 contains Poems 6-15. These are based around heartbreak. The reader will learn how heartbreak and personal battles can go hand-in-hand as well as how relationships tend to fall apart when you are in a very bad mental state.

 

Part 3 contains Poems 16-51. This part of the book will look into personal battles such as depression, sexual and physical abuse, alcoholism, eating disorders, rape, and more. It will both educate readers on the dangers and struggles of these issues as well as show them that they are not alone in the things that they are going through or have gone through. 

 

Part 4 contains Poems 52-70 and a hotline page. The last section of the book is constructed of tips on how to get through the recovery process, as well as including reminders and positive notes on how recovery is always possible, even after a relapse.  It is designed to really push the audience to seek help among their peers. The back of the book also includes a page full of hotlines, in case someone needs help, but feels that they cannot reach out to those around them.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Harley Vaughn is a young professional and (now) author who graduated from the University of West Georgia with a Bachelor of Science degree in Psychology and a minor in Sociology. 

 

In a time with an increasing number of people dealing with depression and suicidal tendencies, Vaughn believes it is crucial to raise awareness and get people talking about their struggles with mental and physical health.

 

Though Harley seems to lack the ability to create Serotonin for herself, she loves to make others around her feel happy and safe.

 

For more information you can connect with Harley at ﻿harleyhoo17@gmail.com﻿, on LinkedIn, Twitter, or Instagram @harleyhoo17.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TriggerBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

 

Thanks again,

Harley Vaughn

It will both educate readers on the dangers and struggles of these issues as well as show them that they are not alone in the things that they are going through or have gone through. 
 
Part 4 contains Poems 52-70 and a hotline page. The last section of the book is constructed of tips on how to get through the recovery process, as well as including reminders and positive notes on how recovery is always possible, even after a relapse.  It is designed to really push the audience to seek help among their peers. The back of the book also includes a page full of hotlines, in case someone needs help, but feels that they cannot reach out to those around them.
 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

About the Author
Harley Vaughn is a young professional and (now) author who graduated from the University of West Georgia with a Bachelor of Science degree in Psychology and a minor in Sociology. 
 
In a time with an increasing number of people dealing with depression and suicidal tendencies, Vaughn believes it is crucial to raise awareness and get people talking about their struggles with mental and physical health.
 
Though Harley seems to lack the ability to create Serotonin for herself, she loves to make others around her feel happy and safe.
 
For more information you can connect with Harley at ﻿harleyhoo17@gmail.com﻿, on LinkedIn, Twitter, or Instagram @harleyhoo17.
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.
 
The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TriggerBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!
 
Thanks again,
Harley Vaughn

story:
Donne con le CURVE

Ciao, siamo più di 20 giovani appassionati e abbiamo deciso di realizzare l'unica rivista italiana che si propone di raccontare la moda e la bellezza dal punto di vista di quelle donne che hanno deciso di fare delle proprie curve un punto di forza e che non vogliono lasciare che a identificarle sia un numero su un cartellino.

Il nostro è un bimestrale orientato al lettore, che non parla linguaggi astrusi. Parliamo come mangiamo e abbiamo un obiettivo ambizioso: veicolare un messaggio positivo e coerente di accettazione e consapevolezza di sé.

Quando abbiamo deciso di iniziare questa avventura, ci siamo posti un'unica domanda: se fossimo stati dall'altra parte, di cosa avremmo realmente avuto bisogno? Che cosa avremmo voluto leggere?
La rivista, quindi, è costruita intorno a noi... che siamo come voi.

Così, lo scorso agosto, è cominciato il nostro viaggio.  Il percorso intrapreso è entusiasmante, stimolante, tuttavia ci ha posti di fronte ad un'infinita serie di scogli e ostacoli. Tutto ciò che l'intera redazione desidera è avere la possibilità di continuare, ma non è facile: ci aiuterete?


Per capire di cosa parliamo, leggi gratuitamente il nuovo numero:

http://www.donneconlecurve.it/leggi



A cosa servono le vostre donazioni

Il nostro piano è continuare a lavorare e resistere quanto basta per potere attrarre i nostri futuri investitori. Chiediamo il vostro supporto, è vero, ma non vogliamo certo che siano i lettori a sostenere le spese del magazine. Tutto quello che ci serve è un po' di tempo per convincere le aziende a credere in noi. Per farlo, abbiamo provveduto autonomamente fino ad ora, in tutti i modi possibili, e non è stato facile: adesso, purtroppo, non possiamo più fare da soli.

Il nostro obiettivo è arrivare a dicembre 2014; finanziare, cioè, tre numeri (Luglio-Agosto 2014, Settembre-Ottobre 2014 e Novembre-Dicembre 2014). Per riuscire avremo bisogno di circa 3000 euro a numero, più un piccolo margine per promuovere il nostro progetto e cercare di attirare l'attenzione dei suddetti investitori.

I traguardi


E per voi?


Sostenerci? Puoi farlo in tanti modi!

La cosa più importante è che si sappia di questo progetto: più siamo, meglio è. Ecco cosa puoi fare per noi:

  • Chiedi ai tuoi contatti di partecipare e spargere la voce
  • Condividi la pagina del progetto sui tuoi canali e profili social
  • Parlane, parlane, parlane!

Insieme possiamo farcela: Donne con le CURVE è un sogno che si realizza per noi e per le nostre lettrici. Aiutaci a non infrangerlo!

story:
Summary

Roller derby changes lives. That might sound a little dramatic, but it does. The young girls who play roller derby get it, because the roller derby community is one of the most diverse, accepting, empowering girl power environments on the planet. Dorothy's Derby Chronicles was created to give that same dose of derby spirit and "be yourself" to all girls across the world.  You don't have to play to have it.

I’m Meghan Dougherty, aka Undertaker’s Daughter with the Rocky Mountain Rollergirls. Alece Birnbach is a nationally licensed illustrator, and we are the creators of the Dorothy’s Derby Chronicles book series for tween-aged girls (and boys). After playing roller derby for just a year and seeing the transformations of confidence in the women I skated with, we decided the heart, strength, diversity, independence and self-confidence needed to be shared with all young girls through a fun book.  

Check out this video of junior roller derby athletes talking about how the sport has changed them. 


Roller derby is the back drop for a funny, action-packed adventure about loving who you are and reaching for your dreams as a team. The first book, Rise of the Undead Redhead, came out July 1, 2015, and is about Dorothy (aka Undead Red); the second book, Woe of Jade Doe, is about Jade (aka Jade Doe), and comes out spring 2015; and the third book, Booty Vicious Bites Back, is our fierce, sassy sweetheart--Gigi.

We have self-funded the development of the first two books.  As you may know, unknown authors do not get much of an advance, which they also must pay back before receiving any royalties, and then after that they receive only a small percentage on each book since the publisher pays for all of the printing and distribution.  On a $6.99 book, it's going to be a while. This campaign is specifically funding our co-writer and illustrator helpers for the third book in the series, Booty Vicious Bites Back.  We could use your help.

This third book is the most diverse book in the series so far, as we gain momentum with Book 1.  One of a kind, the Dorothy's Derby Chronicles series celebrates being yourself and laughing at yourself through a sport that has mastered it.  We need your help to knock this third book out.  Then we can focus on the first two books, school visits and instilling derby attitude into all girls.

What we need and what you'll get

We are asking for $5,000 to pay for our co-writer and supporting illustrator to get the 3rd book ready to go.  Books in a series have to be timed within close to six months of each other so you are writing the next book before the previous is even out. That doesn't cover our Indeigogo fees or shipping, but we want to make the campaign achievable. 

We are thanking our donors with love, perhaps a copy of the first book--Rise of the Undead Redhead--art from the book, tattoos, decals, bracelets and all sorts of cool schwag. You could even have YOUR name in the next book!  If we don't reach our entire goal, still every penny will still go to create the third book.  And it all helps.  

Stretch Goals

If we make $500 over it will pay for Indiegogo fees and shipping.  If we make $1,000 more, it will go toward creating a video profiling junior skaters and highlighting the confidence they have achieved.  Any more will help us travel to more schools to talk about the importance of loving your body, and of course, loving roller derby.  Our next goal is to fulfill our dreams of creating an app and turning the first book into a graphic novel style format.  Here's a pic of me showing my derby confidence...or faux derby scariness.

The Impact

This series, like the sport of roller derby, celebrates girls of every shape and size. We believe girls need more role models who have the confidence to say "Hey, I don't care what you think about me." Just think about how long it took you to find that confidence...or maybe you need to join a roller derby league!

Our first book is getting positive reviews, from the industry and from readers of all ages, with comments like "Where was this book when I was growing up!"  

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is having to take longer to fund and finish the third book.  We don't know if we will have a publisher for the third book yet (they've optioned it, but not yet confirmed), so there is a chance we'll have to publish it ourselves.  But we are committed to doing what it takes to get Booty Vicious' story on the tween reader track!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't give, it helps us when you share this project and campaign with others.  The Indiegogo sharing tools are incredible.  Thank you so much for all your support.

story:
In an intensive week of research and dialogue, we aim to review the bulk of my father's papers, and record valuable memories and insights of select family members. Subsequently, I would also like to send one of the writers to New York City on a research trip to review the rest of my father's papers in the William Burroughs Collection at the New York Public Library. 

John Starr Cooke (1920-1976) was a seminal cultural figure whose life story has gone untold, outside a small circle, for far too long. His ideas, personal magnetism, and generosity of spirit directly influenced and triggered the counterculture movement which flowered in San Francisco during 1966–1967. 

My father lived a rich, complex, sometimes tragic, always dramatic, and highly interesting life in which he influenced and befriended some of the most iconic figures of his day including Cole Porter, G.I. Gurdjieff, Pyotr Ouspensky, Meher Baba, L Ron Hubbard, Leonard Cohen, Brion Gysin, William Burroughs, Michael Bowen, and Timothy Leary.

His life and teachings culminated in the doctrine of “One Consciousness," initially communicated to my father and a close circle of friends through a combination of daytime group meditation sessions on Point Lobos, California, and nightly Ouija board sessions at his Carmel Highlands home near Big Sur in the early 1960s. The transcripts and group meditations were the basis for a highly original set of Tarot cards which John himself painted, entitled T: The New Tarot for the Aquarian Age. The texts were subsequently published in book form as The Word of One.

This crowdfunding campaign will help cover airfares, ground transportation, accommodation, and living expenses for writers Michael C. McCann and Mark Walker, as well as former Cooke associates Bobby Bishop and Mitch Chanelis for one week in June, when this dedicated and enthusiastic group will gather to collect research for the book. 

Provided all goes well, and the book is published as planned, your financial donation will be rewarded as follows:

- $35, a copy of the book

- $50, a copy of the book, signed by the authors

- $100, a copy of the book, signed by the authors, with a special credit in the Acknowledgements Section

- $500, a copy of the book, signed by the authors, with a special credit and a personalized sentence written about you in the Acknowledgements Section

story:
The What?

We are the team of literature passionates responsible for Fabledo - a platform allowing independent short story writers to publish their fiction. 

We believe that the short story as a literary form has never received the appropriate credit. There is hardly any way an independent author can publish a single short story and make some money. Even well-known authors will often have trouble getting an agent to deal with a single piece of short fiction. Fabledo provides writers with a way to get their stories out there and listeners with good entertainment. 

There are, of course, places online where you can get audio short stories. However, Fabledo is unique in how much it puts emphasis of what is well written and interesting. We will never aim for quantity and always try to make sure that the stories we publish are actually enjoyable.

Now, we want to be unique in one more way - we want to be free. This is the plan: to offer all our stories for no cost at all, and still pay royalties to our authors.

Your funding will help us make Fabledo free, more widely available, and more importantly - promote the short story as a literary genre. 

Important: Later on we will still need to support the site and record more stories. In order to do that, we'll place advertismetns on the page. BUT we will never make them intrusive or annoying. 

 

Here's What We'll Do with the Money

There are three places the funds will go (+one optional):

1. Currently to download an audio book from Fabledo it is necessary to go through a billing procedure - even in the case of the free stories.

Now, our system will be redesigned so that the stories will be available to listen to directly on the homepage for free (with a possibility to download the mp3s, also for free!) - 30%

2. Making Fabledo available on mobile devices - creating applications for the major mobile OS'es (iOS, Android, Windows Phone) that will synchronize This will be outsourced for another 30%

3. The remaining 40% will be used for recording, mixing and illustrating another batch of short stories.

Optional: 4. If we get suffictient funds over our goal, we will introduce an accounts system allowing for personalization, like favoriting certain stories and getting rid of all ads for a small monthly fee.

 

What's in it for You?

Since our products will already be free for everyone, there isn't that much we can offer our supporters! Still, we'll try hard to do that. As you can see on the perks list, you get the following:

 

$2 - Thank you so much!

$10 - lots of our gratitude. But wait... there's more! A Thank You email and a coupon code to download a free story! The code is not in the perks list because we can't change the description now that somebody bought it already, but it's what you get!

$30 - a code to get three our current stories for free, right now, AND the gratitude.

$60 - you will additionally get a hand written postcard anywhere in the world. You will get 50 impressions of your commercial ad and the promo code you'll receive will enable you to download ALL of the current stories for free.

$100 - the code, the gratitude, 100 free impressions of your  advertisement AND the lifetime ad-free account (if we raise enough funds for the accounts system!)

$400 - the code, the gratitude, 500 free impressions, the ad-free account AND getting mentioned on our About Us page

 $1000 - Much as we'd like to offer you one of our female team members to wed, they weren't too thrilled about the idea. We really don't know why. So we had to skip this perk...

 

Is that all...?

In addition to the above perks, you'll get a huge amout of satisfaction that will be proportinoal to the value of the perk you choose. Cheesy though it may sound, you will really make a difference and help enable some great fiction to get out there. Thats worth it!

Any fan of literature will know that short stories are not just shorter/inferior novels - they are a separate genre that has special charm on its own. It would be a shame to let really interesting stories lie forgotten in drawers and hard disks or be buried under the mountain of mediocre creative writing floating online!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are actually more ways you can help us:

- a writer? submit your writing! (www.fabledo.com/submissions)

- a literary agent looking to expand his field of work to short stories? Contact us!

- an illustrator? send us your portfolio and rates, we'll need talented artists for the cover images!

- you do like us but don't want to pay? Share this campaign on social media - this DOES make a difference in this case!

 $1000 - Much as we'd like to offer you one of our female team members to wed, they weren't too thrilled about the idea. We really don't know why. So we had to skip this perk...
 


Is that all...?
In addition to the above perks, you'll get a huge amout of satisfaction that will be proportinoal to the value of the perk you choose. Cheesy though it may sound, you will really make a difference and help enable some great fiction to get out there. Thats worth it!
Any fan of literature will know that short stories are not just shorter/inferior novels - they are a separate genre that has special charm on its own. It would be a shame to let really interesting stories lie forgotten in drawers and hard disks or be buried under the mountain of mediocre creative writing floating online!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
There are actually more ways you can help us:
- a writer? submit your writing! (www.fabledo.com/submissions)
- a literary agent looking to expand his field of work to short stories? Contact us!
- an illustrator? send us your portfolio and rates, we'll need talented artists for the cover images!
- you do like us but don't want to pay? Share this campaign on social media - this DOES make a difference in this case!

story:
People of the Pancake is a children's book illustrated by the artist Amy Sarkisian and written by me, Janet Sarbanes. For many years, I'd wanted to collaborate with Amy, who has an awesome punk rock surrealist sensibility (www.amysarkisian.com). We had our daughters close in age, and one day we were talking about how so many contemporary children's books seem to transmit the values of neo-liberal capitalism. I'd heard about a Swedish socialist children's TV show from the seventies, "Lost in the Pancake," in which a boy doesn't want to eat his pancake because there are people living in it (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aUqvXNEKM_I#t=82). Amy is a big fan of the children's illlustrator and satirist Tomi Ungerer, also known for his erotic illustrations and his drawings and posters opposing the Vietnam War (http://www.washingtonpost.com/goingoutguide/mov...)

So with these as our inspirations, we decided to collaborate on a children's book. This was around the time of Occupy, so we wanted our kids to learn about nonviolent resistance and the idea of the commons, too. We enlisted the help of our friend the fantastically talented book designer Kimberly Varella (http://content-object.com/), who also has a daughter around the same age. By pre-ordering a book, you'll help us achieve an initial print run, get People of the Pancake into indy bookstores around L.A. and find a national distributor. You'll also help get the message out to little girls and little people everywhere that human need trumps corporate greed. Thanks!

story:
Hi! My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a Romanian self-publisher and blogger. I've been writing for over eight years now, but I've only decided to release my stories for a wider audience in April 2012, when I also launched my blog.

So far I have released three novels, four short stories, a novella, and a compilation of essays.

I'm pretty much a one man operation, meaning that I do most of the stuff that needs to be done in order to publish a book, from cover art to interior formatting. Basically anything, except for editing.

I'm a very prolific writer. And I can write pretty much everywhere, as long as it's my living room.

I'm a self-publisher by choice. An independent artist who does all the work himself, and tries his best to make a living out of it.

And, believe it or not, I know how difficult and frustrating the world of self-publishing can be sometimes, especially when books aren't selling very well, despite the overall positive feedback from readers.

That's why the perks are aimed at helping indie artists reach a bigger audience in exchange for a small contribution.

Your contributions will help me make ends meet, keep on writing, and release my future projects. Donations allow me to dedicate all my time to writing, blogging, and doing all the other stuff related to self-publishing.

What I Need & What You Get

For your contributions, you get the chance to reach an audience of over 79,000 people, via the Sponsor perks available.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that people sometimes can't afford to be charitable.

But if you don't have any money to contribute you can help out with a tweet or like. It's really simple. You just have to click on a button. And, trust me, that's enough, and it will really help me towards meeting my goal.

Thank you,

Cristian

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
What I’m essentially offering you, with the help of indiegogo, is a way to pre-purchase a book and thereby help it get published.  I love this concept, don’t you? 
 
 
WHO AM I?

              I am Brenda Marie Smith.  I wrote my first story when I was five years old about a girl named Wendy who could fly on the winds.  I conceived the whole story while standing at the apex of my swing-set and letting the Oklahoma wind try to carry me away.  It damned near did.

             Now I’ve written a book to share, Something Radiates.  I’m a mother, grandmother, and wife (of a cutie-pie hunky husband) in Austin, Texas.  I do accounting and taxes part-time, help my family run a couple of green businesses, and write, write, write.

             An early draft of Something Radiates was a finalist in a Writers League of Texas novel contest in the Science Fiction category. I have studied fiction in the UCLA Writers Program under published novelists Caroline Leavitt, Roberta Morris, and Dennis Foley, screenwriter Terry Borst, and nonfiction writer Nancy Shepherdson.  I have also been privately tutored by Austin playwright and biographer Anita Howard and Virginia editor/writer David H. Morgan.  I have been actively involved in two writers groups over several years.

             In 2012 I participated in NaNoWriMo and in one month completed 50,800 words for a new novel – as yet untitled – of a post-apocalyptic sort.  I also have a sequel to Something Radiates in the works, Reality Resonates.  I plan to finish both of these novels within the next year.

             In the past seven years I have read more than 2,000 books.  I love good books, and I think you will find that Something Radiates is a good book worthy of your support.

 

WHY DO I NEED $4,000 FOR MY BOOK? 

             The book will be published by CreateSpace, an affiliate of Amazon.com. Their fee includes the cover, interior design, formatting for e-readers, ISBN numbers, and a limited amount of marketing that will make the book more available to most US bookstores.  The book is being copy-edited by well-known Austin writer and editor, Cindy Widner, a real pro. 

             The remaining money will pay for my website, a business bank account, funding fees, books to mail to potential reviewers, and some inexpensive marketing and networking costs.  Most of the marketing will be done by me with social networking and I hope by word of mouth from my readers and friends.  You can help me go viral, right?  I know you can.

 

MORE ABOUT SOMETHING RADIATES

             Something Radiates is a genre-bending paranormal thriller about a single mother’s struggle to wrench control of her life away from a madman.   

             From lusty swamp romps to dream invasions and psychic battles of will, this mother’s quest for survival and love will yank you from the psychedelic fringes of nirvana to demented stalker hell and back.

            Telepathic dreamer Sarah Stevens worked for fourteen years to build the courage to leave her cruel husband Dietrich Peters, and four more years to build a life for her and her two teenage sons in sultry Baton Rouge, Louisiana.  Just as Sarah meets a good man she could fall in love with in a heartbeat, Dietrich barges back into her life, and Sarah is not about to put up with it.

            But Dietrich will not be deterred.  He invades her home, her dreams, her mind, and grows more threatening with each passing hour.  Sarah defends her family and freedom tenaciously but soon has trouble separating the emotional turmoil dredged up by Dietrich from the increasingly terrifying reality that suddenly engulfs her.

          Sarah must revisit her abused past, learn new psychic skills, and summon all her untapped mental and spiritual resources for the fight of her life.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

             For $20-25 you can get a copy of Something Radiates as soon as it’s printed (estimated two to three months after funding).  For more money you can get autographs, more copies, and other extra perks all the way up to dinner with the author in Austin paid for by me.  But if you can’t afford the $20-$25, you can still get an autograph for $5.  All donors get listed on my website and Facebook page unless they choose not to be listed.

             And if you can’t contribute money at all, I get it completely.  If you would please spread the word and get your friends and relations to contribute and/or to buy the book, you will have the undying gratitude of me and my fairly large family, and that is something worth having. If you let me know you’re helping spread the word, I’ll list you on the website and Facebook page too.

             Thanks so much for your interest and support.  Look for updates on the novel at my spanking new website: http://brendamariesmith.com/.   

Peace, Love, and Good Reading,  

Brenda Marie

story:
Hello Beautiful People! 

My Name is Emily Sanders and I will be graduating from Florida State University in May 2013. Since high school I've heard about a pilgrimage across Spain from The Pyrenees in France to Santiago de Compostela. Walking 500 miles in 30 days could pose a challenge for any one willing to endure the adventure. At this moment in my life I realize that there is no better time than now to take this journey. 

This journey means a lot of different things to different travelers. Originally I planned to follow this dream on my own, for myself. This is my time, right? Wrong. The more I thought about it, the more I realize that this journey will be far from that! This will be the first time in my life that I have the opportunity to be completely focused on God. Traveling among God's creation with nothing to distract me, not even the dirt under my feet.

I plan to dedicate this walk in prayer daily to the people who need it most. Family, friends and those not able to walk by my side. 

To share the full extent of this walk with all of you, I’ll be capturing a photo documentary project of my journey. This will not only include my story but the stories of the travelers I meet along the way.

 

BUT I NEED YOUR HELP!

 

WHAT I NEED

I am raising money for:

-Flight

-Daily expenses, which include but are not limited to Food and Room & Board.

Through my research I am estimating about $1500-2000 for my flight, depending on when I am able to book it.  It is recommended to have at least 1000 Euros for your daily expenses for the 30 days. (This works out to be about $1200.)  

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO GET INVOLVED 

If your prayer for my journey is all you can give, that is more than enough. 

 

WHAT YOU CAN DO AND WHAT YOU GET! 

 

Contributions of $10 will receive:

           A thank you card. DUH! 

 

Contributions of $25 will receive all previous perks and:

            A DVD of the photos sent to you in the mail. 

 

Contributions of $100  will receive all previous perks and:

A personalized photo from a day on my trip of me holding a sign thanking you for your contribution. This could be a great conversation starter and also a daily reminder to take  time with God even in your busiest moments.

 

Contributions of $200 or more will receive all previous perks and: 

A professionally bound book of the project and the stories accompanying the photos. This will be printed and sent to your home after my journey is complete. 

 

 

If you have any questions about the Pilgrimage or Photo Documentary, feel free to email me at Ems10m@my.fsu.edu

story:
Mental illness. They're scary words, but they shouldn't be. Most people don’t want to talk about it, and the few who do may not know how.That’s where I come in.

GetMental is a project of my own creation designed to fight the stigma of mental illness, advocate for treatment, recovery and acceptance, and to encourage responsible, ethical reporting in the media.

The blog will show my attempt to tackle this challenging subject and cover it with the respect it deserves. The accompanying academic symposium will consist of a panel discussion that addresses the challenges to covering mental illness in the media. This panel will consist of journalists and media members who work in this specific field as well as mental health advocates.

What's the money for?

You're probably thinking "this sounds cool, but why do you need funding?" As it turns out, hosting a community-wide event like this symposium is expensive, as are the materials needed to publicize my project. The funding will go toward the blog's domain name and design, cost of printing for traditional advertising, food for the panelists and attendees (the University charges a lot!), and for any unforeseen facility/equipment rental costs.

What You Get

I'd appreciate anything you can contribute. I am passionate about this project and hope to bring it to life. Please help me make that happen! Every dollar helps!

All contributors will be personally recognized after the panel discussion and on the website. If we succeed and this project comes to fruition, you are all welcomed to attend the panel discussion on April 24, 2014 at 7 pm in the University of La Verne Campus Center!

If I don't reach my goal, any money that is raised will still go toward the effort. Every dollar is appreciated and necessary to make this happen!

The Impact

By helping fund this project, you are bringing my senior project to life (and consequently helping me graduate). More importantly, however, you're helping raise awareness about an important cause.

According to the National Institute of Mental Health, one in four American adults experience a mental health disorder. By helping fund this project, you are helping eliminate the stigma and make change possible. If one person feels less alone or seeks help for their illness as a result of this project, then together we have done something great.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Meet the C.H.U.M.P.S.,

the self-dubbed Calgary Homeless Unintelligible Mumbling Poets Society. We are a coffee-fiendish clan of philosophers, a motley assortment of homeless and semi-homeless writers, a poetry workshop centred in the inner city, and group of friends. Once a week, we meet to write, write more and write better, and be in each other’s company. Led by myself, Celine, C.H.U.M.P.S. originated from a creative writing program hosted at a homeless shelter and since then has become a fiercely loyal group who has supported each other not only in writing but all the bumpy elements of life.

The heart of C.H.U.M.P.S has always been about the writing process itself, and about championing self-expression of those on the streets as a mean to catharsis and community. But we also recognize that these stories and voices need to be shared. That's where you come in.

Our Anthology

I've compiled, edited, and designed an anthology that collects the best of our work. It's a tangible marker of C.H.U.M.P.S.' accomplishment, and once put on the shelves of Calgary's independent bookstores is a huge and hopeful signature of street poetry and its value in our literary scene. But more so, it's a testament to a movement to transcend the stigma of homelessness and acknowledge the beauty in its bareness, in honesty and rough edges, in wit and imagination and sitcom-worthy hilarity. What's more, the writers will split the profits, giving them something to start denting rent cheques and grocery bills. 

The fundraiser goal of $1,040 includes all printing and production costs for 200 copies of the anthology, taking into account poster promotion and extra processing fees. We'll be selling these at our book launch and reading on August 30th at Shelf Life Books. (You can check out the Facebook event here.) After that, they'll still be available at Shelf Life, as well as Pages in Kensington. Any extra funds raised will go straight to the poets. 

What your support says

When you sponsor our anthology, you're joining a movement. Sure, it sounds trendy and hyperbolized. But it's true, and here's why: you're saying homelessness does not define people, as writers or as people, and its stigma and stereotypes should not hold sway on how we read, listen to, and see others. You're saying that the creative spirit is innate and bright and its electricity is worth lighting up in anyone no matter how much baggage (literally or metaphorically) is attached. The point is that this goes farther than a few dollars, or a few hundred. It goes farther than a book. This is just a concrete way of participation in an ongoing push to open up ourselves, our consciousness and our spaces to stories that discomfit us, nudge us into empathy, and help us realize our capacity for feeling. And for change.

Don't got no dolla dolla bills y'all?

Don't worry, we understand. You can still share this campaign like crazy, hype our reading event, invite friends, and attend with mad respect and a listening ear.

Meet the C.H.U.M.P.S.,
the self-dubbed Calgary Homeless Unintelligible Mumbling Poets Society. We are a coffee-fiendish clan of philosophers, a motley assortment of homeless and semi-homeless writers, a poetry workshop centred in the inner city, and group of friends. Once a week, we meet to write, write more and write better, and be in each other’s company. Led by myself, Celine, C.H.U.M.P.S. originated from a creative writing program hosted at a homeless shelter and since then has become a fiercely loyal group who has supported each other not only in writing but all the bumpy elements of life.
The heart of C.H.U.M.P.S has always been about the writing process itself, and about championing self-expression of those on the streets as a mean to catharsis and community. But we also recognize that these stories and voices need to be shared. That's where you come in.


Our Anthology
I've compiled, edited, and designed an anthology that collects the best of our work. It's a tangible marker of C.H.U.M.P.S.' accomplishment, and once put on the shelves of Calgary's independent bookstores is a huge and hopeful signature of street poetry and its value in our literary scene. But more so, it's a testament to a movement to transcend the stigma of homelessness and acknowledge the beauty in its bareness, in honesty and rough edges, in wit and imagination and sitcom-worthy hilarity. What's more, the writers will split the profits, giving them something to start denting rent cheques and grocery bills. 
The fundraiser goal of $1,040 includes all printing and production costs for 200 copies of the anthology, taking into account poster promotion and extra processing fees. story:
About Me:
I'm a professional writer and multimedia journalist living in Ontario. I've written for the Herald de Paris, Women’s Post, Montreal Gazette, Kingston This Week and Quill & Quire. I have a BA from Lakehead University and an advance diploma from Loyalist College's Journalism: Online, Print, and Broadcast program. In the spring of 2013 I finished Mistral, my first novel, as part of Humber College's creative writing program. Author Helen Humphreys was my mentor.

The Book:

The Widower’s Orchestra is about the life of Amelia Jolin, a young woman who lost her parents at a very young age. With only a satchel full of their correspondence, she’s on a journey to see the places and meet the people that became pillars in her parents’ lives.

From the neighbourhood of Citta Antica in Verona to Jordaan in Amsterdam, Amelia visits the spaces her musical parents played in. In doing so, she discovers The Widower’s Orchestra. 

The Idea

I’ve always been taken by the symphony. A few years ago I was sitting in the mezzanine when I met a widower who had a remarkable, tragic, and compelling story to tell. This experience happened more than once, with different men who had lost their wives. Last year, when I was in Paris, I was reminded of this experience, of the stories, and for the first time I felt I had finally found one of the many settings for The Widower's Orchestra.

The Details

Where: France, Spain, Hungary, Czech Republic, Italy and the Netherlands. 
When: Mar. 21, 2014 to Apr. 18, 2014
What I'm doing: Visiting selective neighbourhoods, opera houses and landmarks that are part of Amelia's journey. Example: The Arena in Verona, Italy. 

What I Need & What You Get

•  My fundraising goal is $3,700. This will cover all of the costs associated with the research. From accommodations, to food, to train tickets, to airfare. My goal is to make this venture as inexpensive as possible, but as intense as possible. I only have 27 days make it happen and I have a lot of ground to cover.

•  I want to make this as interactive as possible. I'll be letting you know where your donation went by taking photographs and telling stories on my blog that are tailored to you. 

The Impact

The Widower's Orchestra is a work of historical fiction. I can't write it without doing the research. I have a window of opportunity from Mar. 21 to Apr. 18 to collect all of the information I need to write it. We all know how powerful a book can be, and I truly feel this is one story I'm meant to tell. The impact of a book is limitless.  

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Can't donate? Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's share tools!

story:
Production is complete. Koya Bound is now shipping. 

Purchase over on Gumroad. 

Some shots from production in Japan: 

 

The Book

In March of this year, Dan Rubin and I went on a walk.

The walk was along Japan's 1,000+ year old Kumano Kodo pilgrimage path. From that, we made a book. 

The 1,000 copy edition of the book will be offset printed and bound in Japan on archival Japanese paper. 

The specs:

  • Koya Bound is bound in linen that feels soft in the hand, and the images are printed on archival Japanese paper 
  • Printed and bound in Japan
  • The cover and spine will be debossed with the title. 
  • The trim size is 320mm x 290mm
  • The book is 84 pages long.
  • It also includes a topographic map of our walking route. 

 

The content:

  • Koya Bound is a book of photographs from the Kumano Kodo pilgrimage walk in Japan.
  • It's a book of photographs about mountain time, and towering cedar time, and crumpled earth time, and ancient teahouse time. 
  • It's a book of photographs about where the mind wanders when disconnected. 
  • But, really, it's a book of photographs about adventures and curiosities often nearer to you than you may realize.
  • Koya Bound will ship by December. 

 

WHO ARE YOU GUYS?

Dan Rubin is an award winning photographer and designer who frequently leads photography workshops around the world (most recently in the Faroe Islands), has worked with American Express, Ducati, Google, Land Rover, RedBull (and many more), and was once Creative Director for MOO.COM, among other Google-able things. You can view his recent photographic work on instagram.com/danrubin.

Craig Mod (me!) is a writer and photographer and award winning book designer who has produced over a dozen cloth-bound, silk-screened, foil-stamped books of all types, mostly in Japan. I also have a long history with Kickstarter. In fact, I ran one of the earliest successful book campaigns on Kickstarter six and a half years ago. You can read about that on my website. I'm also on Instagram: instagram.com/craigmod.

 

ABOUT THE WALK

The Kumano Kodo is only one of two UNESCO World Heritage pilgrimage walks. (The other World Heritage pilgrimage walk is the Camino de Santiago in Spain.)

Dan and I (and another friend, Matt) began walking from a town in Wakayama Prefecture called Takijiri, traveling along what is called the “naka hechi” route. We then turned north to follow the “ko hechi” route to the birthplace of Shingon Buddhism: Mt. Koya. 

(That's why the book is called Koya Bound.)

It took eight days. We walked about 107 km. 

Not too long, but long enough. Not too far, but far enough. 

Koya Bound is an artifact from this long, quiet walk in the woods. 

It shows you snippets of where we went and what it felt like, but doesn't tell you (exactly) how to get there. 

You can think of it as a sequence of visual hints. It says: There is a place in the world that looks and feels like this. Given a little gumption, similar places can probably be found near wherever you may be. 

We believe that a good walk begins with a clear goal — a mountaintop, a far-off village, a superb pizza shack in the middle of the woods — but that a great walk is born out of a bit of circuity and a little uncertainty. 

As we walked, we shot three thousand photographs using a Leica Q and a Leica M Monochrom. 

We used these cameras because we love them. They are remarkable tools, but also feel like good friends. 

After completing the walk, Dan and I hid in an old Japanese house in the middle of the Gifu Prefecture for a week. 

We subsided mainly on rice crackers. 

And burned liters of kerosene each day trying to stay warm.

It was great. 

We used a cheap Brother laser printer to print out hundreds of our photographs. We covered the floors in them. 

I don't believe you can understand a book until you've printed it out and put it on the floor.

We walked all over the images, moved them around, and lived atop them for days. Finally, we edited them down to the fifty-seven that best told the story we wanted to tell. 

WHY WALK?

My interest in Japanese pilgrimage walks (and more generally, walks in Japan) began three years ago. I've now done about twelve such walks, and have spent nearly six months in total up in the mountains. 

My time in Tokyo spans nearly fifteen years. I've gone on the occasional countryside trip (for example, when I was twenty I hitchhiked across the country for a month — an adventure chockablock with generous people and a little too much alcohol; stories for another day), but had never connected with (nor had I been really aware of!) the historical paths criss-crossing the archipelago. It wasn't until 2013, when John McBride — Japan scholar, art historian, and walking guru — invited me on my first walk, that I realized there existed just a train ride away a universe I had long ignored.

Since then I've scheduled at least one decent sized walk every six months (the next one is at the end of this October), and I usually cap off the end of each year with a smaller New Year's walk. 

These walks have served as a way for me to invite to Japan people whose work or life inspires me, to spend a few days or weeks together, to get off the grid, and slow down in the old forests.  

There's a special rhythm to walking in Japan, made possible in part by the vast transportation infrastructure and ecosystem of lodgings and hot springs. The day unfolds: You wake at dawn, eat a big breakfast, take some rice balls from the inn for the road, and then you spend the next eight to ten hours in the woods, cresting mountain passes, tip-toeing around snakes, singing away bears, finally arriving at your next inn or hut or home or hot spring. You bathe your weary bones in scalding hot water, eat a generous dinner, and then slip into futons by 8 p.m. It's a damn fine way to walk the world with good friends. And the kind of schedule that permits a type of chatter not present in the everyday day-to-day.

Dan Rubin and I had been trying to make a book together for almost five years. Finally, this past March, our timing aligned and we were able to head out on our Kumano Kodo walk. We didn't quite know what the shape of the final book would be, but we knew the walk was special, and that somewhere in the jumble of our images was a good story, or a good sequence, that both helped us remember those rhythms of a walking life, and would (we hope) inspire others to seek out similar adventures. 

Thanks for your support. We look forward to sharing this little adventure with you.

— Craig & Dan

 

Thanks

For helping us get this project this far, many thanks to the following people: John McBride, Akiko Moriguchi, Chiaki Hayashi, Matt Jacobson, Chris Cox, David Cady, Derek Baines, Matt Mullenweg, Om Malik, Kevin Kelly, Jason Kottke, Frank Chimero, John Pull, Gail & George Musgrave, Laura Schmalstieg, Bryan Mochizuki, Chris Palmieri, Ashley Rawlings, Brie the Dog, Tanabe City, Victoria Wright.

 

The audio track for our video was recorded at Sweetwater Studios by Mark Hornsby (recording engineer) and Nick D'Virgilio (drums). We dig it!

story:
¿Qué?

La virtud de ese amuleto es la historia de un gran amor, pero también es un relato de batallas personales y de conquistas; de sueños cumplidos y de valor. De la lucha de Carmen Alicia por lograr su libertad y así poder vivir su amor.

La virtud de ese amuleto narra las tribulaciones de una mujer dispuesta a escapar de una terrible cárcel moral e intelectual. La de su casa, su retrógrada madre, su desalmado hermano mayor, y el ultraconservador y racista pueblo en el que le tocó nacer, a principios del siglo pasado. Además de esto, tiene que salvarse de ser la moneda de cambio en un matrimonio pactado por intereses económicos.

Su desdichada vida da un giro inesperado cuando conoce y se enamora de Mandinga; un enigmático individuo de raza negra, de quien se dice en la región que es el mismísimo Satanás, y que tiene unos poderes sobrenaturales que provienen del deslumbrante amuleto que cuelga sobre su pecho.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Juan José Núñez.

Nacido en Caracas en 1975. Escritor, Lingüista y epicúreo; es Licenciado en Comunicación Audiovisual y Diplomado en Dirección Cinematográfica y Realización de Televisión. Su currículum académico también incluye estudios de Derecho (Universidad Complutense de Madrid) y de Máster en Formación de Profesorado (Universidad Pontificia Comillas), aún por finalizar. En 1998, fue seleccionado por la ilustre Fundación Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho de Venezuela, para la concesión de una beca de estudios de postgrado en el extranjero. Y así, en 1999, traslada su residencia a Madrid, para cursar estudios de Cine, obteniendo en 2002 el título de Diplomado que ostenta. En 2003, y tras un intenso y fructífero período de residencia en Londres, regresa a Madrid, donde permanece desde entonces y se desarrolla profesionalmente.

Como Lingüista, cosecha una amplia experiencia en la enseñanza de idiomas modernos a grupos de empresas y directivos, y también a alumnos de Máster; profesión que alterna con la creación literaria y de guiones cinematográficos. Es miembro de la SGAE. Ha sido Guionista y Director de dos cortometrajes rodados en cine y estrenados en los Cines Verdi de Madrid. También es autor de varios guiones de largometraje.

Ha sido premiado en dos Concursos internacionales de Escritura para Televisión, tanto en Venezuela (RCTV; 1998) como en México (Fundación Azteca; 2006). Además, fue finalista en un Concurso de Crítica Cinematográfica patrocinado por la Guía del Ocio de Madrid.
En Venezuela, fue Ayudante de Producción en reportajes televisivos, y becario como Guionista de Telenovelas.

Juan José Núñez sabe despertar sentimientos...

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La virtud de ese amuleto que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan José Núñez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

modernos a grupos de empresas y directivos, y también a alumnos de 
Máster; profesión que alterna con la creación literaria y de guiones 
cinematográficos. Es miembro de la SGAE. Ha sido Guionista y Director de
 dos cortometrajes rodados en cine y estrenados en los Cines Verdi de 
Madrid. También es autor de varios guiones de largometraje.Ha 
sido premiado en dos Concursos internacionales de Escritura para 
Televisión, tanto en Venezuela (RCTV; 1998) como en México (Fundación 
Azteca; 2006). Además, fue finalista en un Concurso de Crítica 
Cinematográfica patrocinado por la Guía del Ocio de Madrid.En Venezuela, fue Ayudante de Producción en reportajes televisivos, y becario como Guionista de Telenovelas.
Juan José Núñez sabe despertar sentimientos...¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La virtud de ese amuleto que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan José Núñez vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
"Les bêtes sauvages"

est une publication indépendante de dessins d'ART ÉROTIQUE d'inspiration poétique, aux arborescences éclectiques et originales. Autour d'un projet collectif, ce recueil génère la convergence d'artistes dessinateurs aux talents charmants et d'écrivains aux notes voluptueuses, tous issus de Montréal.

Les artistes 

  • Martin PM
  • Lucile Bernard
  • Olivier Thibodeau
  • Shabnam Zeraati 
  • Payam Mofidi 
  • Rod Legrand
  • Véronique Lévesque-Pelletier ​
  • Eduardo Morataya-Guevara 

Démarche artistique 

Tout a commencé avec un POÈME composé par Claire Martinant. Il a servi d'inspiration et de contexte aux dessinateurs qui ont eu carte blanche pour réaliser des DESSINS aux effluves LUXURIEUSES (dont Les lions et Les buffles de Shabnam Zeraati présents sur cette page) : 

"Des bêtes sauvages s'unissant à l'unisson, à travers une lutte acharnée pour la survie s’offrent une parade amoureuse. Les caresses, les râles et les cris s’entremêlent, le rut brulant et fatal, embrase tout sur son passage. 

Animé d’une faim avide et sans égale, le désir poursuit sa quête effrénée pour se fondre dans l’éternité. Et finit par se perdre esséminé dans la brume et l’humidité" . 

Puis dans un second temps, les écrivains ont choisi les dessins qui les interpellaient le plus pour rédiger des RÉCITS SENSUELS aux appétits CHARNELS. En voici un aperçu de Eduardo Moratay-Guevara:  

"Il y avait la hauteur vertigineuse de la nuit.

Il y avait leurs réveils continuels, à chaque moment, pour sentir leurs peaux, pour goûter leurs sueurs, pour entendre leurs cris à l’unisson. La pièce, déjà si petite pour contenir leurs exhalaisons, des extases continuelles, se résorbait peu à peu sur leurs corps exténués..."

"Les bêtes sauvages" regorge de 18 dessins et 10 textes qui combleront vos nuits d'hiver! 

VOUS ÊTES NOS GÉNIES

En tant que personnalités éminentes du monde des arts, vous détenez entre vos mains nos chances de succès et le pouvoir de sillonner ses pages de vos yeux curieux et émerveillés.

Des récompenses fabuleuses et azimutées vous attendent. Quelque soit votre implication, quelques clics suffiront à nous combler de bonheur pour l’éclosion de ce projet collaboratif. 

P-S: si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de payer en ligne, sachez que nous sommes flexibles. Vous pouvez nous écrire à lesbetessauvages@gmail.com 

De la transparence

Direction artistique et coordination / 350$

Graphisme / 150$

Artistes / 1 100$

Impression (350 exemplaires) / 1 524$

Lancement / 560$

Marchés vente / 250$

Envois à l'étranger / 150$

 = 4 084$

Lancement 

la lumière collective nous ouvrira ses portes le 14 février 2017 pour une SAINT-VALENTIN des plus délicieuses et excitantes ! Les oeuvres originales des artistes seront exposées au travers d'un parcours déambulatoire jouant avec les espaces pour une découverte intimiste et personnalisée. Sans oublier des vidéos d'art expérimentales évoquant l'érotisme pour une ambiance immersive et pénétrante.

Bénévolat  

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer et souhaitez tout de même participer, nous accepterons volontiers de l'aide pour la mise en place et déroulement du lancement. Vous pouvez écrire à lesbetessauvages@gmail.com 

Les bêtes sauvages sont également sur Facebook et elles aiment qu'on les flattent. D'autres infos encore plus succulentes sont disponibles. 

N'hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous et utilisez les outils de partage Indiegogo ;-) 

Merci pour votre temps si précieux et portez-vous bien !

story:
About this project 

NEVOAZUL is an independent bi-annual magazine where minimalism, consumerism and sustainability merge with culture, art and literature. The aim is to gratify the readers intellect, stimulating critical thinking about modern society.

We live in the age of speed. We strain to be faster than machines, for the sake of a future that consumes our present. We now buy fast, cheap and in huge quantity, forgetting about centuries of heritage and wisdom.

But it doesn’t need to be that way.

We believe it’s time to give another chance to efficiency, creativity and quality, instead of over glorifying waste, quantity and compulsory consumerism.

That’s why we decided to create NEVOAZUL, an independent publication where minimalism, consumerism and sustainability merge with culture, art and literature. Every article, photography and drawing is an invitation to a balanced life with more conversations and less shopping, more walks and less anxiety, more knowledge and less information. We want NEVOAZUL magazine to be a knowledge and inspiration haven for those looking for a simple, but significant life.

This campaign aims at funding the printing and shipping costs of NEVOAZUL's first issue. The pieces are slotting into place, most of the magazine is ready. We just need some help covering the initial print run and distribution so that you can get NEVOAZUL magazine into your hands by September, 2016. 



Issue 1 - Impermanence

In a culture motivated by consumerism and memory, the first issue of NEVOAZUL magazine reflects about impermanence as a driven force for a simple, more meaningfull life.


Here's what you will find inside the first issue:

-An article about the benefits of organic cotton in the lives of farmers around the world
-How the ancestral art of Kintsugi turn broken ceramics into objects even more precious than they were before
-Was Albert Einstein a minimalist? An article wrote by Sam Lustgarten from the blog Frugaling
-Paintings by the artist Katte Geneta, where she represents nature fickleness using a single stroke to create a wave
-A  review about the movie Mon Oncle about simplicity and modernity

-A story about the inspiring Aileen Xu, the girl behind the youtube channel Lavendaire

-Three poems about Wittgenstein's silence written by Emanuel Madalena
-The virtues of impermanence online, an article about sharing in the age of Snapchat, a social network where what we share expires in 24 hours

...and many more.

More about issue 1

About 150 pages

Cover - CLA 240gr 

Pages - IOR 100 gr


About Us

Inês Catarina Pinto - Editor

Mastered in Media Studies and Journalism, she decided to embark on this journey and merge her interests in minimalism, consumerism and sustainability with her passion for editorial journalism. Inspired by the mountains, the Patti Smith writing and the music from Beach House, she sign several articles, essays and interviews on NEVOAZUL pages. 

Pedro Oliveira - Creative Director

Master in Architecture , he uses points , lines, balanced forms and chromatic compositions to draw the pages of NEVOAZUL . His greatest inspiration is also his first major artistic reference , the artistic education system of the Bauhaus .

What you'll get if you help us:

-A warm-hearted hand-written thank you postcard, and we'll keep you updated on everything that's happening with the project.
-Your name printed in the first issue as an early supporter of NEVOAZUL. 
-One copy of NEVOAZUL's first issue, delivered directly to you anywhere in the world.
-CALMA, a booklet with short stories written by NEVOAZUL editor Inês Catarina Pinto. (Size A5)
-An exclusive etching in dark blue colours (Size A4)
-A poster designed by Pedro Oliveira (Size A1)


Help us share the word:

#nevoazulmag
We want to create awareness about the impact of compulsory consumerism, waste and environmental problems on our society. Help us spread NEVOAZUL magazine and together we could open a debate about how social responsability, sustainable behavior and ethical fashion could make a difference in our future.


Costs, risks and challenges 

We have carefully assessed the risks, challenges and costs associated with launching a project like NEVOAZUL.

The money we raise via this campaign is dedicated to printing and distribution NEVOAZUL's first issue "Impermanence". We need to raise at least 5.000€, enabling us to print 1,000 copies and distribute them. 

One issue of NEVOAZUL will cost — 15€ per issue, that's about 22$ and £15.  We think this is a fair price point, making the publication affordable for readers while enabling us to create more content.

We're confident that we can create a meaningfull publication that you'll enjoy, but the biggest concern on our minds is how to get the printed version in countries outside Europe. Shipping ain't cheap, but with the inclusion of a digital edition, we hope to reach more people in more parts of the world.

As much as there are always risks with print publishing, We have approached this project vigilantly through extensive planning for the last months and we are totally committed to this project.

This project is at an advanced stage of production. Funding is the last step to make this first issue happening. 


Follow us on:

Facebook      Ello      Instagram      Twitter


__________________________________



Sobre o projeto

A NEVOAZUL é uma revista independente bi-annual onde o consumismo, o minimalismo e a sustentabilidade se cruzam com a cultura, a literatura e a arte. O nosso propósito é gratificar o intelecto do leitor e estimular o pensamento crítico sobre a sociedade moderna.

Vivemos na era da velocidade e desejámos ser mais rápidos do que as máquinas em nome de um futuro que consome o nosso presente. Compramos de forma cada vez mais rápida, em grandes quantidades e por preços irrisórios, esquecendo séculos de tradição e sabedoria.

Mas as coisas não precisam de ser assim.

Nós acreditamos que está na altura de dar outra oportunidade à eficiência, à criatividade e à qualidade, em vez de continuarmos a glorificar o desperdício, a quantidade e o consumo compulsivo.

A NEVOAZUL é este equilíbrio entre quem somos e o que queremos ser. Cada artigo, fotografia e desenho da NEVOAZUL é um convite a um quotidiano com mais conversas e menos compras, mais passeios e menos ansiedade, mais conhecimento e menos informação. Nós queremos que esta revista seja um porto de abrigo para todos aqueles que aspiram a uma vida mais simples mas significativa.

Com esta campanha pretendemos angariar fundos para a impressão e distribuição do primeiro número da revista NEVOAZUL. A revista está praticamente feita, só precisamos da tua ajuda para cobrir os valores iniciais da gráfica e para a fazermos chegar até ti em Setembro de 2016.


NEVOAZUL nº1 - Impermanência

Numa cultura motivada pelo consumismo e pela memória, o primeiro número da NEVOAZUL reflete sobre as vantagens de aceitar a impermanência como catalisador de uma vida mais simples e significativa. 

Eis o que vais encontrar no primeiro número: 

- Um artigo sobre como o algodão orgânico ajuda a melhorar o modo de vida dos agricultores

- O Albert Einstein era um minimalista? Um artigo de Sam Lustgarten do blog Frugaling

- Como a arte ancestral do Kintsugi transforma cerâmicas partidas em objetos ainda mais preciosos do que eram anteriormente

- Pinturas da artista nova-iorquina Katte Geneta feitas com materias vulcânicos para simbolizar a beleza e a fragilidade da natureza

- Uma crítica ao filme Mon Oncle sobre simplicidade e modernidade

- A história da youtuber Aileen Xu, a pessoa responsável pelo canal do Youtube Lavendaire

- Três poemas sobre o silêncio em Wittgenstein escritos pelo Emanuel Madalena

- Um artigo sobre as virtudes do Snapchat, uma rede social onde tudo  o que partilhamos expira em 24 horas.  

...e muito mais.


Mais sobre o primeiro número da NEVOAZUL

100 páginas

Capa - CLA 240gr 

Páginas - IOR 100 gr


Sobre nós

Inês Catarina Pinto - Editora e escritora

Mestre em Estudos de Média e Jornalismo, ela decidiu criar a NEVOAZUL para aliar o seu interesse pelas temáticas do minimalismo, consumismo, sustentabilidade e cultura com a sua paixão pelo jornalismo editorial. Inspirada pelas montanhas, pela escrita da Patti Smith e pela música dos Beach House, ela assina vários ensaios, entrevistas e reportagens na NEVOAZUL.


Pedro Oliveira - Director Criativo

Mestre em Arquitetura, ele usa pontos, linhas e formas geométricas com equilibradas composições cromáticas para desenhar as páginas da NEVOAZUL. A sua maior inspiração é também a sua primeira grande referência artística, o sistema educacional da Bauhaus. 


O que vais receber se apoiares a NEVOAZUL:

- Uma nota de agradecimento escrita à mão

- O teu nome impresso na primeira revista NEVOAZUL como um dos nossos primeiros contribuidores.

- Uma cópia da primeira edição da NEVOAZUL entregue diretamente a ti em qualquer sítio do mundo.

- CALMA, um pequeno livro com escritos pela Inês Catarina Pinto (tamanho A5)

- Uma gravura exclusiva e numerada em tons azulados (tamanho A3)

- Um poster desenhado pelo Pedro Oliveira (tamanho A1)

Ajuda-nos a passar a mensagem:

#nevoazulmag
Nós queremos sensibilizar sobre o impacto do consumismo compulsivo, do desperdício e dos problemas ambientais da nossa sociedade. Ajuda-nos a divulgar a revista NEVOAZUL e juntos podemos abrir o debate sobre como a responsabilidade social, o comportamento sustentável e a moda ética podem fazer a diferença no nosso futuro.

Custos, riscos e desafios 

Nós avaliamos cuidadosamente os riscos, os desafios e os custos de lançar um projeto como a NEVOAZUL.

O dinheiro que vamos angariar com esta campanha vai ser dedicado à impressão e distribuição da primeira edição da NEVOAZUL. Precisamos de conseguir pelo menos 5.000€ para imprimir 1000 cópias e distribui-las. Cada revista da NEVOAZUL vai custar 15€, o que corresponde a cerca de 15£ e 22$ . Nós estamos confiantes que conseguimos criar uma publicação interessante que te irá fazer reflectir sobre o mundo que te rodeia enquanto te dá a conhecer as pessoas que querem mudar o mundo.

A nossa maior preocupação é fazer com que a versão impressa da revista chegue às tuas mãos sem teres de pagar elevados portes de envio. Enquanto tentamos resolver essa questão vamos disponibilizar uma versão da revista em formato digital para aqueles que preferem ter a sua biblioteca em formato digital e para quem não pode suportar os portes de envio para fora da Europa.  

Apesar dos elevados riscos de lançar uma publicação impressa, nós analisámos e planeamos este projeto tendo em conta todos os seus riscos e estamos confiantes que os últimos meses de planeamento nos deixaram preparados criar uma revista como a NEVOAZUL.

Este projeto já está numa fase avançada de produção. Os conteúdos estão prontos e o design está quase finalizado. Só precisamos da tua ajuda para a fase final de produção. 


Segue-nos nas redes sociais:

Facebook     Ello    Instagram     Twitter

- Um artigo sobre como o algodão orgânico ajuda a melhorar o modo de vida dos agricultores

- O Albert Einstein era um minimalista? Um artigo de Sam Lustgarten do blog Frugaling
- Como a arte ancestral do Kintsugi transforma cerâmicas partidas em objetos ainda mais preciosos do que eram anteriormente
- Pinturas da artista nova-iorquina Katte Geneta feitas com materias vulcânicos para simbolizar a beleza e a fragilidade da natureza
- Uma crítica ao filme Mon Oncle sobre simplicidade e modernidade
- A história da youtuber Aileen Xu, a pessoa responsável pelo canal do Youtube Lavendaire
- Três poemas sobre o silêncio em Wittgenstein escritos pelo Emanuel Madalena
- Um artigo sobre as virtudes do Snapchat, uma rede social onde tudo  o que partilhamos expira em 24 horas.  
...e muito mais.









Mais sobre o primeiro
número da NEVOAZUL
100 páginas
Capa - CLA 240gr 
Páginas - IOR 100 gr

Sobre nós

Inês Catarina Pinto - Editora e escritora
Mestre em Estudos de Média e Jornalismo, ela decidiu criar a NEVOAZUL para aliar o seu interesse pelas temáticas do minimalismo, consumismo, sustentabilidade e cultura com a sua paixão pelo jornalismo editorial. Inspirada pelas montanhas, pela escrita da Patti Smith e pela música dos Beach House, ela assina vários ensaios, entrevistas e reportagens na NEVOAZUL.

Pedro Oliveira - Director Criativo
Mestre em Arquitetura, ele usa pontos, linhas e formas geométricas com equilibradas composições cromáticas para desenhar as páginas da NEVOAZUL. A sua maior inspiração é também a sua primeira grande referência artística, o sistema educacional da Bauhaus. 




O que vais receber se
apoiares a NEVOAZUL:
- Uma nota de agradecimento escrita à
mão
- O teu nome impresso na primeira
revista NEVOAZUL como um dos nossos primeiros contribuidores. 
- Uma cópia da primeira edição da
NEVOAZUL entregue diretamente a ti em qualquer sítio do mundo. 
- CALMA, um pequeno livro com escritos
pela Inês Catarina Pinto (tamanho A5)
- Uma gravura exclusiva e numerada em
tons azulados (tamanho A3)
- Um poster desenhado pelo Pedro
Oliveira (tamanho A1)


Ajuda-nos a passar a mensagem:
#nevoazulmag
Nós queremos sensibilizar sobre o impacto do consumismo compulsivo, do desperdício e dos problemas ambientais da nossa sociedade. Ajuda-nos a divulgar a revista NEVOAZUL e juntos podemos abrir o debate sobre como a responsabilidade social, o comportamento sustentável e a moda ética podem fazer a diferença no nosso futuro.


Custos, riscos e desafios 
Nós avaliamos
cuidadosamente os riscos, os desafios e os custos de lançar um projeto como a
NEVOAZUL. 
O dinheiro que vamos angariar com esta
campanha vai ser dedicado à impressão e distribuição da primeira edição da
NEVOAZUL. Precisamos de conseguir pelo menos 5.000€ para imprimir 1000 cópias e
distribui-las. Cada revista da NEVOAZUL vai custar 15€, o que corresponde a
cerca de 15£ e 22$ . Nós estamos confiantes que conseguimos criar uma
publicação interessante que te irá fazer reflectir sobre o mundo que te rodeia
enquanto te dá a conhecer as pessoas que querem
mudar o mundo. 

A nossa maior preocupação é fazer com
que a versão impressa da revista chegue às tuas mãos sem teres de pagar
elevados portes de envio. Enquanto tentamos resolver essa questão vamos
disponibilizar uma versão da revista em formato digital para aqueles que
preferem ter a sua biblioteca em formato digital e para quem não pode suportar
os portes de envio para fora da Europa.  
Apesar dos elevados riscos de lançar uma
publicação impressa, nós analisámos e planeamos este projeto tendo em conta
todos os seus riscos e estamos confiantes que os últimos meses de planeamento nos deixaram preparados criar uma revista como a NEVOAZUL. 
Este projeto já está numa fase avançada
de produção. Os conteúdos estão prontos e o design está quase finalizado. Só
precisamos da tua ajuda para a fase final de produção.
