Facebook     Ello    Instagram     Twitter

story:
Keep scrolling down and you'll find our message in English

Tú lo sabes tanto como nosotros: estamos en uno de esos momentos críticos en que las cosas más impensables suceden todos los días y quienes las cometen hacen todo lo posible para ocultarlas y seguirlas cometiendo con impunidad. Decía Al Gore, quien conoce el tema bastante bien: “Si la gente no está informada, no puede pedir cuentas al gobierno cuando es incompetente, corrupto o ambas”.

Aquí es donde entramos nosotros: Desde Julio del 2014 hemos hecho más de 300 investigaciones a profundidad que van desde las donaciones de Odebrecht a campañas de políticos tanto de oposición como oficialistas en Venezuela, los Panama Papers o la serie sobre el colapso del sistema público de salud. Hace unos días, ganamos el segundo lugar en el Premio Latinoamericano de Periodismo de Investigación 2017, otorgado por IPYS, por nuestra serie ”Outsourcing militar” acerca de como los uniformados han conquistado los contratos e importaciones multimillonarias del Estado,

Queremos ampliar nuestro trabajo, incrementando el número de crónicas que  publicamos por semana y generando un concurso entre periodistas de investigación latinoamericanos para desarrollar historias de alcance regional como la serie sobre Lava Jato (el entramado de corrupción entre empresas brasileras y políticos corruptos que involucra 12 países, entre ellos Venezuela y, al menos, 6 ex-presidentes). 

Entendiendo que cada una involucra al menos dos meses de trabajo, invitamos a financiar un día de trabajo, dos, una semana o hasta una historia completa. Vemos esta campaña como una oportunidad para que miles de venezolanos elevemos nuestra voz, en un momento tan crítico de opacidad e impunidad y revelemos en conjunto lo que poderosos sin escrúpulos quieren ocultar

Financia una investigación

En cada una de las investigaciones que publicamos en nuestro sitio web invertimos en promedio dos meses y $400, es un trabajo arduo conseguir y confirmar la información que nos permite revelar lo que algunos poderosos quieren ocultar. 

Contribuye desde:

  • Un día de investigación: mantente informado de cada una con la activación de tu suscripción mensual.
  • Dos semanas de investigación:  activaremos tu suscripción trimestral y enviaremos para tu colección nuestro libro Panama Papers .
  • Y más, busca en las recompensas o fija tu el monto con el que deseas colaborar.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 Todos los aportes son valiosos para nosotros, así que:
  • Comparte nuestra campaña
  • No te pierdas ninguna de nuestras investigaciones públicas en la sección Demo de Armando.info
  • Siguenos en nuestras redes sociales

Web: Armando.info

Facebook: @armando.investiga

Instagram: @armando.info

Twitter: @armandoinfo

English Version

We have published over 300 in-depth investigations, from Odebrecht donations to political campaigns, the Panama Papers, to the series on the collapse of the public health system. We want to expand our work by increasing the number of investigations we publish per week and developing stories of regional scope, such as the Lava Jato series that involves 12 countries. We invite readers to contribute to the development of our investigations.

You know as much as we do. We are in one of those critical moments when the most unthinkable things happen every day, and the people involved do everything possible to hide them and continue with their actions with impunity. Al Gore, who knows the subject quite well, said, "If people are not informed, they cannot hold the government accountable when it is incompetent, corrupt or both."


This is where we play our part. Since July 2014, we have conducted over 300 in-depth investigations, from Odebrecht donations to campaigns of both opposition and pro-government politicians in Venezuela and the Panama Papers, to the series on the collapse of the Venezuelan public health system. A few days ago, we won the second place in the Latin American Investigative Journalism Award 2017, awarded by IPYS, for our series "Military Outsourcing" about how uniformed people have won contracts and multimillion-dollar imports of the Government.


We want to expand our work by increasing the number of reports we publish per week and generating a competition among Latin American investigative journalists to develop stories of regional scope such as the series on Lava Jato (the corruption framework between Brazilian companies and corrupt politicians that involves 12 countries, including Venezuela, and at least 6 former presidents).


Understanding that each story involves at least two months of work, we invite you to finance a day of work, two days, a week, or even a whole story. We see this campaign as an opportunity for thousands of Venezuelans to raise our voice in a critical moment of opacity and impunity and reveal together what powerful unscrupulous people want to hide.


Fund an Investigation

In each investigation we publish on our website, we invest two months and US$ 400 in average.
Obtaining and confirming the information that allows us to reveal what some powerful people want to hide is a hard work. 


Contribute with:

  • One day of investigation: Keep abreast of each story by activating your monthly subscription.
  • Two weeks of investigation: Have your quarterly subscription activated and receive our Panama Papers book for your collection.
  • And more, look at the rewards or set the amount you want to collaborate with

Other ways you can help

 Any contribution is valuable to us, so:

  • Share our campaign
  • Do not miss any of our public investigations in the Demo section of Armando.info
  • Follow us on our social media

Web: Armando.info

Facebook: @armando.investiga

Instagram: @armando.info

Twitter: @armandoinfo

story:
My name is Mike McCready. No not the Mike McCready from Pearl Jam (I get that a lot). I've been writing about social media, marketing, and customer service for 7 years.

I have a passion for understanding social as it relates to businesses - both externally and internally.

I've often thought about writing a book and now I think the time is right.

About the Project

Recently I shared an article on LinkedIn about Starbucks' Tweet-a-Coffee campaign.

In the first 2 days it received over 71,000 views, over 350 comments, and over 8,000 shares. 

The response was overwhelming and led me to believe that people love reading and talking about innovative businesses. 

I want to create a book that examines the how and why businesses are social, but more importantly, I want to have you help me write it. I'm looking for amazing case studies that you've written about social businesses. Why they were social, how they did it, and how others could adopt that strategy. 

I want to crowd fund a book AND I want to crowd source it.

We all have amazing thoughts, lets share them! 

What the Funding Covers

Funds from this Indiegogo project will cover the 'All-Inclusive' self-publishing package from FriesenPress.  The package includes: 

  • Editorial evaluation
  • Professional copy-editing
  • Custom layout
  • Premium cover design
  • 2 revision rounds
  • Copyright
  • 3 ISBNs
  • Book distribution services
  • Author website
  • Promotion plan
  • Press release

Want to Contribute?

While the specifics of the make up of the book are not finalized, the general areas that I'm looking for case studies are:

  • Social Selling
  • Social Service
  • Social Marketing
  • Social Recruitment
  • Social Giving

If you have an amazing case study of an organization that falls under one of these categories and want to contribute, email me at mike@mikemccready.ca or find me on Twitter.

Everyone who contributes a case study which is included in the book will receive the following:

  • 2 digital copies of the book
  • Full credit for the case study
  • A 50 word contributor bio (including a website URL)
  • My eternal gratitude

Other Ways You Can Help

This project won't succeed without your help.  Even simply using the social sharing buttons to help spread the word would help tremendously.

story:
My name is Sandra Lynn Sparks. For years, I have worked on the research of past life recall, having uncovered and verified several of my own past lives; I have also helped others in the search for their own. In other areas I've been fortunate enough to work in Shakespearean theater, and to have a close interest in both the works and life of William Shakespeare. I have brought these two interests together in a novel about a strange story that has slipped through the cracks of history: why would the 3rd Earl of Pembroke, possibly Shakespeare's lover, choose to marry a dwarf? What reasons and consequences were bound up in this decision?

In order to bring this novel to the public:

  • I am raising funds for an initial advertising campaign on facebook, and to order advanced copies.
  • Donors who contribute $20 or more will receive a personal signed copy of the novel. All donations, unless specified anonymous, will be acknowledged on http://sasmalltaleofshakespeare.tumblr.com/
  • All of the funds collected will be directed towards the advertising and advanced copies. The more that is raised, the more that can be done.

I feel that :S: can make an impact in many ways:

  • Many people do not understand the very real ways past lives affect our current lifetimes. The novel helps explain what past life recall really is.
  • It also explains how the influence of one person, especially a man like William Shakespeare, can leave an impact far after his lifetime is over, not only by his work, but by how he lived his life.
  • Whether you are interested in reincarnation, Shakespeare, or just reading a good mystery, I feel many people will enjoy this novel.

If you can not contribute at this time:
  • Please help me get the word out to others!
  • There are Indiegogo share tools that can help you do this. Also, please like the facebook page for  S - A Small Tale of Shakespeare, and share it with your friends. Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Founded by Nita Noveno in the summer of 2002, the Sunday Salon is dedicated to welcoming a diverse mix of emerging and established writers to its stage at Jimmy's no. 43 in New York's East Village. As one of the oldest running series in the city, it has inspired the launch of other salons across the country, and maintains a sister series in Chicago (and previously, in Nairobi.) In addition to providing a respected venue for local and international voices, the Salon demonstrates its commitment to community through its literary zine and by continuing to promote, celebrate and connect with writers online. 

This campaign will help fund:
- 2015 operation costs
- Venue and equipment 
- Website re-design including the launch of the next literary Salon Zine
- Partnership with a mobile bookseller to sell authors' titles
- Travel expenses for writers who otherwise would not be able to read for us

story:
APRIL 1 UPDATE: 

THRILLED to have met goal and incredibly grateful for all the people who've offered support!!

If you’re here for the first time or a return visitor to the page and thinking about giving a gift, PLEASE KNOW that any additional funds would be greatly helpful as well. Trips like this always have additional expenses. And a new idea has emerged....

I'd LOVE to have a "writer’s retreat" with the girls while I’m in Cape Town. Hopefully overnight, or at least all day, somewhere beautiful, maybe out on the peninsula near the Cape of Good Hope. Time away from Gugulethu, for them to have a chance to write about where they are in their lives now, what writing has meant to them, and what they see in their futures. I think this would make a great epilogue for the book, and especially in the girls’ own words.  

Additional gifts will help make that retreat happen!

Enkosi -- THANK YOU -- so much for helping raise the Voices of the Girls! 

*** 

“Words mean more than what is set down on paper. It takes the human voice to infuse them with shades of deeper meaning.” 

Maya Angelou, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

 

The Born Frees are setting their words down on paper. They’re finding their voices.  And together, we’re telling their stories. 

Will you join with us?  

 

The Backstory: “Voices of the Girls”

In 2010, I left behind a career working in communications for DC nonprofits to go to South Africa as a Fulbright Scholar. I had just completed an MFA in nonfiction writing, and I was ready to write my first book. As I was trying to find my voice as a writer, I wanted to help others do the same. So I spent a year leading a creative writing club for teen-aged girls in Gugulethu, a township ten miles outside Cape Town. They named the group Amazw’Entombi -- “Voices of the Girls,” in Xhosa.

THE BORN FREES: Writing with the Girls of Gugulethu will be a narrative nonfiction account of several members of the club. My book is the first that tells the stories of this generation of black South African girls “born free” and coming of age after the end of apartheid, and the first that incorporates the words of girls themselves, their poetry and prose. 

Along with racial liberation, they inherited a country plagued by poverty. They’ve lost mothers and fathers, to AIDS and violence. In a place where the rape of women--and even little girls--is widespread, some have lost things they struggle to name. And still, they act like girls. They’re fun and funny, resilient and smart as a whip. They come together around the power of their own words. Their spirits, their writing, and the power of their insight--about themselves and about their beloved country--continue to astonish me.

  

Where the Book Stands Now -- And What It Still Needs

I’m beyond thrilled that my book is under contract with W.W. Norton, one of the best publishers in the world. THE BORN FREES will be published in 2014, which coincides with the 20th anniversary of South Africa’s first democratic elections. I’ve previously written about South Africa for The Atlantic and Sojourners, and as a fellow through the International Reporting Project. 

As wonderful a publisher as Norton is, a book about girls in South Africa in 2013 earns only a modest book deal. So I’m funding the research and writing of this book myself. I don’t have any organizational or academic backing. As a freelance writer, I also don’t have a steady salary. 

My manuscript is due to Norton in October 2013. I need one final trip to South Africa to complete research for the book, to see what’s happening in the girls’ lives now. I also want to conduct interviews with in-country experts so I can understand and convey to readers the challenges these girls face, now and in a future South Africa. 

A plane ticket to Cape Town averages $1,500. Other major expenses include car rental, gas, lodging, food, and an internet data plan to send updates about this project. I hope to stay at least a month, traveling there by April. Any additional funds raised beyond my set goal will allow me to extend the trip, and maybe also provide some financial cushion as I finish writing the book back in DC.  

This book truly is a labor of love. I love South Africa, I love these girls, and I know you'll love them, too. 

What You’ll Receive 

It takes a village, right? Welcome to our village! 

You will partner with me to get the story of these amazing girls out into the world, helping them to raise their own voices. And I want to show my gratitude to you with some special gifts -- a thank-you photo card, a sneak preview of a chapter-in-progress, a listing in the acknowledgements when the book is in print, a session of the creative writing club (via Skype or in person), a handcrafted gift from South Africa. So choose your support level (on the right) and enjoy the rewards!

When the book’s in bookstores and available online next year, you’ll know you played an important role in bringing it out and making it as compelling as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, please help to spread the word about The Born Frees and this campaign. Find us on Facebook for regular updates. And look for The Born Frees: Writing with the Girls of Gugulethu when it’s out in 2014!

story_txt:
APRIL 1 UPDATE: 
THRILLED to have met goal and incredibly grateful for all the people who've offered support!!
If you’re here for the first time or a return visitor to the page and thinking about giving a gift, PLEASE KNOW that any additional funds would be greatly helpful as well. Trips like this always have additional expenses. And a new idea has emerged....
I'd LOVE to have a "writer’s retreat" with the girls while I’m in Cape Town. Hopefully overnight, or at least all day, somewhere beautiful, maybe out on the peninsula near the Cape of Good Hope. Time away from Gugulethu, for them to have a chance to write about where they are in their lives now, what writing has meant to them, and what they see in their futures. I think this would make a great epilogue for the book, and especially in the girls’ own words.  
Additional gifts will help make that retreat happen!
Enkosi -- THANK YOU -- so much for helping raise the Voices of the Girls! 
*** 
“Words mean more than what is set down on paper. It takes the human voice to infuse them with shades of deeper meaning.” 
Maya Angelou, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
 
The Born Frees are setting their words down on paper. They’re finding their voices.  And together, we’re telling their stories. 
Will you join with us?  
 
The Backstory: “Voices of the Girls”
In 2010, I left behind a career working in communications for DC nonprofits to go to South Africa as a Fulbright Scholar. I had just completed an MFA in nonfiction writing, and I was ready to write my first book. As I was trying to find my voice as a writer, I wanted to help others do the same. So I spent a year leading a creative writing club for teen-aged girls in Gugulethu, a township ten miles outside Cape Town. They named the group Amazw’Entombi -- “Voices of the Girls,” in Xhosa.
THE BORN FREES: Writing with the Girls of Gugulethu will be a narrative nonfiction account of several members of the club. My book is the first that tells the stories of this generation of black South African girls “born free” and coming of age after the end of apartheid, and the first that incorporates the words of girls themselves, their poetry and prose. 
Along with racial liberation, they inherited a country plagued by poverty. They’ve lost mothers and fathers, to AIDS and violence. In a place where the rape of women--and even little girls--is widespread, some have lost things they struggle to name. And still, they act like girls. They’re fun and funny, resilient and smart as a whip. They come together around the power of their own words. Their spirits, their writing, and the power of their insight--about themselves and about their beloved country--continue to astonish me.
  
Where the Book Stands Now -- And What It Still Needs
I’m beyond thrilled that my book is under contract with W.W. Norton, one of the best publishers in the world. THE BORN FREES will be published in 2014, which coincides with the 20th anniversary of South Africa’s first democratic elections. I’ve previously written about South Africa for The Atlantic and Sojourners, and as a fellow through the International Reporting Project. 
As wonderful a publisher as Norton is, a book about girls in South Africa in 2013 earns only a modest book deal. So I’m funding the research and writing of this book myself. I don’t have any organizational or academic backing. As a freelance writer, I also don’t have a steady salary. 
My manuscript is due to Norton in October 2013. I need one final trip to South Africa to complete research for the book, to see what’s happening in the girls’ lives now. I also want to conduct interviews with in-country experts so I can understand and convey to readers the challenges these girls face, now and in a future South Africa. 
A plane ticket to Cape Town averages $1,500. Other major expenses include car rental, gas, lodging, food, and an internet data plan to send updates about this project. I hope to stay at least a month, traveling there by April. Any additional funds raised beyond my set goal will allow me to extend the trip, and maybe also provide some financial cushion as I finish writing the book back in DC.  
This book truly is a labor of love. I love South Africa, I love these girls, and I know you'll love them, too. 
What You’ll Receive 
It takes a village, right? Welcome to our village! 
You will partner with me to get the story of these amazing girls out into the world, helping them to raise their own voices. And I want to show my gratitude to you with some special gifts -- a thank-you photo card, a sneak preview of a chapter-in-progress, a listing in the acknowledgements when the book is in print, a session of the creative writing club (via Skype or in person), a handcrafted gift from South Africa. So choose your support level (on the right) and enjoy the rewards!
When the book’s in bookstores and available online next year, you’ll know you played an important role in bringing it out and making it as compelling as possible.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute, please help to spread the word about The Born Frees and this campaign. Find us on Facebook for regular updates. And look for The Born Frees: Writing with the Girls of Gugulethu when it’s out in 2014! 
Enkosi. Thank you.
--Kimberly

story:
What’s Real Advice For The Unemployed? 

To much of the planet, the unemployed are just numbers on a page. We’re part of the 7.8%, or 7.9%, or whatever number that’s being used at the end of each month to explain the unemployment percentages. We’re one of the 13,000,000... no, wait, you have to add in the underemployed, so now we’re part of the 17,000,000... no, wait, you have to add in the numbers that have completely stopped looking for work altogether, so now we’re part of the 20,000,000 unemployed. And on and on and on.

Numbers on a page.   

You may be one of them. Or know someone who is.

Two Very Important Things You Need To Know:

Your investment ACTUALLY matters.

You do not need to be unemployed to invest in this book.This book has the potential of reaching thousands of people who are desperate for any help they can get to face the enormous problems and pressures brought on by unemployment. They are urgently looking for solutions they cannot find themselves. This book acts as that advocate for them, and lets them know there is help and there are solutions.

You do not need to be unemployed to find this book useful:

This book has been designed to speak to those who are always on the financial edge. It teaches you how to navigate the rough waters of home finance, relationships with your wife/husband/children, and how to deal with those who could, with one stroke of the pen, take it all away from you.

What Does "Real Advice" Actually Mean?

Real Advice For The Unemployed is a new book that offers you lots of helpful coping skills, relevant stories, and solid advice on getting yourself whole again - emotionally, as well as financially. Use it as your guide, your road map, to find your way back to prosperity. 

In this essential reader, we cover a whole host of tips on lowering your mortgage and car payments, how to handle Gary, the guy on the other end of the phone who wants to get paid, job hunting advice, dealing with the government, handling your spouse and family, and a whole bunch of survival skills that help you confront the day-to-day mountain of problems unemployment brings. There's also a lot of amusing anecdotal and poignant stories that discuss the absurdities of the unemployed life, and remind you that you are not going crazy, and you don’t have to go through this alone.

                          

Is There More? Of Course.

You not only get to read this informative and helpful book for some great guidance and encouragement, but participate in it as well. We want you to submit your own personal story of frustration and madness of what unemployment has meant to you and your family. It can consist of a sentence or two, or even a whole page. The stories that you send to us will be included throughout the pages of the book.

We will give you a real platform to tell the world, in your own words, the upheaval your unemployment has caused. If you would like, we will even include a photograph of you and your family so that everyone who reads the book will have a better sense of who you are.

That you are much more than just a number on a page.

We’re talking about the incredible, insane choices you now have to make almost every day.

Just as one easy example: You’re at the grocery store in the condiments aisle. As you survey the products, you already know that Grey Poupon is out of the question. So you look at the French's Mustard. That’s when you remember that you have no bread at home and not enough money to buy both the mustard and the bread. So you stand there trying to look, well, normal, as your brain attempts to sort this mess out. “I can get bread, but I’ll have no mustard to put on it. Or, I can get mustard, but I’ll have no bread to put it on.” Goddamnsonofabitch. 

        

            

                                    OR    

                          

 

 

 

Not too long ago you bought bread and you bought mustard. Now, it doesn’t quite work that way. The above situation doesn’t represent a complex or large financial issue, but it’s real. And it totally sucks.

Diapers or toilet paper? At least somebody gets wiped today.

Honestly, how many times do we get to sit down with anyone, and I mean anyone, and talk about that part of being unemployed?

Rarely, if ever. We simply just never get it out. Until now.

The following is a sample from Chapter One.

Click Here!

You can also visit the web page at RealAdviceForTheUnemployed.com

 

What Will Your Investment Be Used For?

We have big plans for this book. Depending on how many responses we get, formatting this book could be quite a challenge. It’s a complex job, but an important one. And it should be.

We wrote this book not only because it’s relevant, but because we have something to offer people who, right now, are faced with complex decisions that directly affect their lives. Decisions that just a short time ago, they never thought they would have to make.

And like everything else, getting this book out costs money. Getting it out correctly and professionally costs even more. Your investment will be used for EDITING, COLLATING, FORMATTING, TYPESETTING, PUBLISHING, DISTRIBUTION, MARKETING, COVER ART, TAXES, and all the other expected and unexpected costs we have to face.

If we can get to our stretch goals, we will be able to produce a limited number of hard bound copies, get that ISBN number, and create more copies for distribution. This campaign, if successful, will help us connect with an extensive audience. There's real value in that.

Also, if we are able to surpass our goals we will even distribute free of charge, any remaining copies to those who are unemployed and can’t afford to purchase one. They can pay us back by finding employment. And, it’s just good Karma.

What Can You Do?

  • Invest what you can. 
  • Encourage those you know to check us out.
  • Send your story and photo to: sam@realadvicefortheunemployed.com
  • If you can’t send via your computer, you can mail me your information. Send what you have to: Sam Murphy P.O. Box 26, Lecanto, Fl. 34460. 
  • Even if you are not unemployed, maybe you know someone who is. You may invest in this book in their name. We will include them in the Acknowledgement Page.
  • Be kind and spread the word. You can do this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, and any other place you can think of.

 

 

Availability

With the exception of editing and adding your submissions, the entire book has been written. This all means that the project is ready to go. I’m sure you can tell by my overuse, misuse, and abuse of punctuation, not to mention syntax, I’m really going to need a very talented editor. All that’s left is putting everything together, printing, and distribution. The talented editor is standing by. The biggest challenge at this point will be collecting and collating contributors’ stories and photos, and getting them ready for inclusion. We are giving that portion a two week time limit.

Should all go even remotely close to the original plans, we have allocated enough days to get everything done done and done by mid to late June of 2013. 

Regardless, We will keep you all updated throughout the process with frequent updates.

story:
Que?

Pillabán, pillabán!  mostra un tempo pasado no que a vida non valía un peso e a xente facía o que podía para sobrelevalo.

O 24 de decembro do ano 1431, noite de fin de ano, un frade negro avanza con dificultade, baixo unha forte treboada, cara a casa que lle fora arrebatada á súa familia corenta e cinco anos atrás polo bispo Pero Lopes de Aguiar, á que ten prohibido volver. Pouco despois de ser acollido nela, chega un soldado. As olladas dos dous crúzanse. Xa se coñecen. Mais non ousan dicir nada.

Estamos nos tempos de María Castaña, a cabalo entre o fin da Idade Media e o comezo da Idade Moderna, nunha Galiza convulsa que non acaba de atopar o seu lugar no mundo, onde os nobres abusan do seu poder e son considerados polo pobo os auténticos malfeitores.

Quen?

 

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentásenos a Amador Castro.

Son un home de aldea. Concretamente de Nandulfe, nas terras de Chantada. E tamén un home urbano. Crieime e vivo en Barcelona. Un galaico-catalán que herdou dos pais o amor pola terra que o viu nacer e marchar moi cedo. Que medrou falando galego na casa e catalán na rúa.

Empecei a escribir moi cedo. O Diario de Barcelona publicoume un relato con quince anos. Editei, xunto con tres compañeiros máis, unha revista de poesía no instituto. Pero cando vin impresos cinco poemas meus na Escolma da poesía galega 1976-1984 de Xosé Lois García, deume unha vasca e pensei que deixar por escrito algo para sempre é unha responsabilidade moi grande. E dediqueime ao punk. Rematada a etapa de músico, o deserto literario, a licenciatura en Socioloxía e o traballo no desenrolo de aplicacións informáticas. Até que hai pouco publiquei a primeira novela Memorias de antes do encoro retomando unha actividade literaria que xa non penso deixar. Vocación tardía? Non. É que son diésel.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«Cando rematei de ler a carta non sabía que dicir. Un silencio maior que o que hai nun convento pola noite, maior aínda que o que hai nunha cripta, apoderouse daquela estanza. As chamas da lareira queimaban en silencio. Os que alí estabamos respirabamos sen facer ruído. Os cabalos non rinchaban, as vacas non bruaban, os burros non orneaban, os porcos non gruñían. As moscas e as bolboretas nocturnas non se movían. Non me atrevía a dicir palabra ningunha trala mestura de sensacións e sentimentos que me invadira lendo a carta coa voz crebada. Un ano pensando que a nai morrera. Corenta e cinco ouvindo nada máis que parvadas sobre unha María Castaña inventada. E agora, da súa mesma letra, por fin tiña respostas. Entón apertei a carta contra o peito e boteime a chorar en silencio»

«Empezou bastante ben, pero á metade da leira as vacas viraron para pacer nunhas herbas que medraran un pouco máis alá. Esquecéranos pórlles o bozo. Non é que o rego quedase torto. Fixeron unha curva case que perfecta. "Sodes as vacas máis ruíns que hai en todo Çereixa" berrou o Pillabán. Eu quedei marabillado de que fose capaz de o dicir todo seguido, sen tatexar nin repetir palabra ningunha. Pero tamén me deu a risa. Entón díxenlle: "se llo dis por tras, han pensar que es un covarde". O Pillabán deixouno todo, púxose diante das vacas, ergueu o furabolos e abaneándoo, coa cara moi seria, engadiu: "e tal como volo digo por tras, tamén volo digo por diante". Eu partía coa risa pola mirada indiferente das vacas. Pero o Pillabán debeu quedar satisfeito. Fíxoas pór no sitio e seguiu arando, desta vez sen torcer un so rego máis»

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 920€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Pillabán, pillabán!, que sairía despois á venda.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Amador Castro vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Pillabán, pillabán!, que sairía despois á venda.
Ademais...
Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Amador Castro vexa publicada a súa obra.
Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
¿Qué?

Hortensias deshojadas nos muestra la realidad que supuso para muchos jóvenes, con la llegada de la Guerra Civil Española, el conocer lo que era un verdadero odio y lo que era una verdadera amistad.

Ya en la posguerra, Nieves, Mario y Roberto sufrieron en su corazón cada uno de ellos la desfloración, el atropello y un desgarrador desenlace, mientras los vencedores, con el premio a su victoria en su bolsillo y creyéndose que todo sería un alfombrado camino de vino y rosas, acabaron convirtiéndolo por su engreimiento en oscuros y espinosos vericuetos. Para los perdedores supondría el tener que soportar ya no la pesada carga de los vencedores que no les dejaron vivir sino también la de tener que soportar la brutalidad y la de tener que jugar al olvido.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Félix Sanz Gómez.

Nacido el 28 de Junio de 1952, en un hogar humilde, tuvo que dejar los estudios a una edad temprana para poder ayudar a su familia. Tras muchos años dedicados a realizar trabajos en la construcción para poder mantener a su familia, por fin, pudo dedicarse a su verdadera vocación, plasmar todas sus ideas en papel.

Sobre todo dedicado al relato corto, obtuvo el tercer accésit del IV Certamen Narración Breve Ciudadanos Mayores con su relato «La vía muerta» en el año 2014, obteniendo, ese mismo año, el segundo premio del II Concurso Literario ―Modalidad Narrativa― Centro Municipal Actividades Personas Mayores Pare Jofre con el relato titulado «Esperando a Teresa». Durante cuatro años, ha sido colaborador de la revista cultural Hontanar, de Alustante (Guadalajara), donde también obtuvo el primer premio en narrativa con el relato «Domingo de resurrección», en el Concurso Literario Asociación Cultural Hontanar.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Al día siguiente en uno de los Álamos que había en la plaza del pueblo durante dos horas tuvieron el cadáver del maqui colgado bocabajo, su exposición supuso un duro ultraje para la mayoría de los vecinos pero nadie dijo nada, a Mario le obligaron a que fuera él quien lo enterrara pero no le dejaron que lo hiciera en el cementerio, sino al lado de una de sus paredes por la parte trasera.
          Sobre las ocho de la tarde el cielo comenzó a encapotarse de una forma alarmante, unos sólidos y negruzcos nubarrones lentamente se iban agrupando formando como una gigantesca mole anulando por completo la ya escasa luz solar, por el irregular horizonte por culpa de las sinuosa montañas que rodeaban al pueblo, unos destellantes relámpagos rasgaban el firmamento como largos latigazos incandescentes, para décimas de segundo más tarde reventar con interminables y estruendosos truenos que parecían estremecer la tierra, después de una fuerte ventolera la inestable climatología dio paso a unas gruesas gotas de agua que golpeaban con fuerza las empedradas calles para minutos más tarde convertirse en un aluvión de agua que duraría varias horas.
          Mario ayudándose de la luz del candil leía un viejo libro apoyado en la mesa de la cocina, su padre dormitaba sentado en una silla recostado sobre la pared al lado de la ahora apagada chimenea, unos pequeños golpes sobre el cristal en la ventana de la cocina le hicieron levantar la cabeza, durante unos segundos estuvo atento pero nada parecía escucharse, reiniciando la lectura los pequeños golpecitos sobre el cristal se escucharon de nuevo, se levantó y con la ayuda del candil se aproximó a la ventana, una débil voz escuchó que provenía de la calle.       
          ―Compañero, compañero, abre la puerta, necesitamos tu ayuda.
          Mario movía el candil de un lado a otro con el fin de ayudarse con su débil luz y así poder ver quien le pedía ayuda, pero la espesa capa de lluvia y la congestionada oscuridad no le dejaban ver quién era, de nuevo se escucharon las palabras de auxilio.
          ―Tienes qué ayudarnos, tú eres nuestra última esperanza.
          Mario en la penumbra de la cocina se encogió de hombros sin saber que contestar.
          ―La vida de este hombre y la mía pueden depender de ti ―le dijeron de nuevo.  
          Mario no salía de su asombro, ahora aún estaba más desconcertado que antes, nunca imaginó una situación como aquella, tenía el corazón encogido, se acercó a la puerta y solo pudo hablar a borbotones».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Félix Sanz Gómez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Who is Eden Evans?

Eden Evans grew up with her mother and grandmother in Bayside, Queens, where she attended a private high school, graduating at age 15.  By 17, she was backstage at Madison Square Garden three nights a week and traveling up and down the eastern corridor with bands from Rainbow and Deep Purple to Iron Maiden, Dio, Eric Clapton and Kiss. She enjoyed a wild ride and became known as “The Whip Lady” and the “Queen of the New York Rock Scene.” 

At age 23, life handed her a challenge when she was diagnosed with a brain tumor, having surgery  two years later. But that did not stop her and she landed a job as an IT expert. Years later, Eden had another battle to face. After overcoming cancer multiple times, she was left with Delayed Radiation Syndrome and Panhypopituitarism. Yet, being the type of person who never gives up, she still slept with famous musicians, until she was in her 40's. She is now in the process of writing her memoir, “Good Times, Bad Times...” and is looking for: 

  • A Ghost Writer
  • A Public Relations Representative
  • A Publisher

Eden's Dream 

Eden will take you with her as she tells stories of sex, drugs and Rock 'n' Roll:

  • Eden has many tales about rock bands and their musicians and wants to share those stories with you about the fun, in explicit detail, while she still remembers!
  • Eden has warmth, intelligence and humor and will touch your heart, as she discusses her medical struggles with candor.
  • Since Eden is now disabled, she needs assistance to pay for the professionals that will help make her dream a reality.

Campaign Goals

Funding will cover:

  • A ghost writer
  • A Public Relations Representative
  • Perks

Funding will not cover:

  • Publication 
  • Advertising Expenses

Risks & Challenges

The greatest obstacle Eden may face on the way to achieving her goal:

  • Additional medical issues may arise, but with the help of a good ghost writer, her story can be told.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with everyone you have ever met in your life!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Bruce Langston, and I am the Executive Director of Ozarks Freedom to Soar-A SpiritHorse Therapeutic Riding Center. We are a non-profit, Christ-oriented, licensed organization that helps physically, mentally and emotionally challenged children and adults through horseback riding and one-on-one interaction.

We are curently in need of a place to begin our center. We have the property located but need donations to put a down payment on it. 100% of all donations go toward the purchase of the property and riding equipment. After meeting this goal we plan to expand the center to include: a day camp for terminally ill children, the rescue of abused and negleted animals, as well as the Horses for Heros program which provides Equine Assisted Healthcare to our wounded U.S. Military Veterans.

SpiritHorse is a 72 step method of therapeutic riding, also know as Equine
Assisted Healthcare. It is gaining acceptence in the medical field as a legitimate and successful tool for the developement of special needs individuals. Not only do the individuals get to interact with the horses, they get instruction from a SpiritHorse certified instructor who has had specialized training for this program which has been developed with the help of many experts in the medical field.

Most therapeutic riding is done in a group setting, but our SpiritHorse riding is done on a one-on-one basis that involves the parents' participation so as to design a program that best fits that individual's needs and progress. Although we do charge for these sessions, NO child is turned away due to their inability to pay. We only ask them to give what they can, and rely on donations to cover the rest of the cost. We are here for the children, every decision is made for the child, not the Center.

Your donation will help children grow both physically and mentally to their full potential. We don't offer "perks or gifts" for your donation, as we want all donations to go directly to the organization so we can get started as soon as possible. If, by chance, our goal is not met, rest assured all donations go into a special account until we can meet these goals.

If you are unable to donate, please get the word out and let people know about us. Like our page on facebook at www.facebook.com/ozarksfreedomtosoar and follow us on Twitter for regular updates on the fundraiser and our progress, and keep us in your prayers. 

For more information about SpiritHorse International go to www.spirithorsetherapy.com.

Our web site, www.ozarksfreedomtosoar.org is currently under construction. Please keep checking back with us and follow our progress as we begin our journey.

Thanking you all in advance and God Bless!

story:
Our Story

Is happiness only for a few lucky people?

Could happiness (or unhappiness) affect my health? My income? My relationships? (Hint: Yes!)

How do happy people do it? How do they pull themselves up over and over again?


I've worked with hundreds of clients with all kinds of life stories, and what I've seen over and over again is this bottom line: People want to be happy! They want their children to be happy! They want to know how to cope with the stress of life and be able to feel joy and find meaning. Happiness matters.


Is happiness compatible with 21st century life?

Is happiness dependent on one's circumstances in life?


The good news is that there is enough happiness to go around. Yes, even you can be happy - and I want to spread the word about how.

I've written a little book that describes the seven secrets that truly happy people know about getting - and staying - happy. I'd like to share it with the world.

Buying a book is a small enough price to pay for the secrets of true happiness, but  that's not good enough for me. I intend to give away the first 1000 copies of my little book. I need your help to cover the publication costs so that I can get these books into the hands of people who need them, people who are looking for a way to lift themselves up.

This book is different from other books you have read. It is small and concise - the secrets of happiness will fit in your purse or pocket. But the experience continues after you've read. The book experience continues online in a special web environment filled with additional thoughts, activities and inspirations. Listen to guided visualizations related to happiness. Ponder additional journal questions. View inspiring video. See where copies of the book have traveled. Grow your happiness habits.


The Impact

Distress, anxiety, and fear are all too common in the world today, creating a downward spiral that threatens to pull us all into negativity.


Happiness creates an upward spiral. Every person who learns how to keep themselves happy helps us all do the same. You know this is true! If the person who sells you coffee in the morning is chipper and bright, your day  takes on a completely different tone than if that same person is grumpy and out of sorts. 


Add to that, the fact that happiness, and the habits of happiness counteract the effects of stress hormones that flood our bodies all day long just from normal daily life.


Happiness and the habits of happiness can be life saving.

Help me spread the power of happiness by distributing 1000 free copies of my little book, Being Truly Happy which tells the seven secrets of Truly Happy People and puts true happiness into anyone's reach.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $1500.00 (USD) to cover the printing and delivery costs for the first 1000 copies of Being Truly Happy.


Any amount that I raise in this campaign will go towards these costs. If I meet my goal - great! If I don't, your money won't be wasted. I will still print and give away 1000 copies of my book - it'll just take me a little longer to save up and get it done. EVERY CONTRIBUTION HELPS!


Any amount raised over the goal will go towards printing more copies of the book that will also be distributed for free.


WHAT YOU GET:

For contributions of $10 - an autographed copy of Being Truly Happy

For contributions of $25.00 - the above + four additional signed copies for you to give as gifts (makes a great stocking stuffer)

For contributions o $100.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy + an audio download of Prosperity Meditations by author Sue Bryan

For contributions of $175.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy, your audio download of Prosperity Meditations + a free Happiness Coaching Session by phone with author, Sue Bryan.

For contributions of $250.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy, your audio downloads + Author, Sue Bryan will take you out to lunch. If you are not in the Los Angeles area, we will have a picnic together via online conference call.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD HAPPINESS! I fully realize that not everyone has money laying around to donate to someone else's cause. I appreciate you even reading this far!


Whether you contribute to this project or not, you can help spread happiness and help build that upward spiral of well being by endorsing this project and sending it out to your friends, family or network. You can also request additional copies of Being Truly Happy and for the cost of shipping to your location, you can have copies of the book to give out in your community. See my website to find out how.

Happiness creates an upward spiral. Every person who learns how to keep themselves happy helps us all do the same. You know this is true! If the person who sells you coffee in the morning is chipper and bright, your day  takes on a completely different tone than if that same person is grumpy and out of sorts. 

Add to that, the fact that happiness, and the habits of happiness counteract the effects of stress hormones that flood our bodies all day long just from normal daily life.

Happiness and the habits of happiness can be life saving.
Help me spread the power of happiness by distributing 1000 free copies of my little book, Being Truly Happy which tells the seven secrets of Truly Happy People and puts true happiness into anyone's reach. 

What We Need & What You Get
I need $1500.00 (USD) to cover the printing and delivery costs for the first 1000 copies of Being Truly Happy.

Any amount that I raise in this campaign will go towards these costs. If I meet my goal - great! If I don't, your money won't be wasted. I will still print and give away 1000 copies of my book - it'll just take me a little longer to save up and get it done. EVERY CONTRIBUTION HELPS!

Any amount raised over the goal will go towards printing more copies of the book that will also be distributed for free. 

WHAT YOU GET:
For contributions of $10 - an autographed copy of Being Truly Happy
For contributions of $25.00 - the above + four additional signed copies for you to give as gifts (makes a great stocking stuffer)
For contributions o $100.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy + an audio download of Prosperity Meditations by author Sue Bryan
For contributions of $175.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy, your audio download of Prosperity Meditations + a free Happiness Coaching Session by phone with author, Sue Bryan.
For contributions of $250.00 - your five signed copies of Being Truly Happy, your audio downloads + Author, Sue Bryan will take you out to lunch. If you are not in the Los Angeles area, we will have a picnic together via online conference call. 

Other Ways You Can Help
SPREAD HAPPINESS! I fully realize that not everyone has money laying around to donate to someone else's cause. I appreciate you even reading this far! 

Whether you contribute to this project or not, you can help spread happiness and help build that upward spiral of well being by endorsing this project and sending it out to your friends, family or network. You can also request additional copies of Being Truly Happy and for the cost of shipping to your location, you can have copies of the book to give out in your community. See my website to find out how.

story:
Story of My Book + IMEA: Making Pivotal Moments

My name is Mia Lee and I am the author of IMEA: Making Pivotal Moments. I wrote this book because I found that there wasn’t a lot of resources for women looking to go into creative fields, becoming their own boss, and for women wanting to find change for themselves when they enter the unknown. Going into a big risk is always something scary and challenging, but with this book, I hope to change that perspective within women to know that they have an army of experts who will guide them on their journey.

IMEA: Making Pivotal Moments is about utilizing your skills and leveling up your career. It’s a spectrum of self improvement, motivation, and empowerment to be your best self within any part of your career path whether it’s going in for your first interview or starting your own company empire.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover ways to level up your career game and savvy techniques to stand out by being authentically yourself throughout the process. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for fashion, entrepreneurship, and self-motivation. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you gain perspective of each event in life and turn it into an opportunity for success.

In this book, you'll learn about being the main character in your story and learning the IMEA way of being inspired, motivated, empowered, and authentic in everything you do. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Pivoting your mindset
  • Starting your own business from real business owners
  • Being able to bounce back from setbacks

You will love this book if you want to be the change in the world, if you want to grow, and if you want to be your own business owner.

The book is written in three parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. I believe that every part whether it’s the success or failures is all part of a bigger plan towards your journey. This section dives into the initial understanding of the pivotal mindset and gaining understanding of your why.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-9. The next part goes into deeper topic discussions such as allyship (supporting + practicing diversity and inclusion) within the workplace and the big pivot the world conquered through COVID-19.

Part 3 contains chapters 10-15. The final stretch of this section will go into stories and tips from people in the workforce and people who have successful businesses.
 

What We Need & What You Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [April, 2021].
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring in 2021

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • A.......Wildcard surprise!!!
  • And much more!

About the Author 

Mia Lee is a journalist and fashion enthusiast of her generation seeking authenticity within her works that speak volumes to her creativity. With an undergraduate degree in Fashion Entrepreneurship and Journalism with a minor in Photography, she is taking the world by storm and making it her mission to create a supporting, loving community for women across the world.

Mia wrote this book to guide women into becoming confident leaders of...not the future....but for the present. She dedicated this publication to her grandfather who escaped the Korean War and sought out for the American Dream.

Mia is known as the mom of the group who is all about motivating other people in their pursuits. With a positive can-do attitude, she is known to be making vision boards, doing food photography projects, and writing about fashion + lifestyle topics in her free time.

For more information, you can connect with Mia Lee at mialee4114@gmail.com and at @itsmialee for Instagram and LinkedIn.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IMEA and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! I truly appreciate you all so much!

Thanks again,
Mia <3

story:
Story Of My Book

The Mafia Princess is about a mafia princess, Angelica Ferrari, who struggles through her life in the mafia, trying not to be seen as the “typical” princess type. Throughout the story, she evolves from someone who is seen as a chess piece to be moved, to someone who kicks butt and takes names. Her character is all about redefining what people think the role of a princess should be.

My name is Khadijah L. Wynter and I am the author of The Mafia Princess. I wrote this book to showcase a strong female protagonist that doesn’t need anyone to save her and actively goes against the traditional “princess” role. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a strong, relatable character. You will see that not all princesses follow the typical “Disney-style” mold that says they need someone — usually a man — to save them. A real princess takes control of her own story.

Take a glimpse into Angelia Ferrari’s world as she tells you exactly how it is:

“In the Mafia lifestyle, you never know when your last day alive will be. Walking down the street with your guard down can lead to you on the side of the road choking on your own blood. Usually over something your employer did, and your murderer will kill you just to send them a message. Betraying the wrong family can lead to one bullet to the head and two to the chest if you are lucky. If you’re not lucky, well, you could spend the last few days of your life stuck in a basement being tortured just for your limbs to be sent to your family piece by piece, with your family hoping they have all the pieces of your body before the day of your funeral. Such are the risks you take in our business. While the men are praised for their heroics, the women are forced to shut up, look pretty, and shop like the airheads their husbands want them to be. Being trained to pull the trigger as a woman is relatively unheard of. This leads to Mafia wives and daughters — ‘princesses’ — being utterly defenseless. That’s not the life I wanted to live, my destiny is bigger than this.

“I, Angelica Ferrari, was destined to be more. I won’t let the barriers my father think I should abide by keep me down. I don’t abide by the rules these old-timers set for me. Nor should I take the abuse my father is determined to dish out to have me stay compliant to him. I clutch my gun and sheath my blades every morning before leaving my loft. I may be a princess, but I’m not a Disney princess. As far as I’m concerned, a real princess gets off her ass and gets shit done. I’ve done tons of jobs with the benefit of my family in mind. I’ve never needed some man to swoop in and save me like a damsel in distress and I find no need to have one now. 

“But when my father’s loyalty and intentions comes into question, and my brother Leonardo turns up missing, the only person I can possibly turn to is a guy from another Mafia family: Cristian Salvatore, the heir to the Salvatore throne. But when Cristian finds himself in a sticky situation, it looks like the only person to rescue the men that I need the most is me. You know what they say, real women kick ass.”

You will love this book if you enjoy modern stories about the mafia, strong female protagonists, and narratives that reject traditional stereotypes. The Mafia Princess speaks to women and a young adult audience who value a strong female protagonist with agency, and want to see more stories that challenge the “damsel in distress” narrative you typically see in princess stories — they want to see a princess who rescues herself!

Ultimately, I hope that The Mafia Princess inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions and statements like:

Why do traditional princess narratives position the princess waiting to be saved, as if she doesn’t have agency otherwise?

Can the definition of a “princess” be flexible and go against tradition? 

How do you become your own hero and not rely on someone else?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the dynamics of the princess narrative and becoming your own hero will change us all for the better. 

The Book - The Mafia Princess

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. Readers are introduced to the main character, Angelica Ferrari, and are shown a glimpse of the current situation she finds herself in. It also introduces the secondary character, Cristian Salvatore, and his notorious family as well. 

Part 2 contains chapters 3-10. Here the reader is given a taste of Angelica’s determination to write her own story and be her own hero. Of course, nothing comes easy, so we watch the internal and external battle that Angelica has to go through to be who she is determined to be. Also, how Angelica reacts when on the verge of losing everything and everyone she loves.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-Epilogue. These chapters brings Angelica’s story to a close and show us the decision she makes after all that’s happened. Will she choose the family she was born into, or the new found family she has found along the way?
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover photo.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Khadijah L. Wynter is a writer who loves pushing social norms in the stories she creates. Her parents describe her as passionate, challenging, curious, and outgoing. 

Khadijah always thought there was a lack of “strong female lead” stories, and that most of them had this character needing to be rescued by a man; only after she is rescued, too, is the story put back on track and comes to a nearly satisfying ending. Khadijah’s niece asked her one day, “Why does the princess always have to be rescued?” With that in mind, Khadijah wanted to create a story where the female lead does not need to be rescued by a male secondary character. Instead, she ends up being the one to do the rescuing herself. 

When Khadijah isn’t writing, she loves reading, archery, baking, and spending time with her family and friends. 

For more information, you can connect with Khadijah L. Wynter at Khadijahwynterwriting@yahoo.com and on Instagram @_khadijahwynerauthor.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheMafiaPrincess? or #TheMafiaPrincessBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Khadijah L. Wynter

story:
Short Summary

Giresun Island is a Science Fiction novel about a young soldier whose family is killed in the eternal conflict between Kurds and their neighbors. After the decimation of her village, the woman drifts into the desert, to emerge years later stripped to the core of herself. She ends up starting a new life in a burgeoning island nation, only to have it threatened by the same greed and violence all over again.

My name is John McKeel, and I am the author of Giresun Island. I wrote this book because of my admiration for the power and strength of women, the experience of war, homecoming, and second chances. 

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover that the differences between people—men, women, one nationality or another—are less significant than advertised. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape into a world a little further along than ours and engage in how we interact with our own.

Giresun Island lies a few hundred miles off the Pacific coast of South America. It mysteriously appeared 150 years ago, to be colonized by women and outcasts the world over. They turned a barren island into a tropical paradise, teeming with technological resources where one can become anything they choose. On the mainland, another attempt at the unification of South American countries is led by the son of a deposed drug cartel czar. The best intentions lead the young prince down the road of power, into a confrontation with the matriarchy of Giresun. Caught in the middle of the conflict,the young Kurdish immigrant is left not knowing who to trust.

You will love this book if you are, or know, a veteran, if you like action-adventure science fiction, or are looking for a different discussion on how our environments shape us.

Giresun Island speaks to women and veterans who want to address toxic masculinity and rebirth in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Giresun Island inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

• If I lost everything, what would I do next?
• Would changing environments allow us to transform ourselves?
• How can we make small changes to better provide equity between all people? 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe by discussing the conflict between toxic masculinity and feminine power, the experiences veterans face returning to the rest of society, providing room for second chances, and how we can help each other be the best versions of ourselves will change us all for the better.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

• The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

• The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

• The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

• The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

• The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

• You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

• And much more!

About the Author

John McKeel is a Registered Nurse in Hawaii. He specializes in wound care and is a Family Nurse Practitioner student with Saint Joseph’s College of Maine. He has additional science degrees in Psychology and Engineering. John served in the U.S. Army as a Signals Intelligence Analyst. He wanted to reframe the traditionally male-dominated soldier returning from war allegory as a woman’s journey because of his passion for feminist theory. John lives as he writes—in respect and admiration for the strong women in his life, and hopefully through this book inspiring more women like them. When he’s not spending time in alternate realities, John is an avid SCUBA diver and cook. He lives with his wife, two children, and two cats in Oahu, Hawaii. 

For more information, you can connect with John McKeel at johnmmckeel@gmail.com and on Instagram at @johnmckeel_author 
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GiresunIslandBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via IndieGoGo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

John
