Hello, my name is Jordin Crow.  I am a Freshman at Arkansas State University and a member of Central Baptist Church in Jonesboro, AR.  Before college, I was raised by my wonderful parents and church in Hope, AR.  
Why Canada
I have been in multiple Mission Projects before this year, but they were all in my price range.  Because the cost for the Canada Mission Project is so high, I hesitated to sign up.  A day after the deadline, a friend talked to me and told me that he is raising about $6,000 to go to China.  He stated that he has total faith in God that He will provide.  He also said that the college years are the best years to be in a Mission Project because of the flexibility.
Very soon after talking to him, I got a text from a member of CBC stating they have one more spot open for someone to go and immediately, I said I will. I truly believe that God wants me to go on this project.
Calgary is the fastest growing city in Canada with the youngest population. Over 100,000 are university students, most of whom do not know Christ. There are few evangelical churches in the city and there is a need to start urban churches that would reach young adults, among others. 
In Canada
The mission of this team will be to help the Church Planting Catalyst for Alberta determine opportunities to plant churches to reach young adults in the universities and downtown Calgary. The team will be at SAIT, University of Calgary, Bow Valley College and University of Alberta (downtown Calgary campus) sharing Christ, prayer walking, doing spiritual surveys, praying with people and meeting persons of peace. 
Our team would be the first team to scout the city of Calgary in recent years. We are expecting God to open doors, minds and hearts to the gospel! Our team will lay the foundation for many mission groups and church planters from different churches who will come and build on our efforts.
There will also be a day where the team will go snow skiing.
The Impact
This project is very important to me for two reasons: To see other college students come to know our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, and to grow in Christ and come to love Him more and more as I serve him missionaly.
Your contributions will greatly impact the peoples' lives in Canada.  Through giving, you will be a part of something far greater than just me or CBC.  You will be a part of advancing the Kingdom of God and seeing lives come to know and love Jesus.  
 


The Goal & What You Get
My goal is $900.  With giving you will receive a letter via email March 25th showing all the results with pictures.  Soon after that, you will recive a video about the trip made by yours truly! Most importantly, I truly believe God will bless you for your generous gift.  (Philippians 4:14-20)
I have made a bank acount that holds all the money given to me for my mission funds.  Your money will go straight to that account.  I will personaly write down all the records of the acount.  If the money goes over the goal, I will save that money for future Mission Projects.
This website charges a 4% fee if I make the goal and 9% if I don't.  You will not be charged for it, only I will. 
You have my word that I will use the money strictly for Missions.


 
Pray, Pray, Pray
Even if you can't give, I ask you to pray and to put this mission trip on the top of your prayer list.  Pray for me, pray for the team, pray for Calgary, Canada, pray for the people there, pray for the church plants, and pray for souls to be saved and people to know and love the God we love.  Prayer is very very powerful!  So above all, I ask you to pray!
Thank you very much for your time and support!  I thank God for this opportunity that I have and may he bless you!

story:
About the Author:

My entire life I've been told I had an indelible gift: writing. From a young age I started wielding the most intricate details to stories in my head. Also, I was an exceptional liar. I mean, really, I was. In high school I took multiple creative writing classes, and in college it was no different. Writing became as simple as you and I taking our next breath. 

But life, as it does, takes its toll on you. I started growing up and divorced Peter Pan. Life just started happening without me being able to slow it down. My father suffered a debilitating stroke, my family grew larger with weddings and kids, my focus suddenly became on ... being a responsible adult. 

My writing took the back burner, and it upset me every day. It's a tough thing for a writer to get back into the groove after so many weird things start happening around them. It's just kind of ... what's the point? I used to write because I was happy but the happiness started fading when the real world started washing up on my imagination shores. 

I was so desperate to get that good vibe back ... 

About Alabama Sons:

About 6 months ago I woke up from a nap (like ya do) and wrote down my dream in a journal - not unlike any other sequence of me waking up from a dream. Except ... I couldn't get this one out of my head. 

Penny and Jackson, as well as the other characters, stuck in my head for days. One day at work (sorry bossman) I zoned out - and zoned in - and wrote the first chapter of Alabama Sons. I came home that night and wrote until almost 4am (at almost 30 years old on a work night this was a great feat). 

Friends and family started reading it and commending me for it's harsh truths and honest realities. I could write the emotion, I could wield the lines, and I worked everyday to make my dream unfold. 

This story will inspire you, I hope - or make you hate me. Either way. It's a story that was crafted after years of my own inspiration being stifled by adulthood and at the end of this journey I can honestly say - I can't believe I waited this long.

The Synopsis: 

Penny Wilmot leads a simple life. Together with her widowed father and best friend Boone they run a small U-Pick farm. She never asked for much, and certainly wasn't looking for him...

Jackson Hawkes lives his life at one steady speed: fast. On a mission to find his father, he takes a road trip and ends up finding himself with a new band, a new job and a new dream.

The two meet by accident and begin a romantic adventure in the summer heat of Alabama. But what happens when the pair find out that they have the one thing in common that took their whole worlds away from them?

Death. 


It takes things away, but can it bring the two together? Join Penny and her sons of Alabama in a turbulent journey of love and loss...


The Sons Trilogy:

While I was writing Alabama Sons the ideas for two additional books came to me. Not necessarily extensions of the first since they won't be featuring the same main characters, but they will be part of the same story in the sense that you get to see the other characters stories and how they ended up in our original story (Think movies like ... Run Lola Run, or Amores Perros). 

Any additional funds collected in this campaign is going to be put towards the publication of the next two books in this amazing series! 


The Campaign:

I love my job (hello again bossman) but it doesn't really allow me the luxury to afford things like a top-notch editor, a virtual book tour, or even purchasing my own books for resale. 

So...I need a little help! 

The campaign was the idea of a few friends of mine, since I have too much pride to ask my parents for money (don't even pretend you can't relate!). It's mainly for the two next steps WHICH HAPPEN TO BE THE BIGGEST! (I'm shouting in joy - I promise.) Editing and the virtual book tour(s). 

Editors cost money - but they're worth it. I'm sure you've seen plenty of mistakes here. Imagine 75,000 words ... The quotes are high, but I don't want to sacrifice this step. I simply can't. I want to put out the best product I possibly can! I wouldn't feel right about spending the last 6 months on this book and not giving it the proper shine-up it deserves. I mean ... I don't have kids, but I imagine it's like throwing your firstborn into a shark tank and praying they make it out alive. Nahhht gonna happen!

Virtual book tours cost money - but they're worth it. Imagine that you've just bought a prized pony (weirdo) and you spent a small fortune on him/her. Now what? Well, naturally you want to show him off! Thus, a virtual book tour. These tours are typically staggered in a month - to - month basis. Example the book release is scheduled (with your help) for a January release. This means for the months of January, February, and March the book will be reviewed and featured on 20+ book blogs per month. If you know nothing of blogs - this is HUGE - it means the book will have an estimated reach of over 10,000 people in the first few months. This isn't about sales, it's about total reach. I want nothing more than for a few people out of those 10,000 to see the book, grab the book, read the book, and then be able to find me to say that they were moved by the story. GAH! It's a writers DREAM!


An Author's Asset:

If you cannot contribute to the campaign, that's ok, I understand!!! But if you could spread the word about the book or me I'd love you the most! Here's some links I would be indebted if you shared:

  • www.eawhitehead.com
  • www.facebook.com/eawhitehead
  • https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/18161513-alabama-sons 
  • www.twitter.com/ea_whitehead 

I cannot thank you enough for your time and contribution. I hope you've been inspired to start a new project of your own - the joy it brings you is irreplaceable!

story:
Unda Vosari: Legends

 

Friends, family and acquaintances, I need your help. I need your help to make Unda Vosari: Legends a success.

This is not the kind of thing I enjoy writing and I dislike having to do so in any capacity.

I love being an author. Ever since I sat down and started toying with the idea of writing a novel about pirates, I fell in love with every aspect of Unda Vosari. The characters, the story, the setting and every other facet the Unda Vosari series is something I've enjoyed pouring my heart and soul into. There's very little I would change about Unda Vosari and there is nothing more that I would like than to keep writing. I want to tell an epic story about the world of Unda Vosari and every person in it, from kings and queens to pirates and merchants.

A lot of people have enjoyed hearing about me talk about what I've written and what goes into it and the ideas I've had. People have talked to me about what they liked, what they didn't like, how they enjoyed watching the characters evolve and the story grow. I've seen people boggle at how I've managed to create a half-dozen unique stories that run concurrently and weave into and out of each other and want to learn more, see exactly what the Unda Vosari series can grow into.

Right now, though, I'm facing a harsh decision and it's one I can't really make on my own.

Unda Vosari: Legends is good. I dare say it's potentially on the cusp of great, and I know it can be better. I want to be able to take what I've written to a professional editor that will look at every aspect of the novel, from the pace, flow and scope of the story down to spell-checking and proof-reading. They'll take what I've written and make it better. After that, I want to be able to take it to a professional marketing company and see to it that this polished work of art is put it where it's accessible to people who would enjoy reading not only the first novel but future novels as well. I want to be able to hold a book that's been reviewed by newspapers and magazines and say "This newspaper thinks my book is great and they recommend it to everyone" or "This fantasy periodical has endorsed my novel as a great book to read."

I need support to make all of this happen and bring a new series with an exciting, edgy and adventurous story to the literary world. What I need is a chance to push this series above and beyond what it's at right now. What I've done so far is only the beginning. People have only seen the bare bones of an entire series of novels I want to publish, and I have every desire to see it through to the very end, but I can't do it without your help.

I want to do all of that and more, but I can't do it myself.

I've spent years writing and rewriting and polishing and pushing myself to keep at it, because it's something I believe in. I want everybody else to believe in me too, which is why I'm asking for your help in bringing this novel to the world as something we can all be proud of. Every single person who donates to the project at $15 or more will have their name in the book with my own personal thank you. You will be immortalized as the ones who brought the first novel to the world and helped the beginning of an epic story I desperately want to see pushed to the end. I'm asking you, please... Pledge, share and let everyone know that there is a new fantasy series coming that you want to see succeed.

Without your support, I'm not going to be able to show the world what an epic series Unda Vosari can be.

Please go to this page and please share this post. Thank you to everybody for doing everything you can to help me continue doing the one thing I truly feel passionate about.

What This Is

Unda Vosari: Legends is the first novel I've written that I had been working on since 2007. Fantasy authors are in no short demand, so publishers are rather selective with whom they agree to publish. One novel has already been finished but gathering the funds for an editor, as well as promotional and printing costs, is far more than my meager pocketbook can sustain.

 

What I Need & What You Get

What this project is for is this:

  • Finding and hiring an editor for content and line editing.
  • Making sure the book is published with quality materials.
  • Most importantly, making sure that the book is publicized and distributed to a wide enough market that people that will enjoy the series have a chance to *find* the series.
  • Anyone and everyone that donates will certainly be able to contact me to find out how the process is going. Additionally, I am always interested in discussing the series (from character development to the setting to everything else that's part of the series).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please, get the word out and make some noise!
  • Even if you can't donate, that doesn't mean you can't urge me on. I'm always glad to get constructive criticism and have ample time on my hands between bursts of creativity.
